loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem lives in a small city called Kasur. It is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its leather industry. She is living in the area of Basti Baraat Shah, where she moved 20 years ago.  

She is a 53-year-old who has given birth to two sons. She couldn’t educate her children due to financial constraints. Now both of them do work. Her eldest son has a bike-rental business and he also operates a grocery shop in the market. Her youngest son works in a factory on a monthly salary.
  
Naseem is married to A. R., who works in a vegetable market. He has a vegetable shop from where he sells seasonal vegetables to earn a profit.  

At the age of 53, Naseem is not in a position to work full-time to earn but she helps her son in his grocery shop business. She operates his shop in his absence but mainly she stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  

She has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her son in expanding his grocery store business. With the loan investment, he will buy grocery items to sell through his shop.  

Naseem is hopeful that her son will be able to increase his income by making positive use of the loan money. She is an Asasah regular loan user and is in her second loan cycle. In her previous loan year, she paid all the installments on time and built a good credit record. 

Note: In this photo, she is seated with her son, for whom she acquired a loan.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 62 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo Oswaldo de 40 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Junto a su hijo, Juana trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra papa, alfalfa y arveja, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 44 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito la ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Juana is 62 years old. She is a woman that has always worked hard to advance in life. She lives in her own home together with her son Oswaldo, 40 years old. What she wants most is to have a comfortable old age. Together with her son she works the fields every day. With a great deal of effort she has managed to keep her fields productive. She cultivates all kinds of things now, taking pride that every product will be of the highest quality. Her principal plantation is potatoes, alfalfa, and sweet peas. These are the products that sell best in the markets. Her favorite part of the work is warding her plantations for insects that may harm them. She has 44 years experience in the field. The most difficult part is having to transport the harvest all the way to the wholesale markets in Tarma, where she sells her products. In the future she hopes to purchase more land to increase her production. This is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she sees this loan as a great help in the development of her business. She is a very responsible and proud member in her community bank. With the two thousand nuevos soles she requests she will purchase fertilizer to improve the productivity of her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe E. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old and married. To make a living, Cleofe owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Cleofe works hard because she wants her farm to be productive.
Cleofe joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cleofe is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make a separate room for a weaving shop.

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar T. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhoshuu of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children attend university while his wife helps him with the business.

Enhbayar owns and operates his own wooden products business, specializing in home kitchen furniture. He started his business in 2003 by making a variety of wooden products alone in his home. Over the many years of business, he has managed to expand his business and hire two more employees. His wife sells those products in a rented stall at the Narantuul, the largest market in Ulaanbaatar. He would like to increase his sales so that he can afford to build a house by the end of next year with his business profits. For the future, he plans to establish his own furniture making center in his yard after building a big house. Enhbayar is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials.

loans.use: To purchase more materials.

loans.name: Filadelfa

texts.en:
Filadelfa G. is from Molicay, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old. Filadelfa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Filadelfa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from cultivating orchids for sale. Filadelfa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Filadelfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Filadelfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Filadelfa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Filadelfa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lourdes Yaquelin

texts.es:
la sra. Lourdes Yaquelin E. O. tiene 44 años de edad y vive en la aldea Lazaro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Lourdes se dedica a la produccion y venta de pan casero como ser rosquillas, quesadilla y torta. su especialidad son las tortas de queso.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus sabrosos panes, tiene muchos clientes fijos todos los dias ya que su producto es de muy buena calidad, sabor e higiene.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a a su familia.
texts.en:
Lourdes Yaquelin E. O. is 44 years of age and lives in the Lazaro neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. 

Lourdes earns a living making and selling homemade pastries such as doughnuts, sweet cheese pound cake and cakes. Her specialty is the cheese cake.

She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for making her delicious pastries. She has many regular customers who visit every day since her product is of very high quality, flavor and hygiene. 

She needs the earnings to get her family ahead.

loans.use: To purchase corn, yeast, wheat flour, cheese, lard, margarine, eggs, soda and sugar

loans.name: Tajiri Ene

texts.en:
Tajiri Ene has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 25 years old, married to Musa Kshao, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy 10 goats, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Tajiri hopes to start selling curios, targeting tourists who frequently visit Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats to rear and sell

loans.name: Fredie

texts.en:
Fredie P. is from the village of Benito, Soliven, Isabela. He is 32 years old. Fredie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fredie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Fredie has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Fredie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fredie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Fredie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fredie from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sam-Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-aun S. (shown in the photo) is 35 years old and her husband, Mr. Borom Pil, is 36 years old. They have been married since 1996 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives along national road number six about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sam-aun sells steamed corn. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to buy construction materials for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and to buy construction materials for her husband.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 37, is married to Anna and together they have two children aged six and ten. He does welding for the residents and business people of the Mukuyuni area. He has been running this business for five years. This is his second loan from KADET Ltd and he intends to use it to buy metal bars for his work.

With the profits from this loan, he hopes to take up big contracts and expand his trade. He also desires to build a better house for his family and give them a better life.

loans.use: To buy metal bars for welding work.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Comité San Miguel, se conformó en fecha 05 de marzo del 2010, gracias a la actual Directora de Finanzas, la Sra. Celia F., quien ya formó parte de otro grupo, al desintegrarse dicho grupo ella invitó a sus amigas y vecinas para la conformación del grupo, logrando juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 4º ciclo.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de  868.750 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de verduras y frutas, chipas (comida típica del país), etc.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
texts.en:
San Miguel Group was formed on March 5, 2010, thanks to its current Finance Director, Mrs Celia F., who was already a member of another group. When that group broke up, she invited her friends and neighbors to create a new group, getting together 16 women who are very comfortable working together. They are now in their fourth loan cycle.

The average loan per member amounts to 868,750 guaraníes and will be used to finance different activities, such as selling vegetables and fruits, chipas (a typical dish in Paraguay; it is a bread product made from corn flour and starch and baked in an oven heated by firewood), etc.

The group members participate actively in their weekly meetings and are grateful to the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya. They are all busy with income generating activities and help each other to reach their common goals.

loans.use: To buy bananas, apples, oranges, pineapples, peppers, onions, tomatoes, melons, grapefruits, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 35 años, es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ebert de 44 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Norma es una de las más visitadas en Kimiri, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo,  ya que no quiere causar problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Norma, 35, is a sincere, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Ebert, 44, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. 

Norma’s store is one of the most popular in Kimiri.  She opens very early in the morning to await her neighbors who come by to buy what they need.  She is a very cheerful, attentive seller since she always welcomes her customers with a smile and is always willing to help them with their purchases.

What she enjoys most about the work is chatting with her neighbors.  She’s been in business for two years and considers having to stay in the store without being able to go out to be the most difficult part of it.  In time she hopes to expand the store and fill it with more merchandise to offer her customers a better selection of goods.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she is willing to make all her payments on time because she does not want to cause her communal bank any problems where she is very well liked by the other members.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more products to better stock the store.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Mrs. Eleuteria, 51, is married and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City,  Misamis Occidental. When she learned about Paglaum MPC, she became a member in 2009 so that she could get help to set up her business. She used her first loan of PHP 3,000 to buy one piglet and this is how she started her hog-raising business.

She is grateful to God that her hog-raising business has done very well and she has buyers already. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and more piglets. She also wants to build a concrete piggery for her pigs.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy feed and more piglets

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman who lives in the island Palawan. She earns her living by selling fruits and vegetables. Her husband Cresencio, who is 56 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have eight children who are between 10 and 31 years old. 

Lilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for selling fruits and vegetables so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Lilia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 35 years old and married with two children.  One of her children is in school. Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products for the general store.

Lilibeth has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as rice, bread, and instant foods. 

In the future, Lilibeth would like to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for the general store

loans.name: Joram Boaragu

texts.en: Joram is 47 years, married to Alice Nyaboke and they have two children. He has operated his food stall in Naivasha town for the last 14 years. He was introduced to Kiva patner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 75,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy cooking fat, flour, cereals and sugar in bulk for his food stall. In the future, Joram hopes to develop his food stall into a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, flour, cereals and sugar in bulk for his food stall

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbors, school-going children, and passersby. Her greatest challenge in the business is competition from other restaurant operators. She dreams of becoming self-reliant and satisfying her customers' needs in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting, she wants to stock wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to stock wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and beans

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 48 years old, married and lives with five family members. Two of the family members work.

Wahida has cows producing milk so she has been selling dairy products since 1990. She has good experience breeding animals and has a good reputation. She is well known in her area.

She is requesting $1800 to buy a cow to milk. She aspires to have a large barn and to increase the dairy products so she can gain more profits and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a cow to milk.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a 57-year-old farmer who lives in the town of Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has six children.

Gilda primarily grows rice to sell. She works hard to keep her crops healthy. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Gilda hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Heleine

texts.en:
Heleine is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of three children.  She lives in Tyre.  Heleine has manufactured perfume for eight years and, in 2007, opened her own shop.  Her shop has a very good reputation in her region.  All of her customers recommend her products because they have experienced them.

Heleine requests a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to buy new scents so that she can make her own perfume blends.  This is Heleine's third loan cycle with A. Majmoua.  The previous loans have helped her to achieve most of her goals and she hopes to improve even more.

loans.use: To buy new scents to make her own perfume blends

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Jardinier de profession, Kossi est un jeune homme de 36ans qui aime les fleurs. Il a un joli jardin dans lequel on retrouve tous les espèces de fleurs qui peuvent orner une maison. Il fait son approvisionnement à Lomé et à Accra. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des jeunes plants, du fumier et autre. Il a commencé en 1997 et est marié à une revendeuse.Deux personnes l'aident.
texts.en: A professional gardener, Kossi is a young man of 36 who loves flowers. He has a beautiful garden in which you can find all the sorts of flowers that can be used to decorate a home. He buys his supplies in Lomé and in Accra. He is requesting this loan to buy young plants, manure and so on. He began in 1997 and he is married to a small-scale retailer. Two people help him.

loans.use: to buy young plants and manure.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco, 48, lives in the rural village of San Antonio. He is a simple man who lives in his own house with his wife. They have been married for 25 years but lived together for 12 years before tying the knot. They have two wonderful children. Francisco began growing rice and corn 25 years ago and puts into practice everything he learned from his parents. He plants and harvests rice and corn twice a year.

What he enjoys most about his work is taking care of his crops because he feels like he has done a good job each harvest time when he goes to sell the rice and corn in town. He has two carabaos that he uses to plow the fields. He plows for others who pay him extra money, around PHP 180 per day. He is now preparing to plant the rice and corn and he is hoping to get good results. He is requesting a loan of PHP 29,000. The loan will be used to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer to begin planting his rice and corn.

He hopes to have good earnings from this in order to improve his farm. He also wants to find technology to be more efficient and to improve the conditions of his home and farm. He wants to continue planting crops in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: 18 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “18 DE SEPTIEMBRE” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maritsa, que en la fotografia es la vestida de guindo. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de abarrotes, peluquería, carnicería, venta de ropa, taller, tienda.

La señora Maritsa  indica que esta hace catorce años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por institución una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de carne que viene trabajando hace 36 años que aprendio de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de carne), las que comprará de la ceja de El Alto y lo comercializará en su tienda de la zona Horizontes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra en la señora Benigna ya que por cultura no quizo sacarse fotografía.
texts.en:
The “18 de Septiembre” communal bank will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing board headed by Maritsa who is wearing maroon in the photo.  The communal bank members are engaged in a variety of businesses.  Among them are: grocery store, barber shop, butcher shop, clothing sales, workshop and store.

Maritsa indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for 14 years having joined thanks to a promoter.  Currently, she has a butcher shop that she’s been running for 36 years; she learned from her family.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital (meat purchase).  She will buy it in La Ceja in El Alto and will sell it in her store in the Horizontes zone.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family as best she can because she’s married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health services.

Benigna did not want to have her picture taken because of cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose has four children, all of whom are in school. She is married. She has been a charcoal seller for two years now. Rose took a loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal to sell, with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit for building and paying school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Pomamaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POMAMAYA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Felisa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, servicios y negocio

La señora Felisa,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche el cual aprendió de sus padres.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de alimentos para sus animales, ya que con la crianza de los mismos negocia la venta de leche en las fabricas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene diez hijos.
texts.en:
The “Pomamaya” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Felisa.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of business activities such as: commerce, services and business.

Felisa indicates that this is the first time they’ve worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from a promoter in the area.  At present, she has a business selling milk that she learned from her parents.

The loan she requests is to buy feed for her animals because with their development she negotiates the milk sales with firms.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family because she’s married and has ten children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La señora Rita tiene la edad de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto año de primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Bulmaro que trabaja de operador de maquinas, ellos tiene 3 hijos que se ya se encuentra casados, ella y su familia viven en una region que se  caracterisa por ser una zona cañera.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace 3 años tal vez un poco mas decidio inicar con su propio negocio de venta de ropa pues queria apoyar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña Rita realiza sus ventas de ropa casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella nos  dice que algunas veces levanta pedidos, cuando  los surte los entrega a sus clientes y recibe el pago por sus productos,ella nos dice   que cuida a sus clientes y les da un trato amable ya que  asi aumentaran dia a dia sus ventas..

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de ropa interior para dama y caballero, vestidos, blusas, faldas, playeras, calcetines, shorts, camisas, pantalones para su posterior venta.

Doña Rita espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere, tambien nos platico que se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por la confianza que a brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Rita is 54 years old and has a 4th grade education.  She is married to Señor Bulmaro who works as a machine operator.  They have 3 children that are married.  She and her family live in a region known as Zona Cañera.  

She tells us that a little more than 3 years ago she decided to start her own business selling clothing because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and to be able to have a better quality of life.  

Doña Rita sells her clothing door to door to her friends and neighbors in her community.  She says that she takes care of her customers and gives them friendly service since this is how she increases her sales every day. 

She needs this loan to buy undergarments for men and women, dresses, blouses, skirts, t-shirts, socks, shorts, shirts, and pants for subsequent sales.  Doña Rita hopes that with this investment her business will prosper.  

She also tells us that she is very grateful to Fundación for the trust they have placed in her.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Santísima Trinidad Group

texts.es:
El comité Santísima Trinidad nace con la firme intención de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus integrantes, ellas se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras y con visión. Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación. El grupo está integrado actualmente por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción.
una de las miembros es la señora Cristina, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas, ya sea de sport, de vestir y demás. Gracias a su trabajo ella puede obtener los medios necesarios para enfrentar los gastos diarios de la casa. Tiene como objetivo seguir creciendo y convertirse en una gran comerciante. Dice que todo lo que ella hace es por darle a su familia lo mejor.
Ella pide es crédito para poder abastecerse con más prendas y de esa forma hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene, pues no desea defraudar a sus clientes. Está esperanzada en crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The 'Santísima Trinidad' committee was born with the firm intention of improving the quality of life of its members who describe themselves as very hard-working, entrepreneurial women with vision.  They long for a better future for their children and, for this reason, they work doubly hard in order to provide them with the materials they need for their development and education.  The group currently has thirteen members (all women) from the city of Asunción.

One of the members of this group is Cristina who sells clothes (sports clothes, dress clothes and others).  Thanks to her work, she is able to make the income she needs to cover her household's daily expenses.  Her goal is to continue growing and become an important saleswoman.  She says that everything she does is done so that she can provide her family with the best.

Cristina is requesting a loan to stock her business with more clothes.  This will enable her to fill the orders that she has as she doesn't want to let down her customers.  She is hopeful about this loan as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, tiene 36 años, es soltero, tiene un hijo que esta viviendo con el, vino de Asunción para trabajar en una empresa de esta ciudad, de ahí paso a abrir su propia empresa.
El tiene un local donde se dedica a la colocación y venta de parabrisas. Comenta que su negocio le genera muy buenos ingresos y que gracias a esto puede mantenerse y mantener los gastos de la casa y también a su hijo. Dice que su negocio tiene mucho éxito y que eso le genera un poco mas de ingresos, por lo cual le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en el, para que de esa forma vaya creciendo mas y mas en el mercado.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas, el cual es el elemento esencial de su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Juan, 36 years old, is single. He has one son who is living with him. He came from Asunción to work in a business from that city, and from there he opened his own business.

He has a shop where he installs and sells windshields. He says that his business generates very good profits for him, and that thanks to this he can support himself, pay the household expenses, and support his son. He says that his business is very successful and it generates a bit of profit for him. For this reason he would like to continue investing in it, so that it may grow more and more in the market.

He is asking for the loan to purchase windshields, the essential element of his business. He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it is giving him.

loans.use: to purchase windshields to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William has been a businessman operating a retail shop for the past fifteen years. He is 49 years old, married, and supports ten people in his family.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by the KADET staff. He has applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase more stock like maize flour, wheat flour, and salt.

He hopes to make a profit and invest the income by expanding his business to a wholesale business. He is a hardworking man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like maize flour, wheat flour, and salt.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en: Evanson is 53 years old and married with five children.  He has operated the business for seven years and has employed one person. He also does farming to earn extra income. Previously, he owned a cafeteria.  Since he joined a group in Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business. Evanson hopes to expand his business in five years. He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of firewood.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Otgontsetseg is 28 years old and lives with her son, a student, in a ger ( Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Otgontsetseg operates photo studio, a business she started in 2003 by renting a workspace uptown. Well-experienced in her field, she is known as the one of the best in the province.

Now that she's operated the business for a long time, her equipment is getting old, reducing the quality of her photographs. Otgontsetseg is therefore requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy new equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment.

loans.name: Satarah  P

texts.en: Satarah is 23 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is single and has two children aged 3 and 8. They are in school and live at home. For the past two years she has been selling chicken, pig feet, and spare ribs in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, pig feet, and spare ribs for her business.  Her main challenge is freezer room (storage). She started her business with money given to her by her sister, and she learned this business from her mother. What she really likes about her business is the way customers buy. She hopes to attend college.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, pig feet, and spare ribs for her business

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 54 year old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 6 children between the ages of 25 and 10. 3 of them go to school. 

Mohamad runs a mixed food store business, and he has been in the business for 3 years. He has no employees. Mohamad heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase items like tomato paste, cooking oil, saltand other products. This is Mohamad's has only source of income. His major challenges include  competitors and the high cost of living in Juba.

In 5 years time, Mohamad would hopes to build his own shop. 

Mohamad says, "God bless the owners of Finance Sudan for this opportunity to happen in Sudan".

loans.use: to purchase items like tomato paste, cooking oil, salt and other products.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Leny has a shop that makes & sells snacks like cheese cakes & rice cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Leny has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fátima, es ama de casa, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, administra una granja de cerdos al interior de su vivienda, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, no tiene horario establecido y sus hijos le apoyan en algunas actividades para el mantenimiento de la granja.

Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para comprar de cerdos y concentrado, ya que quiere aumentar la granja y tener disponible la alimentación necesaria para engordarlos.
Ella quiere aumentar su negocio a través de la inversión préstamos, siendo puntual de sus pagos para continuar obteniendo este servicio.
texts.en:
Fátima is a housewife. She lives with her husband and her children. She runs a pig farm from her home, starting the business from her own initiative. She has no set hours and her children help her with some of the activities in up-keeping the farm.

Currently she is asking for a loan in order to buy pigs and food pellets as she wants to expand the farm and to have the necessary food on hand to fatten the pigs.

She wants to expand her business by using the money from the loans, and she feels that by making her loan payments on time she will continue to be able to use this service.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food pellets

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son 20 mujeres quienes tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante y ven una gran ayuda en el programa de la fundación paraguaya, es por ello que se unieron y de allí surge el grupo llamado el progreso, su deseo es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa y poder crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo social.ç
La sra. Irene  es vendedora de Artículos de Limpieza, tiene 3 hijos que van al colegio y tiene su pareja desde hace varios años, ambos trabajan y ayudan con los gastos de la casa. Comenta que su marido también la ayuda en la venta de los productos que vende, y de esa forma es un poco más ligero el trabajo. Su deseo es extenderse y tener más clientela y de esa forma tener un mejor ingreso para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los químicos que necesita para la elaboración de los productos de limpieza que vende, como ser: colorantes, esencias, bactericidas, soda caustica y demás insumos necesarios. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad de progreso que les da a ella y sus compañeras.
texts.en: This group is from the city of Villa Elisa; there are 20 women who are keen to move forward and see a great help in the Paraguayan Foundation program, which is why they joined and then emerged the group called progress.  Their desire is to reach the maximum level of the program and to grow not only economically, but also socially.  Mrs. Irene is selling cleaning Products, she has 3 children going to school and has a relationship for several years, both work and help with household expenses. She says her husband also helps in selling the products she sells, and thus it is a little lighter work. Her desire is to expand and have more customers and thus have a better income to continue to help her family. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of chemicals needed for the production of cleaning products they sell, such as: colors, scents, bactericides, caustic soda and other necessary inputs. Thanks to the foundation for this opportunity of progress that it gives her and her companions.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to make homemade cleaning products.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: La señora Luz Elena esta dedicada desde hace aproximadamente 15 años a la confección de prendas de vestir sobre medida y por encargo en un pequeño taller adecuado en su casa, trabaja en una jornada de todos los días desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido generar los ingresos necesarios para su sustento y el de sus padres. A sus 50 años, la señora Luz Elena desea de la compra de insumos tales como telas e hilos con los cuales pueda producir camisas de dama para vender a sus familiares y conocidos y poder mejorar sus ventas. El sueño de la señora Luz Elena es tener un taller de confección bien amplio en el cual pueda generar varios empleos directos.
texts.en:
Luz Elena has been making made-to-measure and custom clothing for approximately 15 years. She is 50 years old. She has a small, adequate workshop in her house, and works every day from 8:00am until 6:00pm. 

Thanks to this business, she has been able to generate the income necessary to support herself and her parents. Luz Elena wishes to buy supplies such as fabric and thread, to use for making women's shirts to sell to family members and to people she knows, and to be able to improve her sales. 

Luz Elena's dream is to have a really spacious dressmaking workshop, through which she can generate several direct jobs.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies, such as fabric, thread, and trimming.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru:
Аиде 27 лет, не  замужем, проживает с родителями в селе Петровка.
Аида родилась в Ошской области (юг страны)  в семье фермера и с малых лет вместе с родителями занималась выращиванием овощей,  фруктов, которые  они реализовывали на местном рынке, параллельно они содержали хозяйство: бычков на откорме, овец, коз, что являлось основным доходом в семье. 
Аида в 2001 году окончила среднюю школу, поступила учиться на швею, окончив учебу, два года проработала  в швейном цехе «Ак-Куу».  Со временем ее близкие родственники стали переезжать в Чуйскую область (северная часть). Причина переезда  связана с тем, что  в сельской местности, где они проживали, земельная доля выделенная на  одного члена семьи очень маленькая -  земельный надел  одной семьи составляет 6-10 соток, что не позволяет  получить планируемый урожай.  А сельскохозяйственный урожай  - это основной доход в сельской местности, производство и промышленность не развита.
В 2005 году семья Аиды переехала в Чуйскую область,  село Петровка, где проживают по настоящее время. Переехав  в новый край, семья испытала немало трудностей – проживая на съемной квартире, они занимались полеводством,  выращиванием арбузов, перца, помидоров. Через два года,  семья Аиды смогла купить себе дом. На сегодняшний день,  Аида занимается животноводством - содержит две коровы и  сдает молоко производителям молочной продукции, что приносит около 10,000 сом в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Аида обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Аида планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aida is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the village of Petrovka. She was born in the Osh region (south of Kyrgyzstan) in a farming family, and from the early years was involved in growing fruit and vegetables that were then sold at the local market. At the same time the family raised calves, sheep and goats for sale, and this constituted their main source of income.

In 2001, Aida graduated from hight school and began to study for a job as a seamstress. Upon completing her studies, she worked for two years in the "Ak-Kuu" sewing factory. Over time, her close relatives began relocating to the Chuisk region in the north of the country. This was caused by the fact that in the area where they had lived, very little land was allocated per family member - a family would have 6-10 hundredths of a hectare (roughly one quarter of an acre), which didn't allow to produce sufficient harvest. Meanwhile, agriculture was the main source of income in the countryside where manufacturing and industry were not developed.

In 2005, Aida's family moved to the village of Petrovka in the Chuisk region, where they live to this day. Having moved to this new location, the family experienced many difficulties - living in a rented apartment, they engaged in farming, cultivating watermelons, peppers and tomatoes. After two years, Aida's family could finally buy a house. Today, Aida is engaged in raising cattle - she keeps two cows and sells the milk to producers of dairy products, which brings her around 10,000 som per month. In order to expand her business, Aida has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase more cattle. Aida plans to use her revenues to repair the house.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Chantrea

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Bovel district, Chantrea is 32 years old and married with three children. She earns a living through farming rice and growing bean. To add up more income, her husband work as a paid worker. She can earn about KHR90,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR40,000 each day for the future needs. 
This is the first loan for Chantrea with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to feed her pigs to be fat and healthy so as to sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Amamatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Amamatou, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 38 ans est veuve, mère de deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Amamatou vit seule avec ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Amamatou. Amamatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, depuis quinze ans, Amamatou vend des tissus, des tisanes et de la farine d’igname par la technique de distribution. Amamatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Amamatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tisanes et de la farine d’igname.

loans.name: Wanyinan 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANYINAN 2 est composé de trois personnes qui fréquentent un même lieu de vente. Bossi Jeanne, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 37 ans est mariée à un couturier du nom de Maxime. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Bossi Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Bossi Jeanne a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour cette raison, Bossi Jeanne vend des fruits de saison à son domicile depuis douze ans. De façon secondaire, Bossi Jeanne vend aussi du maïs et de la farine de manioc. Bossi Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Bossi Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANYINAN 2 un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fruits et de la farine de manioc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline , is a 43-year old married woman  and has 5 dependents. She  makes kutchinta (a steamed rice cake but is made using lye, characteristically moist and chewy, and can range in color from reddish-brown to yellow or orange in coloration. It is typically topped with shredded coconut meat).
Her husband's occupation is a welder. 

She would like to boost her earnings and improve the her yield. But the only problem is the very limited funds to acquire those supplies.

Evangeline  has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients like flour, margarine, edible oil and sugar.  That is vital. She could able to prepare higher volume of kutchinta everyday.
 Thus, she could provide her family with nutritious meals and continue support their respective studies.

In the future, she is aiming to have a healthy family ,a sustainable livelihood and to be able to build her own bakery.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, margarine, edible oil and sugar

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi K., born on May 2, 1970 in Lomé, is a mechanic by training. He is still single. He abandoned his studies during high school and became an auto mechanic. He had trouble working because he did not have the financial means to open a garage. To earn his daily wages, he was forced to help a friend who has opened a small computer training centre. He quickly took interest in computing and initiated himself rapidly. This passion for computing led him to open his own multi service centre in Lomé in the Super Taco area. With his three previous loans obtained and repaid without incident, he has succeeded in opening his own computing and word processing centre with some secondhand equipment. However, in order to work with an increasing and insistent clientele, he needs to upgrade his computer equipment.

To achieve this, Mr. Komi K. is asking for a loan of $1200, which will serve to acquire a personal computer and to re-outfit his centre. Given the dedication he has shown and his ability to rigorously manage his business, this financial support will give him a second wind and will above all improve his performance and yield.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Komi, né le 2 Mai 1970 à Lomé est mécanicien de formation. Il est encore célibataire. Il abandonna les études au troisième degré et s’est formé en mécanique auto. Il eut du mal à exercer ce métier car il manque de moyens financiers pour ouvrir un garage. Pour gagner son pain quotidien, il est obligé d’aider un ami qui a ouvert un petit centre de formation en informatique. Il prit goût rapidement à l’informatique et s’initia très vite. Cette passion pour l’informatique le pousse à ouvrir son propre centre de multi service à Lomé dans le quartier Super Taco. Avec ses trois crédits obtenus et régulièrement remboursés, il est arrivé à ouvrir son propre centre informatique et de traitement de texte avec quelques matériels d’occasion. Mais, pour la qualité de ses prestations à une clientèle de plus exigeante, il y a donc nécessité de renouveler le matériel informatique. Pour ce faire, Monsieur K. Komi sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui servira à l’acquisition d’un micro-ordinateur et au réaménagement de son centre. Vu le dévouement dont il fait preuve et son aptitude à gérer son affaire avec rigueur, ce soutien financier lui donnera un second souffle et améliorera surtout ses prestations et son rendement.

loans.use: To buy a personal computer and to outfit an office

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy would like to buy 3 high grade dairy cows

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs.Suon S., 23-year-old mother of 1 child, lives with her husband (pictured here because S. is at a market) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells vegetables at the local market and typically makes around $5/day, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver and contributes his daily income to the household. S. hopes to use the loan to purchase more vegetables in order to fulfill and satisfy her clients' needs. In the future, she aims to own another stand so that she can increase her inventory and make additional income.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Mrs. Maryam L. Okeya is a business woman who sells fairly used clothes, and also has a hairdressing salon. She is 47 years old and is married with 7 children. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, and wishes to improve her business with the above loan.

loans.use: To buy fairly used clothes and weavon						cream and relaxer

loans.name: Rokiahon

texts.ru:
When she found out about MicroInvest, Rokiahon decided to takeout a loan to purchase fruits. Using the loan she purchased fresh grapes and pomegranates. This gave her the opportunity to earn a respectable profit. Rokiahon is 40 years old, is married and is raising 5 children. Profits from her business allow Rokiahon to cover most of the family’s expenses.

Rokiahon plans to take out a new loan for $1200 and to pay it back over 12 months. She will use the new loan to purchase grapes.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Узнав о Микроинвест, Рокияхон решила получить займ на закупку фруктов. На полученный займ она закупила свежий виноград и гранаты. Это дало возможность получить приличный доход. Рокияхон 40 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 5 детей. Доходы от бизнеса позволяют ей покрывать большинство семейных расходов. Рокияхон планирует получить новый займ в $1200 и погашать его в течении 12 месяцев. Новый займ она потратит на закупку винограда. .

loans.use: for expansion of business

loans.name: Melecia Bernardina

texts.es:
Surrounded by beautiful and tame cows on pasture land, doña Bernardina is carrying out her daily work herding the grazing cattle that belongs to an educational center in the district of Pukará. She has been dedicated to this occupation for the last five years and her dear husband. Timoteo, works as cleaning staff at the same center. Both work very hard to support and offer an adecuate education to their eight underage children as they wish to give each of them the opportunity of superior studies. Bernardina wishes to by a calf for breeding and reproduction of her own cattle and therefore she is asking for a loan which will be repaid in a period of eight months. Let us help this industrious mother make her dreams come true seeing her beloved children as profesionals and with a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

En medio de un pastizal, rodeado de hermosas y mansas vaquitas encontramos a doña Bernardina desempeñando su trabajo diario de pastar las vaquitas pertenecientes a un centro educativo del distrito de Pukará, oficio al que está dedicada hace más de cinco años del lugar en el que también trabaja como personal de limpieza su querido esposo , Timoteo.Ambos se esfuerzan arduamente para mantener y ofrecer una educación adecuada a sus ocho menores hijos, anhelando siempre brindarles a cada uno de ellos estudios superiores. En esta oportunidad Bernardina desea comprar una ternerita y así poco a poco dedicarse a la crianza y reproducción de sus propias vaquitas, para esto solicita un préstamo que rembolsará en un lapso de ocho meses. Ayudemos a esta madre trabajadora a concretar sus sueños de ver a sus queridos hijos profesionales y con un gran porvenir.

loans.use: Purchase a calf to start breeding cattle

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
History of the client: Valeriana makes blankets of fabric and wool. She works alone because her husband is a construction worker, and her kids are of school age. She lives in the area of Irpavi II in the city of La Paz, where she has her shop. Her objective is to have more capital so she can make more blankets.

This is the fourth time that she is requesting a loan and the second time that she is asking for Kiva's support. Her last loan was paid in full in December, which is why she is requesting a new one. Her history with our institution qualifies her as a 1-rated client, which means she has a good rating with paying back her loans. The amount requested will go towards the purchase of raw material (fabric, wool, and thread).

Her work and previous credits with Impro let her qualify to request another loan. Since she has a lot of experience in this business, the income she makes will let her pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Historia del Cliente: La señora Valeriana elabora mantas de tela y lana, trabaja sola ya que su esposo es albañil, sus hijos están en edad escolar. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, donde tiene su taller, su objetivo es contar con más capital y así poder elaborar mantas en cantidad.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en el mes de diciembre por lo cual solicitan un nuevo crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, lana e hilo)

Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, wool, and thread to make blankets

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is 42 years old and offers gardening and plumbing services, and at the same time rents out his taxi to third parties who work the vehicle on a daily basis. Mario lives with his wife, Paulina, they have a son and live in their own home located in the Cupesi 7 de julio neighborhood.

Mario offer his gardening and plumbing by home delivery, and owing to his experience in both lines of work, has a fixed clientele. He also has a station wagen which he rents to a driver who pays him for each day worked. This generates extra income for him. Mario is well-known for his excellent work and recommended by his customers.

The current loan request is for gasoline equipment for his vehicle and also to acquire other accesories. With this, Mario will be able to reduce his operating costs and increase his income. He has an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario es un señor de 42 años de edad que se dedica a ofrecer servicios de jardineria, plomeria y paralelamente renta su taxi a una tercera persona que trabaja con el vehículo a diario. Mario vive junto a su esposa la Sra. Paulina, esta pareja tiene un hijo y viven en su propio domicilio ubicado por el barrio Cupesi 7 de julio.

Mario ofrece los servicios de jardinería y plomería a domicilio, debido a su experiencia en ambos rubros cuenta con clientela fija, paralelamente cuenta con un vagoneta la cual la renta a un chofer que le paga por día trabajado, esto le genra ingresos extra. Mario es muy conocido por el excelente trabajo que desarrolla y es recomendado por sus clientes.

La presente solicitud es para el equipamiento de gas a su vagoneta y también para adquirir otros accesorios, con esta implementación Mario reducirá sus costos de operación y aumentará más sus ingresos. Tiene excelente antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Gasoline equipment for a vehicle and accesories

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is dedicated to the storage and care of fruit. She picks fruits that are then transported to the city of Santa Ana, Peru, and to the capital of her country. This work is very important and valuable because the act of selection also leads into the ripening process. Good picking helps to maintain the quality of the fruit and keep it tasty. Because this job takes great strength, it is very labor intensive, but it is also very costly due to the need to purchase boxes that will hold a large quantity of harvested fruit. For this reason the few boxes that Nancy owns are a great limitation. Nancy hopes to count on your collaboration in order to increase her production. She needs a loan that she will invest exclusively in the purchase of boxes and other materials to facilitate the transport of fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy, se dedica al depósito de frutas para seleccionarlas y ser luego trasportadas a las ciudad de Santa Ana y a la capital de su país. Este trabajo es muy importante y valioso porque al realizar la selección también se cumple el trabajo de maduración de los productos, esta actividad ayuda a mantenerlos bien cuidados y sobre todo muy apetitosos..Debido a que demanda mucho esfuerzo, esta labor es muy pesada pero también costosa por la compra de cajones para introducir en ellas la gran cantidad de frutas que cosechan, por esa razón los pocos cajones con los que cuenta es una gran limitación.Ella desea poder contar con su colaboración y lograr aumentar su producción para ello requiere de un préstamo que invertirá exclusivamente en la compra de cajones y demás materiales para facilitar sus traslado.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quanitity of boxes in order to facilitate the transport of fruit.

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Fatuma N.. She sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. Fatuma is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has five children ranging from age 10 to 30 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 210000 in profits and with the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to pay the children's school fees and cover her home needs. Fatuma took a UGX 250000 loan from BRAC Uganda before to add capital to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Aidah N., Rose B., and Mariam K.. Aidah is a poultry farmer and sells charcoal and wants to purchase more broiler chicks and charcoal. Rose operates a business in education and wants a loan to invest in her school. Mariam sells used clothes and wants to add to her stock.

loans.use: Fatuma would add more capital to her charcoal business with her part of this group loan

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 42 years old man. He has four children. He works and lives in the Beirut suburbs.

Fadel is a car painter. This is the first time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To develop his car painting business.

loans.name: Latiffa

texts.en: Latiffa I. is a business woman in Kariakoo in Tanzania. She has been in business for the past five years. She runs a shop selling cosmetics and medicated soap. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cosmetics and soap.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina B. sells smoked fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for her and their child. Since demand for her fish is high, Ernestina is requesting a loan of $300 to expand the business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr:
Félicia E. is 38 years old. She is the married mother of five children, of which three are apprenticed and two are in school. For more than three years, she has run a shop in Assahoun, a village about 50 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. Félicia is a loyal client of FECECAV, this being her second loan; with it, she wishes to buy loincloths for resale in order to increase profits and provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Félicia E. est âgé de 38 ans mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 sont en apprentissage et 2 à l’école. Elle tient son petit commerce depuis plus de 3 ans à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Félicia est une cliente fidèle de FECECAV car elle est à son deuxième crédit et souhaite par ce dernier acheter plus de pagnes pour la revente afin de dégager plus de profits et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of loincloths for resale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Her husband passed away so Ms Nguyễn Thi M. had to raise her 2 young children by herself. It was difficult. She started participating in TYM fund in 2002. She opend a tailor shop right in her home. She is a skillful businesswoman and has a lot of experience as a tailor. She has all kind of customers but her main clientele are young men and women since appearance is important for them. After a few years, Ms M. has opened a furniture store with all her savings and loans from TYM. Despite the fact that this is a new store, people do know about it and come to the store. This time Ms M. is seeking 9.000.000 VND to invest in her furniture store, buying wood. Her monthly income is on average 6.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Chồng mất sớm nên chị Nguyễn Thi M. vất vả nuôi 2 con còn nhỏ hiện đang trong độ tuổi ăn học. Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2002 vòng vốn ban đầu chị vay Quỹ chị đã đầu tư vào cửa hàng may mặc tại gia đình, với bản chất là người phụ nữ khéo léo lại có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm trong nghề nên khách hàng của gia đình chị rất đông, khách hàng của chị cũng rất đa dạng đầy đủ các tầng lớp nhưng chủ yếu số đông vẫn là thanh niên nam nữ đây cũng là đối tượng có nhu cầu lớn trong việc sắm sửa may mặc. Sau nhiều năm làm nghề chị đã tích lũy được số vốn kết hợp với việc vay vốn của Quỹ, chị đã kinh doanh thêm một gian hàng chuyên bán đồ gỗ mặc dù mới kinh doanh nhưng cửa hàng của gia đình chị cũng được nhiều người biết đến. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư thêm vốn vào cửa hàng kinh doanh đồ gỗ. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mwanaid

texts.en: Mwanaid is 25 years old and married with one child aged 6 years old. She runs her own salon and she has been a clothes (khanga & vitenge) and home utensils seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business. In the past, Mwanaid has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to open her business. Mwanaid is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: Mwanaid would like to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Loth

texts.en:
Mrs. Loth S. is 39 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are fishermen. The remaining three attend the local school. Mrs. Loth S. is a villager in Kor Village in Kandal Province. Cambodia. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. 

Her husband, Mr. Yan Thy, is a fisherman who can catch only a little fish, because he does not have enough equipment to catch fish. To solve this problem, Mrs. Loth S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat and machinery, especially fishing nets.

loans.use: To buy a boat and machinery, especially fishing nets.

loans.name: Alcides Ramiro

texts.es:
Alcides es socio del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Alcides es casado, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Alcides tiene una tienda de abarrotes al por mayor y menor en la ciudad de Llochegua en la selva ayacuchana, en donde tiene una casa, además Alcides junto a su esposa tienen otra tienda en Totorilla en un local alquilado en donde venden abarrotes.
Alcides necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas.
texts.en:
Alcides is a member of the Communal Bank Totorilla. He is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children. Alcides has a grocery store in the city of Llochegua in the Ayacucho jungle, where he sells both wholesale and retail. There Alcides owns a home with his wife, and they also have another store in Totorilla in a leased space where they sell groceries. Alcides needs a loan of 2500 soles that he will use to buy rice, sugar and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alcides needs a loan of 2500 soles in order to buy rice, sugar, and sodas.

loans.name: Madalene

texts.en:
Madalene U. is 45 years old and is married with five children. Madalene lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Madelene sells loaves of bread at ring road. She sometimes hawks the loaves of bread from street to street.

Madelene needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase additional loaves of bread to sell. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Vicente es casado con 4 hijos, tiene 59 años de edad, su negocio lo emprendió desde el año 1985, era una época floreciente en Ciudad del Este, pero hoy en  día ha bajado su nivel de venta, pero sigue en competencia gracias a su carácter y espíritu jovial. 
Tiene mucha clientela, pero necesita una inyección de capital para comprar las menudencias en  mayor cantidad y por adelantado por que tiene mucha competencia y la única forma de conseguir barato y en forma asegurada es pagando un día antes al proveedor. Las menudencias son las partes internas de animales vacunos, cerdo, gallinas que también son muy consumidos en nuestro país. Entre ellas están el hígado que se consume popularmente como bife con cebolla acompañado de arroz, también se consume el riñón, corazoncitos de gallina, intestinos, etc.

El quiere ir mejorando su negocio para poder obtener mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Vicente is married with 4 children. He is 59 years old and he started his business in 1985 during a time when Ciudad del Este was flourishing. But today his sales have lowered, yet he continues in his business thanks to his character and jovial spirit. He has many customers, but he needs an injection of capital in order to buy large quantities giblets and organ meat and purchase them in advance because this is the only way to get an inexpensive price and assure payment a day prior to delivery. Giblets and organ meat are the internal parts of beef, pork, chicken, and are frequently consumed in our country. Among them are liver which is commonly eaten as liver and onions with rice, and also we eat kidney, chicken heart, intestine, etc. He wishes to continue improving his business in order to obtain greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy organ meat, giblets, and a scale

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El señor Adrian labora para una tienda de un conocido servicio medico desde hace mas de 18 años como administrador del negocio, el tiene un proyecto el cual es la construcción de un techo de madera en el patio para proteger su automóvil de la lluvia  por tal motivo esta solicitando este crédito, ya que asi le brinda mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Adrian has worked for a well-known medical service store for more than 18 years as the manager. He has a project to build a wooden roof on the patio to protect his car from the rain so he is seeking this loan. The roof will provide greater comfort to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wooden roof

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en: Chhean S., 47, sells vegetables in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. On average, she makes $4 per day. Her husband earns about $5 by running a motor-taxi around the market. Two of their children are mechanics at a garage. Mrs. Chhean is requesting a loan to purchase car-painting tools.

loans.use: Purchase car-painting tools

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Emercio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la cuidad de Chinandega, el señor Emercio Q. se dedica a su actividad de venta de gas para cocinar vendiendo los cilindros en su propia casa de habitación el cual es visitado a diario por los usuarios de gas cercanos a su localidad.

Actualmente el señor Emerco ha decidido salira adelante en el negocio y debido a que se le están agotando los cilindros, ha decidido hacer un préstamo en Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos y así comercializarlos en su localidad y continuar beneficiando a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Emercio Q. lives in Chinandega in the area of Somotillo. He sells cooking gas for a living, selling the gas cylinders from his home. Many people from the area use this gas and visit his home daily. Currently Mr. Emercio has decided to try to get ahead in his business. Since his cylinders are almost empty, he has decided to take a loan from Ceprodel so he can buy more. In this way, he can make a business out of them for his area. By dong this, he will also be able to continue to provide for his family, who really need his support.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de los cilindros de gas

loans.name: Rolybeth

texts.en:
Rolybeth L. is 38 years old and married to a tricycle (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver, with three children. She was engaged in farming as one of their main ways to make a living. She became a member of PDP-LP in March 2007.

Rolybeth accessed the credit services offered by the program and she’s on her 3rd loan amounting to Php 6,000, used for purchase of fertilizers. Her project is farming and she is expecting to have a good harvest. Her dream is that all her kids can finish a course of study and can live independently in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en:
Demetrio C. is a fisherman. His life is in the sea. He wants to provide for the needs of his family. He fishes because he thinks it is a better livelihood with which to raise his family. He sells his own fish in their village. He also buys fish from other fisherman to sell to the nearby towns. The man is actually a driver of an old tricycle. He just quit his job and became a fisherman because his previous earnings were not enough to cover his whole family's needs.

He is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fishing materials, such as a fish net and baits. He will also use the loan to buy more fish to sell. In that way, he believes, he will better provide for the needs of his children.

CEVI is reaching out more to fishermen like Demetrio to help sustain their livelihood. CEVI is providing not only credit, but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, bait, and seedlings.

loans.name: Amalia Elena

texts.es: Doña Amalia C. cuenta con 26 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Talabartera, “Elaboración de Calzado para dama” cuenta con un taller de 2 maquinas, habita junto a con  sus Papas,  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 6 años de elaborar calzado en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Amalia C. is 26 years old and single. She is a saddler at "Elaboración de Calzado para dama” (Development of Ladies' Footwear) and has a workshop with two machines. She lives with her parents, who work in the same business and have three employees. She has been making shoes for six years in her home in Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Her customers' demand is currently growing, but the economic conditions are insufficient to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to ASDIR to solicit a loan to buy raw materials and thus increase her sales. She hopes to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ismatullohoja

texts.ru: Исматуллохожа 1983 года рождения , раньше его отец получал кредит на откорм скота в 2006 году, сейчас передал свой бизнес ему. Более 30 лет отец ухаживал , разводил  скот. Дело не легкое , в холодное время необходимо запастись кормом и жмыхом. Всему этому ему показывал отец и своевременно давал советы. Благодаря поддержки КИВА поголовье скота увеличилось и сейчас находится на пастбище. И так будет находиться до глубокой осени.
texts.en:
Ismatullohoja was both in 1983. He overtook the business of his father, who used to be our client and spent over 30 years doing cattle farming. Cattle farming is not easy - one needs to stock a lot of fodder. The father passed his knowledge onto the son and helps him with advice. Thanks to Kiva's support the family has now more cattle, which will stay on the pastures till late fall.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kadi Jahoska

texts.es: La joven Kady Jahoska, vive en union libre, es madre de dos niños menores de edad, solicita su 1er crédito a AFODENIC, para realizar mejora de su vivienda y reparar su cocina, con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, esta joven trabaja en su negocio del restaurantes, localizado en Almendro, en coordinación con su mamá, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero quien asume los gastos del hogar, tiene capacidad y voluntad de pago, su mayor sueño es mejorar cada día su vivienda, espera ser beneficiada con el fondo Kiva pues este fondo ayuda a la familia pobre.
texts.en:
Kady Jahoska is married by common law and is the mother of two young children. This is her first loan with Adofenic, which she will use to improve her home and repair her kitchen. Her goal is to improve her living conditions. She works in the restaurant business in Almendro along with her mother. She also has the support of her boyfriend who pays for their home's expenses. Her biggest dream is to improve her home every day. She hopes to benefit from the funds from Kiva, which will help a poor family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen repairs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia D. Bancomunal Antares
Rosa es  conviviente,  tiene 57 años, no tiene hijos 
Rosa tenía una tienda pero la cerró por que no vendía mucho por la zona donde esta, con su hermano empezó a ofrecer servicio de movilidad, a  repartir cartas y entregar paquetes   
Desde que Rosa esta en Finca  aprendió ahorra, a ser cumplida y ordenada en su negocio,  
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de llantas y batería 
El sueño de Rosa es comprar un carro con asiento especial  para su hermano que es minusválido
