texts.en:
Rosa is a member of Bancomunal Antares. She is 57 years old, has a partner but no children. Rosa had a shop that she closed due to low sales because of the area where it was located. She started a courier service with her brother, they deliver letters and packages. Rosa has learned to save and to be organized since she started with Finca. She is asking for a loan of $350 to buy tires and a battery .Rosa's dream is to buy a car with a special seat for his brother who is disabled.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and a battery

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 38 years old, is married and a mother of three children. She is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, and bags of rice. She tells us that these items move very fast and you can easily recover your money in order to restock. Mary's goods are delivered from the capital city of Kumasi.

With fifteen years of trading experience, she wants to expand her offerings with items like maize and eggs, which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this would be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more bags of raw materials for sale.

She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy items like spices, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, and bags of rice.

loans.name: Abdurafik

texts.ru: Абдурафик 1973 года рождения , женат имеет 3 детей.  Имеет среднее образование. Работает водителем такси в свободное время нанимается водителем грузовой машиныЗИЛ. В основном развозит тяжелые грузы.  У него есть заказы и рейсы по районам и городу.  Его машина устарела и требует  ремонта и конечно  больших затрат. Но получив кредит он отремонтирует только частично. И дальше будет делать  дальние рейсы.  Со временем от полученной прибыли он также закончит свой дальнейший ремонт.
texts.en:
Abdurafik was born in 1973, he is married and has three children. He has secondary education. He works as a taxi driver and drives a truck of make ZIL in his free time. He mainly transports heavy freights. He gets order on routs around the region and town. His vehicle has become old and needs a repair and of course the costs are high. By getting a loan he will make only partial repairs. And then he will be able to make long hauls. With time he will finish the repair when he makes a profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma Y. is from the village of Pob. Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 55-years old and married with two adult children. Nelma owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing services to local community members. Nelma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2007, Nelma joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Nelma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and threads. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

The Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase needles and threads

loans.name: Milenka

texts.es: Milenka D. F., esta separada tiene dos pequeñas hijas, y se dedica a la confeccion de pijamas para hospitales y tambien realiza Guardapolvos para Profesores, ella trabaja sola, durante las mañanas atiende su hogar y por las tardes se dedica a la costura y tambien deja las prendas en distintos hospitales, clínicas y centros médicos de nuestra ciudad. vive en casa de sus padres independiente, ocupando dos habitaciones, una como vivienda y otra como taller de costura.

loans.use: Invertira en la compra de tela

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 39 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling native coconut wine known as "tuba" produced by her husband in the local community. Jocelyn is just starting this business. In 2006, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which she will use to purchase construction materials to repair her house. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to have comfortable shelter for her family to live in. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair.

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin tiene 27 años, es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo de 3 añitos. Ella tiene una chacra a 8 horas de su casa, donde cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres para dirigir las labores agrícolas y con peones que se encargan de la siembra de yuca y el mantenimiento de los cultivos. Por su parte, Karin es la encargada de buscar a los compradores para ofrecer y vender su producto. Esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 4 años atrás y le va muy bien porque cuenta con 50 hectáreas de yuca, produciendo y 50 hectáreas por producir. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede poner en práctica sus habilidades para el negocio y mantenerse activa. Para un futuro cercano, le gustaría incursionar en la crianza y venta de pollos. 
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y desde ya ha notado que sus compañeros de banco comunal son personas responsables y solidarias, por lo que está muy entusiasmada en su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará machetes, palas y rastrillos, herramientas de mucha utilidad para el mantenimiento de sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.use: Compra de herramientas agrícolas

loans.name: Milagros De Cumyasa 4 Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is the coordinator of her group Milagros D. Cumyasa (Miracles of Cumyasa). Her story is representative of the members of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) clients more generally. Her group is based in Cumyasa an area near the town of La Romana where the economy centers around sugar cane and where both running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Here she makes her home with her husband and two children.

Lourdes is excited about requesting her second loan with Esperanza. She has successfully completed her first loan cycle. She plans to use this loan to invest in her colmado/bakery (small corner store) by purchasing five gallon jugs of clean water to sell and platters on which to serve the cakes she bakes. She believes that this will increase her business and the attractiveness of her product, helping her to realize larger profits. With these profits she plans to continue constructing her home and to save for her children to go to university. One of her long term goals is also to move her business to a place where there is more foot traffic and therefore more customers. She thanks you all for her support

loans.use: Bottles of water to sell and trays to present her cakes

loans.name: Chaaban

texts.en: Chaaban is a married man and the father of 5 children. He works hard to provide his family with good living conditions. He has been working as a farmer since 1995. Currently, Chaaban is requesting a loan of $1,000, with which he will purchase new agricultural tools that will allow him to increase the efficiency of his work and thus let him earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: purchasing new agricultural tools

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Cahuaya, estudio educación Primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi un año y su préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado  ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, además algunos chanchos, que luego de su mejora ella los venderá en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Elena, 46, is a member of the "San Pedro" communal bank which is in Ancara, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is married and has 6 children. She lives in Ancara Sector Cahuaya. She finished elementary school. She has been associated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost a year now and she used her initial, 500 new sol, loan to buy sheep. Currently, she needs a new, 500 new sol, loan to buy sheep to raise as well as a few pigs which, once fattened, will be sold at the local livestock fairs. Her greatest desire is to continue working. She enjoys the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory D., 45, lives in the village of Brgy. Maquiling, Sagay City Negros Occidental. Her husband helps her in managing their diversified microbusinesses. They have three children and hope that all their children will be able to earn college degrees and get good jobs so that they can have comfortable lives.

To help her husband achieve this dream, she is helping him in their meat vending business. She sells pork and beef meat in the local market. They also buy and sell livestock, such as pigs, cows, carabaos (water buffalos) and many others. They go around the nearby villages and towns to buy livestock and then resell them for meat processing. 

Dory joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997, in order to have access to loans to help Dory and her husband sustain their business activities. With the help of loans, she also put put a Carinderia (an eatery) as another source of income for their family, and was also able to buy a small piece of rice land, which her husband now farms. Dory earns an average income of 36,000 PHP per month, some of which she adds to her revolving working capital and saves for the education of their children, after spending for their household expenses.

Her previous loan of 35,000 PHP contributed a lot to expanding the businesses. She used it as additional working capital for her meat vending business and as revolving capital to buy livestock. The said amount was fully paid on time without any delay. Now Dory is borrowing 40,000 PHP, which she intends to use as revolving capital to buy livestock and as additional capital for her food business. She plans to use the income from this loan to start another business so that she can save for a better future for her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the  lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" --  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her livestock business

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Con la responsabilidad de mantener en buen estado su vivienda, la señora María A. se dedica arduamente a trabajar en una empresa del municipio de el Guasaule y sus objetivos hoy en día son mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda puesto que ha estado en malas condiciones y ha iniciado la reconstrucción de dicha vivienda la cual está ubicada en el municipio de Somotillo.

Es importante destacar que ella es muy trabajadora y ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda que es el sueño que ha tenido y ahora lo hará realidad gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación en su trabajo.
texts.en:
With the responsibility of maintaining her house in good condition, Mrs. Maria A. dedicates herself arduously to work in an enterprise in the Municipality of Guasaule. Her objective today is to improve conditions in her home, which has fallen into bad condition. She has initiated reconstruction of her house, located in the Municipality of Somotillo.

It is important to point out that she is a very hard worker and has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to invest in purchasing construction materials to carry out these home improvements, which is the dream she has had and now, she will realize, thanks to her great effort and dedication to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO REBUILD HER HOME

loans.name: Maristania Solanda

texts.es:
Maristania forma parte del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ella está casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es guardia de una estación de servicio en la ciudad  y ella trabaja hace dos meses   para una amiga en su restaurant en el área de cocina, aparte  de esta labor en su casa vende diferentes  bebidas como colas, cervezas, jugos y aguas, éste negocio lo montó hace tres  meses aproximadamente y sólo lo atiende los fines de semana. En cada pedido ella invierte entre 100 a 200 dólares mensuales.

Con el nuevo préstamo que recibirá de la Fundación Espoir ella invertirá todo en abastecer  su pequeña tienda con suficientes colas, aguas, jugos  y cerveza que en ésta época del año  se vende mucho más.

Entre sus  sueños esta poder terminar su casa y darle el toque  que le falta para que este totalmente habitable.
texts.en:
Maristania is part of the community bank Mujeres Solidarias ("Supportive Women") in the city of Portoviejo. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a guard in a service station in the city, and she has worked for two months for a friend in her restaurant in the kitchen. Apart from this work, in her home she sells different beverages such as sodas, beers, juices and water. She has been in this business for approximately three months and she only serves the beverages on weekends. With every request, she invests between 100 and 200 dollars per month.

With the new loan that she will receive from the Fundación Espoir, she will invest all of it in supplying her small shop with soda, water, juice, and beer for she sells a lot more this time of year.

One of her dreams is to be able to finish her home and give it the touches that it is missing to make it completely habitable.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soda, water, juice, and beer

loans.name: Analyn's Group

texts.en: Analyn G. is from the village of Bitag Pequeno, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 36 years old. Analyn is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Analyn is married and has three young children. To make a living, Analyn raises pigs for fattening and for sale. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Analyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Analyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa C. L. is a 38-year-old mother of five from Sarapiqui, Heredia, located near the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. Her highest level of formal education attained is the completion of primary school. Maria is a member of a group of women with the name Banco Mujer La Esperanza, which translates as “The Women’s Bank of Hope”. 

Maria’s entrepreneurial idea is the rearing and selling of pigs. She will use this loan to start her business by investing in animal feed and piglets and to make general investments conducive to maintaining the good health of her animals.

The land Maria and her family live on was allocated to them by the Costa Rican government’s Instituto de Desarollo Agrario which translates as “The Institute of Agrarian Development (IDA)”. Through the IDA, the poorest citizens of the country were given land to live on and use for subsistence purposes such as farming and animal rearing. Many IDA land recipients have faced challenges in being able to effectively use their land due to a lack of agricultural knowledge and a lack of startup capital. Fundacion Mujer acts as an extension of the IDA program by providing much needed loans as startup capital for investment in various productive activities.

As a result of the amount of time it will take in order for the pigs to grow to a profitable value, Maria will be not be required to make immediate repayments. This means she will only repay once, at the end of the loan term.

The values Maria expects to be displayed by the group are responsibility and punctuality. She hopes to expand her business in an effort to earn more income and provide a better standard of living for her children. Specifically, she would like to be able to finance their studies.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Emani Doris

texts.fr: cette jeune dame est mariée mais elle n'a pas d'enfants, elle vit avec son mari dans le quartier de Kégué, elle a appris le métier de la coiffure et a ouvert son propre atelier depuis 2006, elle a appelé son atelier "GALAXY COIFFURE", elle a associé à son commerce la vente de  produits de beauté et de mèches, elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a remboursé sans difficulté, voulant se réapprovisionner en produits de beauté et en mèches, elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour l'achat de divers produits de beauté et de mèches.
texts.en:
This young lady is married, but she has no children.  She lives with her husband in the Kégué, district.  She learned the trade of sewing and opened her own workshop in 2006.  She named her workshop "GALAXY COIFFURE".  She has included with her business the sale of beauty products and hair extensions.  She has already had a WAGES loan, which she repaid without difficulty.  Wanting to resupply herself with beauty supplies and hair extensions, she's requesting a second loan from WAGES to do so.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buing beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 52 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Govi-Altay province, Mongolia. Both of her daughters attend university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and her youngest son is in high school. Her husband is disabled and currently unemployed. Narantsetseg operates a small shoe shop at the local market in her town. She retired from her career in 2007; however, she has worked at the market selling imported goods and operating her current shoe business to supplement her income. Narantsetseg has found success since starting her new business. In 2008, she used her earnings to purchase her own counter at the market. Furthermore, Narantsetseg previously received a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 705 USD) loan from XacBank, and used the loan funds to effectively expand her business. Narantsetseg is a very open and hardworking person. The most important thing to her is being able to provide for her children's education. She says, “My two daughters will graduate soon and my son plans to enroll in university after high school. I want to ensure that I can financially support them." Narantsetseg hopes to continue to expand her business in the future. She is now making plans to open a small shop from which to sell Korean products next year. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1407 USD) loan to increase her working capital and purchase summer sneakers to sell at her counter.

loans.use: To purchase summer sneakers to sell

loans.name: Kwamboka

texts.en: Kwamboka is a 28 year old married lady who has two children in school.  For the last five years, she has been running a salon, and before that she sold second-hand clothes. She uses her income to pay wages to her two employees and save some with Faulu Kenya. She hopes to open more salons in the future and employ more people. She has requested for a loan of Kes. 60,000 to buy hair products such as shampoos, hair oil and weaves.  She sees herself having rental houses in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair oil, shampoo and weaves

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty F. is 54 years old and has two children from her marriage to 47-year-old Franklin. One of Letty’s hopes is for her youngest child to go back to school and finish her studies in college. Proceeds from their fishing business managed by her husband are her main source of everything her family needs, especially her children. With the profit from the business, she has been able to purchase appliances for their house. Since they started their own business, their lives have eventually improved. 

For Letty to be able to achieve her dream for her child, she has to grow their business and increase their proceeds. Therefore, she is now requesting a much larger loan through ASHI to finance her business growth plans.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Integridad 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group La Integridad (The Integrity), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged isthmus with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure as a single mother with three children.

Ana is excited to be taK. her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling underwear by travelling to the main market in the Capital to purchase underwear and then bring it back to her community to sell at a profit. She will use the profits to purchase medicine, school supplies, and a computer for her daughters. She also would like to save toward sealing the concrete blocks of her rented home and eventually buying it. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Lingueres Keur Madiagne 2 Group

texts.fr:
le groupement les linguéres de keur maD. 2 est un sous groupe un groupement dénommé les linguéres de Fallokh
leur activité principale est la vente de legumes et céréales dans les marchés de la ville et des villages environnant comme le village de keur maD..Ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt pour débuter leur activité ,ce second credit entre dans le renforcement de leur commerce pour acheter davantage de produits pour être revendu dans le marché et en tirer des profits pour faire face aux exigence de la vie et des depenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The «Linguéres de Keur MaD. 2» is a subgroup of the «Linguères de Fallokh». Their main activity is the retail commerce of vegetables and cereals in town markets and in surrounding villages such as Keur MaD.. Having been granted a first loan to start up their business, this second loan will serve to strengthen their business by acquiring more products for resale, so that they can gain profits to deal with life’s requirements and daily expenditures.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: strengthen commercial activity

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea Z., 51, is an active member of ASHI. Her two children, ages 19 and 21, are the inner force that pushes her to work harder each day and increase her income through a small business. She receives financial support for her business from ASHI loans. In 1997, she opened a small variety store with a loan.  At the time, she only sold a few items. Despite the small scale, Irenea has been able to make a small profit from her store. Making a profit from her store allowed her to augment her husband's income from working as an electrician. Their combined income enabled her to support the needs of her two children, especially their education.

Over the years, Irenea’s business has grown a bit through the support of loans received from ASHI. Using the proceeds of her business she was able to finance her eldest child to attend college.  Irenea is supporting the needs of her children, especially those of the 19 year old, who only finished high school. Irenea never gets tired of supporting her family because it keeps her alive. She wants to increase her store's profit by expanding her variety store into a huge grocery store.  This would allow her to support the education of her youngest child if he considers going back to school and attending college.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia G. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 57 years old. Julia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Julia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Julia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional products to sell. Julia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Julia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Hermelinda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Hermelinda de 40 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada así porque es su originalidad habían muchas flores Orquídeas), desde hace muchos años ella tiene una tienda de vivieres. 

Antes de tener la tienda ella no tenia donde comprar comida porque quedaba muy lejos el mercado, al ver ella la necesidad comenzó a comprar mas comida de la que necesitaba en la semana y venderla a sus amigas, poco a poco se convirtieron las ventas en una pequeña tienda, hasta ahora que trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quieren comprar azúcar, arroz, enlatados para su pequeña tienda, en el futuro quiere que sus dos hijos terminen sus estudios con existo y surtir mas su tienda.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 40 years old and lives in the Orquídeas of Guayquil (urban area, named because there were originally many orchid flowers). For several years she has had a general store. Before having this store she did not have anywhere to buy food because she lived very far from the market. Upon seeing this need, she began to buy more food than she needed for the week and she sold it to her friends. Little by little this converted into a small store. Now she works from 6:30 am until 10 pm every day. With the loan they want to buy sugar, rice, and canned goods for her small store. In the future she hopes that her two children finish their studies with success and she hopes to further supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sugar, rice, canned goods

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn J. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ronelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ronelyn has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Ronelyn joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Glenis Esther

texts.es:
Glenis es una mujer casada y con 4 hijos en las edades de 4 a 15 años, tiene 33 años. Ella es muy reconocida en este pueblo,donde las  ferias artesanales y las fiestas de San Luis Beltrán, constituyen los momentos de la mas alta demanda mercadologica para todos los negocios.

Como  Glenis sabe también confeccionar, ella  inició su emprendimiento justamente con ese arte pero paulatinamente fue agregándole la miscelánea   y allí también vende sus productos de confección, negocio con un   mercado especifico, oxigenado por la miscelánea.

Su credikiva por valor de $ 1.500.000 COP es el segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior  financiamiento, ha podido mejorar su ingreso, porque cuenta como quien dice con un nuevo capital que trabaja y luego devuelve con unas utilidades para ella. Su mayor desafío es la seguridad de su negocio y eso es en lo que se encuentra trabajando para sentirse mas tranquila, porque está justamente a la orilla del pueblo. Es así como con este financiamiento, invertirá en la compra de productos para surtir su negocio en el mes del  amor y amistad y prepararse para este segundo semestre del año, época muy buena para el comercio, donde aumentan sus clientes y hay mayor rotación de su dinero, por eso ella también aprovechará  este recurso,  para hacer unas adecuaciones  a su vivienda y darle mas seguridad para el fin de año.
texts.en:
Glenis, 33, is married and has four children who range from 4 to 15 years of age. She is very well known in town where the crafts fairs and feast days of San Luis Beltrán are the busiest days with highest demand for all types of business. Because Glenis also knows how to sew clothes she started out precisely doing this but gradually added miscellaneous items to sell together with her clothing items. This is a business with a very specific market that is enriched by the miscellany. Her $1.500.000 COP Kiva loan is her second with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her prior loan allowed her to increase her income because she tells us that new capital to work results in profits for her. Her greatest challenge is her business’ security and that is what she’s working on to feel more relaxed because she's located just at the outskirts of town. She will use these funds to buy stock items for her store during the month of love and friendship so that she can be prepared for the year’s second semester, a very good time for commerce, when customers increase and there is better flow of money. She will take advantage of this resource to also make some adjustments to her home to provide it with better security for the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with children's and teens' clothing, decorations, stationery items and also for locale improvements costs.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
This is Roselyn C., a 41-year-old resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Daniel C. Jr., an overseas Filipino worker. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is just starting elementary school while the younger children toddle around at home. By the grace of God, Roselyn managed to support her older child’s schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all her children all the way through college -- a dream for most Filipino parents like Roselyn as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Roselyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. Juanita earns by getting supplies at a  wholesale price and selling them at a piece rate. Roselyn’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Roselyn dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own house and lot someday. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Carla Vanessa,  tiene 22 años, ella es casada  y tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad. Su esposo trabaja como alumno de taxi . La señora Ramírez M. se dedica al destace de cerdos, ella principalmente vende la carne sin embargo también los fines de semana elabora nacatamales además de elaborar comida como cabeza de cerdo, chicharrones, fritos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace ocho años, cabe señalarse fue su papa el que le enseño este negocio, el cual surgió como una necesidad de búsqueda de empleo. Ella está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y materia prima para la elaboración de nacatamales. Ella a través de este préstamo pretende incrementar la oferta de sus productos para vender más y ganar más. Su sueño es llegar a comprar algún día un tramo en el en el cual pueda vender sus productos y diversificarse hacia la venta de otros productos también como ropa.
texts.en:
Carla Vanessa, 22, is married and has a one year old son. Her husband is an apprentice taxi driver. Mrs. Ramírez M. butchers pigs primarily to sell the meat. However, on weekends she makes nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) and other dishes like pig’s head, fried pork rinds, fried pork, etc. She started this business 8 years ago. It’s worth mentioning that her father taught her the business which rose out of her need to find work. She is asking for this loan to buy pigs and ingredients for the nacatamales. Through the loan she pretends to offer a wider variety of products in order to sell more and thus earn more. Her dream is to someday own space in which she can sell her products and diversify toward the sale of other products, like clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and nacatamal ingredients (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare).

loans.name: Santiago Rafael

texts.es:
Santiago de 27 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. El y su esposa tienen una pequeña tienda. 

Creo un negocio familiar con algunos ahorros y con la motivación de mantener a sus tres hijos de 5, 3 y 1 año de edad. Su esposa le ayuda en el negocio mientras que el sale a comprar los víveres para la tienda, trabajan desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Venden todo tipo de víveres incluso verduras, legumbres y frutas.  

Para seguir surtiendo su tienda el quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, carnes etc. En el futuro quiere crear una granja de pollos para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
27-year old Santiago lives in a suburban area surrounded by a salt marsh along the Perimetral highway in Guayaquil. He and his wife run a small store there. He started the family business with some of his savings in order to earn money to support his three children aged 5, 3, and 1. His wife helps him in the store while he goes off to buy stock to sell in the store. They work from 6 am to 10 pm every day selling all types of products such as vegetables, pulses, and fruit. Santiago wishes to use the loan to buy more stock such as rice, drinks, meat etc. In the future he would like to start up a poultry farm so he can earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks etc

loans.name: Catalina Huanca Group

texts.es:
Sinónimo D. perseverancia es Catalina Huanca, un grupo D. mujeres optimistas y  luchadoras. Este grupo lleva ya formado 4 años, con 9 socias que son ejemplo D. mujeres. La confianza que hay entre ellas no solo transcurre por el tiempo que llevan como grupo, también a su vez son vecinas y viven en la zona D. Catalina Huanca por ello el nombre del grupo.
 Seria grato comentar D. cada una D. las integrantes pero faltarían palabras. Por tanto mencionaremos a la señora Giuliana Sánchez, una integrante D. 40 años D. edad esposa y madre D. 3 hijos. Ella comienza su labor diaria con la venta D. productos naturales, el cual le ha dado muchos frutos económicos desD. hace más D. 3 años, pudiendo ahorrar para los gastos D. la casa y los estudios D. sus hijos en el colegio. Con el presente préstamo lo invertirá en mejoras D. su negocio e implementación del mismo. Catalina Huanca un grupo D. mujeres que con esmero y dedicación saben salir adelante con el paso D. cada día.
texts.en:
Catalina Huanca is synonymous with perserverance. It is a group of optimistic women who are fighters. This group was formed four years ago with 9 members who are exemplary. The trust between them exists not only because they are in the group together, but because they are also neighbors and live in the Catalina Huanca area, and that is where the group's name comes from.  

It would be nice to be able to comment on each member, but there aren't enough words. Therefore, we'll mention Mrs.Giuliana Sánchez, a 40 year old member who is a wife and mother of 3 children. She starts her daily work selling natural products. This has given her a lot of economic benefit for more than 3 years. She has been able to save for household expenses and her children's high school educations. With this loan, she will invest in business improvements and the outfitting of the same. Catalina Huanca is a group of women with care and dedication who know how to get ahead every day.

loans.use: She will invest in business improvement and in its outfitting.

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya is 26 years of age, married to G. Q., who runs a grocery store in the market. Other earning people in the family are her mother-in-law and brother-in-law. Her brother-in-law has a business of selling sweetmeats and her mother-in-law is a nurse by profession. They all live together as a combined family system.

Ruqqiya herself is a caring and simple lady. She spends her time at home and carries out the responsibilities of a housewife and a mother well. She has 3 children, 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are very young and have not started to attend school yet. Ruqqiya lives in a city named Jaranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab and famous for its agriculture industry in Pakistan.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s grocery business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries for his grocery shop, which he has run for the past 5 years in the market. Ruqqiya is hopeful that with the loan money, her husband will be able to get a better income by increasing his sales.
 
She is a new loan applicant and is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Ruqqiya”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Alivera

texts.fr: Alivera M. est une vendeuse des légumes.  Elle est veuve, et elle a 4 enfants entre 2 ans et 20 ans.  Deux de ses enfants vont à l'école.  Avec son prêt, elle veut acheter des légumes.  Alivera voudrait développer son projet et ses activités de commerce.
texts.en: Alivera M. sells vegetables. She is widowed and the mother of four children, aged from 2 to 20 years. Two of her children attend school. She wants to use her loan to buy vegetables. Alivera would like to develop her business project and activity.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Reina Luz

texts.es:
la señora Reina Luz S. S. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos nietos que dependen de ella,  ya que el papa de ellos fallecio.
doña Reina Luz vive en el barrio Buenos Aires de San Lorenzo, tiene casa propia  y se dedica al comercio, vende lacteos como ser queso, quesillo y mantequilla, tiene dos puestos en donde vende dichos productos.
doña Reina es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora con muchos deseos de superacion.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de lacteos y bolsas plasticas.
el sueño de doña Reina Luz es que sus dos negocios sean los mejores de la zona y que sus ventas se mejoren porque estan malas en estos momentos, pero con la epoca de navidad las cosas mejoran.
texts.en:
Reina Luz S. S. is 52 years old and married.  She has two grandchildren who are dependent upon her because their father died.

Reina Luz lives in her own house in the Buenos Aires de San Lorenzo neighborhood.  She sells dairy products like cheese, fresh cheese, and butter.  She has two stands where she sells said products.

Reina is a very hard-working and enterprising woman with a strong drive for self-improvement.  She will use the loan to buy dairy products and plastic bags.

Reina Luz’s dreams are that her two businesses become the best in the zone and that her sales improve.  Sales are now bad, but with the Christmas season they will improve.

loans.use: To buy cheese, fresh cheese, butter, and plastic bags

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada R. lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband works long hours as a fisherman to support the family. 

To supply additional income, Iluminada would like to receive a loan of 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase raw materials needed in her fishing business, such as fishing net, and for maintenance of their fishing boat. With more fish to catch and sell, she believes that sales will increase, leading to higher revenue. 
 
As a dedicated member of Kiva partner ASHI, she ensured strong performance with regular attendance in group meetings and steady repayments. Iluminada is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her business dreams. 

With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund all of her children’s education until they finish college.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed in her fishing business, such as fishing net, and for maintenance of their fishing boat.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson N. is an individual client from Ntungamo. He is 50 years old and married with nine children. He is involved in agriculture whereby he sells matooke from Kyeiziga II cell. His customers are mostly from Kampala, Kyeiziga and Kabugo. In addition to this business, he is involved in the sale of cattle, milk and goat sales. Nelson needs a loan to be able to improve his ten-year-old banana plantation. His plantation is a family business and everyone is involved to help it succeed. He is happy that his loans have enabled his business to succeed as well as provide education for his children.

loans.use: To improve his banana plantation by purchasing manure.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Winnie has a retail shop business, which she has run for four years. She also sells charcoal.
To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Winnie hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. Winnie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her an employment skill.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Hero

texts.en:
Hero T. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old. Hero is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hero owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Hero has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Hero joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hero is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Hero from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Abdel Kader

texts.ar:
عبد القادر في عمر 34 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في فرن لبيع (المناقيش) له في عمله 7 سنوات له تاريخ جيد في المصلحة
حيث ان زبائنه همكثر من محيطه وجيرانه له خبرة واسعة في هذا المجال يريد دائما التطور والتجديد ويحب ان يؤمن لعائلته الاستقرار
والامان المادي والاجتماعي يواجه صعوبة مادية في تطوير العمل وانه يطلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء براد للعجين + موتور كهرباء
texts.en: Abdel Kader, 34, is married with three children. He has been working at a bakery that sells manakeesh (pizza-like dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat) for seven years. He has exhaustive experience in his work and has many clients, who are his neighbours and people who know him. He wishes to secure his family socially and financially but he finds it difficult to develop his business for lack of funds. He wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy an electric motor and a fridge for dough.

loans.use: To buy an electric motor and a fridge for dough.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 64 años de edad, de estado civil soltera,  estudio hasta 3º de educación secundaria. 
Hace un año y medio viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de animales  como chanchos, ovinos, etc.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará una vaca lechera y un chancho, también cuenta que trabaja en la chacra sembrando papa, quinua, habas, apilla, olluco, para luego venderlo.  Trabaja sola a veces le ayuda su sobrina.
Su sueño es mejorar el ganado y mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Juliana, 64, is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” communal bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She’s single and finished third grade.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half.  Her initial 300 new sol loan was used for her livestock, pigs, sheet, etc. raising business.

She will use this 2000 new sol loan to buy a dairy cow and a pig.  She also tells us that she works her fields farming potato, quinoa, lima beans, apilla (a tuber), olluco (a tuber) to later sell.  She works alone with occasional help from her niece.

Her dream is to improve the livestock in order to improve her income.  

What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan and what her savings earn.

loans.use: She will buy a dairy cow and a pig.

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa, 46, is widowed and lives with her two children in Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband passed away two years ago, so she must take care of her two children by herself. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent,  on a small plot of land that they own. Both of her children attend a local secondary school. 

Alimaa graduated from a vocational school as a tailor in 1986 and worked at a local clothing factory for six years. She began operating her own business in 1993. In the beginning she made clothes at home, however in 2008 she began to rent a workplace in a bigger trading center. Since she began her own business she was able to save enough money to buy the land they currently own. She wants to have her own workshop in the future so that she can save money on rent. 

Alimaa is a hard-working and brave person who says, "I want my two children to get a good education so they can live without any difficulties in the future." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a stitching machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy a stitching machine

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband who runs a grocery store in the community. Through his store, he sells daily use items such as salt, sugar, cooking oil and lentils.  With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put into his store to fulfill customer demands and to make larger profits. Perveen is hopeful that her husband, who has been operating this business for the past 2 years, will be successful and be able to get the desired results from his business after making the loan investment. 

Perveen is a very supportive lady and always supports her family. As a housewife, she stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She has 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her eldest son works in the fields and grows different seasonal crops. A second son is a diver by profession, while the youngest one operates a Punjabi food restaurant business. Her daughters are studying in a local school. 

She has been living in Jaranwala for many years with her family in a 2-room brick house. Jaranwala is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. 

Perveen is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proved herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa S. is from the village of Buguac, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old. Ma. Theresa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits,  shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Ma. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Theresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ma. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ma. Theresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar comes from Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and known for its textile industry. She has been living there in a 4 -oom brick house with her family in the area of Daood Nagar for the past 16 years. She is 35 years old, married to S. K., and has two sons and three daughters. Due to their financial constraints, her elder son couldn’t get an education. He is a professional cook while three of the remaining four are studying at a local school. 

Her husband has a Paan(betel leaves) and cigarette shop in the market. In his shop he also sells cold drinks like Coca-Cola to his customers. Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. Using the loan, he will buy betel leaves, cold drinks and cigarettes of different brands to sell in his shop. 

She hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and his monthly income will grow.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Kosar.

loans.use: To buy betel leaves, cold drinks and cigarettes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hard-working mother to three children aged 8, 6 and 4. She is married to a farmer. Susan helps her husband till their land to grow rice crops. The farm gives them an income of 4000 PHP per month. Susan does her best to improve this income and save for her children’s future.

Susan’s loan will be used to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Abdulrazaq

texts.en:
Abdulrazaq is a young man who is getting married this summer and needs to cover some of the expenses that he can't cover directly as he is an employee with a meager salary.

Abdulrazaq took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the wedding hall and chair rentA. to have the wedding on time.  Abdulrazaq is photographed in the picture above.

loans.use: to pay for the wedding hall and chair rental.

loans.name: Maribel Isabel

texts.es:
La Señorita. Maribel es socia del banco comunal Prosperidad, vive por el sector del Batan en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su arquitectura y su naturaleza. Cuenca es cuna de deportistas y escritores, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señorita. Maribel tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres que es propia y con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, su papá es de profesión mecánico y su mamá es comerciante.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon, Yanbal, actividad que la realiza hace un año y medio, vende recorriendo la ciudad a sus amigas y conocidas, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Este es su primer crédito que lo realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por su tío. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería para seguir con su negocio.

Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the village bank Prosperidad. She lives in the sector of Batan in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its beautiful architecture and for the natural surroundings. Cuenca is the cradle of sportsmen and writers, and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Maribel is 18 years old, single and lives with her parents in their home. She shares the family's living expenses. Her father is a mechanic and her mother is a merchant.

She sells Avon and Yanbal brand cosmetics, an activity that she's been doing for a year and a half. She goes around the city selling to her friends and acquaintances. She works every day without a set schedule.

This is her first loan from the village bank, which she joined at the invitation of her ungle. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry so she can grow her business.

Her goal is to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old. He is married and has two children, neither of whom are currently in school. Robert has a business selling charcoal, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further and buy more charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: La Familia Renacer 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Sergida is one of the members of the “La Familia Renacer 3 y 4” (To Be a Reborn Family 3 & 4) group which has 10 micro-businesswomen and businessmen. They are involved in clothing sales, natural products sales, shoe sales, food sales, etc. Sergida’s family is made up of herself, her long-term partner and their three children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to have her own house. She really enjoys cooking and being at home with her family.

Sergida is very excited to receive her fifth loan from Esperanza Internacional, having satisfactorily repaid her previous loan and taken an important step in her business’ growth. She has had her business for about 6 years; she started it with a little money she had in savings. Sergida is running a fried food stall, and she is planning on investing the new loan by buying meats, vegetables, cooking oil, flour and other goods.

She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save for her dreams, having a restaurant and her own house.

She lives in the city of Santiago which is the country’s second largest. Its economy depends on agriculture, cattle-raising and tobacco farming, among others. It also has a sizable population of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants who live in communities of very limited resources.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, plantains, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and she is a responsible mother to her three children. She lives close to her parents’ house in San Antonio. The area where she lives is rural and her main activity is in the agriculture sector.

Maria has been planting crops for a living. She sees to the sale of the rice and corn in the markets. She has several years of experience in this business. This business generates a good income for her.

Maria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer such as manure and seeds to grow for her farm.

Maria is a home-loving person and is respected by the people that know her. They describe her as friendly and hard-working in her community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure and seeds

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
Remigio tiene 36 años de edad, es padre de 2 niños y esta felizmente casado. Remigio y su familia viven en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 200 familias.

Desde hace 5 años, Remigio se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco de recorriendo  las viviendas de su comunidad y alrededores (en su mototaxi) y también desde su domicilio. Remigio conoce a la perfección su actividad y cuenta con clientela establecida. 

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de pescado e incursionar en la crianza de aves de corral. Desea comprar aves medianas para engorde y el alimento balanceado que la crianza de estas requiere. Además hará unas pequeñas reparaciones a su mototaxi.

Remigio es un comerciante emprendedor y cliente antiguo de nuestra institución. Goza de buenas referencias personales y crediticias.
texts.en:
Remigio is 36 years old. He is the father of 2 children and is happliy married. Remigio and his family live in a rural area in the Lambayeque district, in a small community of approximately 200 families.

For the past 5 years, Remigio has sold fresh fish round the houses of his community and its environs, from his mototaxi, as well as from home. Remigio knows his business well and has an established customer base.

He is seeking a loan of 2000 Soles from [the field partner] Edpyme Alternativa, so he can buy a greater quantity of fish and also to get into raising poultry. He wants to buy half-grown birds to fatten up, and the balanced poultry-feed that the birds will require. He would aslo like to make minor repairs to his mototaxi. 

Remingio is an enterprising businessman and a long-time client of the field partner. He comes with good references, both personally and in terms of his credit-worthiness.

loans.use: To buy fish and poultry.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last three years.  He is 43 years old, married to Agnes, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy one dairy cow and four sheep.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his town.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow and four sheep.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 5 y un año de edad, él es agricultor, siembra hortalizas, este cultivo lo aprendió por necesidad, las hortalizas las siembra con tomates, ejotes, repollo, maíz y frijol; él necesita comprar abono, semillas de tomates y chile, además tela para proteger las hortalizas, por eso solicita un préstamo que será una gran ayuda para cubrir el gasto necesario de su trabajo.
Juan aplica mucha dedicación al trabajo, esto le ayuda para salir con cada cosecha, los sueños de él es que sus hijos crezcan, y tengan una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and two children aged 5 and 1.  He is a farmer and grows vegetables; a business that he learned through necessity.  He grows tomatoes, green beans, cabbage, corn and kidney beans.  Juan needs to buy manure, tomato and chili seeds, and material to protect his crops.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan which will be a great help to him in covering his necessary work expenses.

Juan does his work with a lot of commitment.  This helps him to do well with each harvest.  His dreams are for his children to grow and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure, tomato and chili seeds, and material to protect his crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes and laces for her boutique business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 67 años de edad, viudo y con 5 hijos. El señor Juan tiene 55 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Él aprendió esta actividad de su padre cuando tenia tan solo 12 años de edad, lo que le impidió asistir a la escuela.

El señor Juan manifiesta que su objetivo primordial es garantizar la seguridad alimentaría de su familia. El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable, ya que hace ocho años quedo viudo y a cargo de proporcionar educación y alimento a dos de sus hijos. Hoy en día sus dos hijos son los que le ayudan a cultivar la tierra.

A pesar de no haber asistido a la escuela, el señor Juan es un hombre visionario que lucha de sol a sol para en un futuro poder comprar la tierra que actualmente cultiva junto a sus hijos. El tiene mucha fé de lograrlo porque sus hijos comparten su mismo deseo.

El señor Juan esta solicitando un préstamo a la Fundación Campo para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas. De esta manera el podrá controlar las plagas y enfermedades en el cultivo de fríjol y maíz que plantó en la última semana de agosto. Con el préstamo, el podrá comprar los insumos a mejor precio y pagar un solo transporte para llevarlos a su comunidad. Juan debe recorrer hasta dos kilómetros desde su comunidad para llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos, y otros dos kilómetros hasta el lugar donde cultiva.

Con la venta de su cosecha el planea cancelar el préstamo otorgado por la Fundación,  y comprar unos cerdos y engordarlos para tener otro ingreso durante la época seca. Lo demás el espera ahorrarlo para comprar la tierra donde cultiva. El señor Juan desea poder dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio que los haga sentirse orgullosos de su padre.
texts.en:
Juan is a 67-year-old widower with five children.  Juan has been farming for 55 years.  He learned this activity from his father when he was just 12 years old which kept him from going to school.

Juan states that his prime objective is securing his family’s food needs.  He has shown himself to be a very responsible person.  It’s been 8 years now since he became a widower and was left in charge of providing education and nourishment for his two children.  Today, it’s his two children that help him farm the land.

Despite never having gone to school, Juan is a visionary man who struggles from sunup to sunup to be able to buy a piece of land to farm with his children in the future.  He has much faith that he’ll accomplish this since his children share the same wish.

Juan is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to be able to control infestations and crop diseases in his corn and bean plants that he planted during the last week in August.  With the loan, he’ll be able to buy supplies at a better price and pay transportation costs just once to take them to his community.  Juan must travel almost two kilometers from his community to the place where he buys the supplies and then an additional two kilometers to the place where he does his planting.

With the sale of his harvest he plans to repay the loan granted by the Fundación and also to buy some pigs to fatten up and have another source of income during the dry season.  He plans to save the remainder in order to be able to buy the land he currently farms.  Juan wants to be able to leave his children an estate that will make them proud of their father.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Babylin

texts.en:
Babylin is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Babylin has a grocery shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to support the needs of her family.

In the future, Babylin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy can goods, snacks, coffee and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.en:
Bagrat is 50 years old. He lives in the village of Charnali, Khelvachauri district. Bagrat is married and lives with his wife Leila, two daughters (18 and 17 years old), a son (13 years old) and an 80-year-old mother. His elder daughter is a student and the younger children go to school. 

Bagrat works in local security service. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in his family's agricultural business. The family owns a milk cow and sells dairy products in the village. Also they have 0.8 hectare of land where different types of vegetables and fruits are grown. Harvested products are sold to the greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 680 Georgia Laris (GEL) (approximately $400 USD). 

Bagrat decided to start a small fish farm. He will grow the fish in a dam, which was created by Bagrat in his yard. Bagrat requested credit for purchasing young fish. After couple of months he will start sales of fish, and the family will get additional income. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business and the other part will be used for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase young fish for his fish farm.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 26-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Manal wants to purchase new home furniture such as living room seats and wants to make some repairs to her house by changing the windows. She hasn't enough money to pay for these expenses, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Manal gets the loan, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and to pay for changing her home windows. This will make her live with her family in better living conditions. Manal is a conservative woman, so her husband Ramzi is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and change the house windows.

loans.name: Hyam

texts.en:
Hyam is a 54-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Hyam is sewing from her home and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase materials for her business such as cloth, thread, etc.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her home-based project.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is married with 6 children aged 4 to 15. He has been a maize farmer for 4 years.  He would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow his crop. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo y tiene una hija de 27 años.  Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada como sabanas, ropa en general, calzado, bolsos entre otros productos que le encargan sus clientes, porque vende a crédito en plazos adaptados a las necesidades de estos. En sus inicios como emprendedora, se dedicaba a la venta de prendas de plata y así fue como logró una primera clientela doméstica que poco a poco fue creciendo, con el oportuno servicio que le ofrecía Rosmery y gradualmente le permitió agregar todos los productos como hasta hoy lo hace. Con su negocio ha logrado  pagar la educación de su hija, a quien ha sacado adelante con su propio esfuerzo, pues es profesional de la contaduría pública y ahora ella la apoya con los gastos comunes del hogar. El sueño de Rosmery es ampliar su negocio y algún día comprar su propio vehículo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará calzado, bolsos, prendas de vestir, pues se acerca la temporada de mayor  rentabilidad para su negocio, porque se incrementan tradicionalmente los pedidos que hacen sus clientes y esto es justamente en lo cual basa su inversión y planea que sea exitosa pues con dinero efectivo, logrará  compras en mayor cantidad y con mejores descuentos, lo cual trasladará a sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 46 years old, lives in the municipality of Malambo, and has a 27-year old daughter.  There, she works selling various merchandise, such as sheets, clothes, footwear, and bags, which she provides to her clients on credit with installment periods tailored to their needs.  When she began as an entrepreneur, she sold silver items, and through that, she found her first domestic customers.  These customers began to grow, little by little, with the useful service that Rosmery offered them.  Gradually she was able to accumulate all the products like the ones she sells today.

With her business, she has paid for the education of her daughter, who has succeeded by her own efforts.  Her daughter is now a professional accountant and helps Rosmery with some of the household expenses.  Rosmery's dream is to expand her business and, one day, to buy her own car.  

She is applying for her first loan, which she will use to buy footwear, bags, articles of clothing.  The most profitable period for her business is approaching, because her customers usually begin asking for more things.  This is the reason for her desired investment.  She plans to succeed because with cash, she will be able to buy more with better discounts, which will translate into profits for her.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, and items of clothing.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 54-year-old married woman with five children with aged between 19 and 28. Conchita's husband is a farmer.
