Conchita got involved in farming seven years ago. She helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops to sell. Conchita also grows vegetables. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Conchita hopes to increase her earnings and be better able to sustain her children's education and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Liberato

texts.es: Liberato, de 53 años es un hombre responsable. Vive solo en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Churampi. Su trabajo es variado y diverso. Ahora se encuentra laborando como albañil en la construcción de la municipalidad de su zona, ahí le pagan por contrato hasta que termine la construcción. Pero cuando no tiene estos ingresos, continúa en la agricultura, la actividad que le enseñaron desde niño. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, alverja y maíz. Los cuales cuida con mucho esmero. Cuenta que en la anterior cosecha le fue muy bien, por ello está seguro que esta  nueva siembra le resultara mejor. Además cría animales entre toros y gallinas; las cuales engorda para luego vender a un mayor precio. Ahora está planeando comprar más terrenos agrícolas. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “nueva generación” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente desarrollada, ya que recibirá la ayuda económica que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Por ello promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Liberato de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entra sus cultivos maíz.
texts.en:
Liberato, 53, is a responsible man.  He lives alone in his own house in the Anexo de Churampi.  He does different types of work.  He is now working in construction in his town where he's paid when the job is finished.  But when he doesn’t have any other income, he farms, the work that he was taught when he was a child.  He mostly plants potatoes, peas, and corn which he tends very carefully.  He tells us that his last crop was very good and that is why he is sure that the new one will be better.
He also raises animals such as bulls and hens.  He fattens them up and then sells them for a higher price.  Now he is planning on buying more fields for planting.
He belongs to the united group “New Generation” and this is his third loan with MFP.  He feels strongly that his business is supported since he will receive the financial help that he needs to achieve his goals.  He promises to be punctual with his payments.  Liberato will use the money to buy natural fertilizers to spread among the corn plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shirts, T-shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rema works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading and gasoline retailing.  Rema is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Rema has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 59 years old and a mother of five. She relocated close to a major secondary school in the city and started a general provisions store about 6 years ago. Her store retails items like canned foods, confectionary, beverages (canned and bottled) and pastries. These are well patronized by students and staff of the school and other community members. Hannah would like to expand her operations due to a major expansion works in the school for additional student enrollment this year. She has gone thru KRABAN\'S TEACH learning sessions.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia Gakuo intends to buy water pipes and its fittings for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add beef and pork meat stock

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Mr Clement O. is 45 years old and has five children. He is from Uromi town in Edo State. He sells and repairs electrical appliances and needs the above loan to expand his business.  He has been in this business since 1985.

loans.use: To expand his electrical appliances business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a young mother, doing her best to provide a healthy and happy life for her husband and two children. As with most families in her neighborhood, her husband has a hard time finding consistent work in the off-season for sugar cane, and so Francisca works hard to make up the difference. She is requesting this loan to purchase chickens to prepare and sell in her community.

Francisca is very involved with the local Club de Madres, or Mothers' Club, and her Catholic church. Her goal is to continue expanding her business so that she is able to own and sell more chickens to her community members. She says that she sends her children to a good school so that they can hopefully have a better future than her, but the school costs 60 pesos a day, per child. She is very thankful for this loan because she knows that it will give her a chance to pay for her children’s education, as well as earning enough to supply food, clothes, and shelter.

loans.use: Purchase chickens to prepare and sell

loans.name: Blanca Verónica

texts.es:
After helping her sister with her sales, Blanca decided to become independent and purchased some shoe catalogs that she could offer to her friends. With this money, she helped her husband with the household expenses, since her husband works as a store clerk, and does not earn enough to pay all the costs of the home.

Since she buys the shoes in installments, it takes a long time to recover what she’s invested and stock other shoes. This method is not working well since the money does not come in quickly and if one customer fails to pay, she falls even further behind. Therefore, Blanca is requesting a loan of $575 that she can pay with a six-month term. With this money, she will be able to purchase the merchandise that her customers request as well as other products to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Después de ayudarle a su hermana a vender Blanca decidió independizarse y comprar unos catálogos de zapatos para poder ofrecerle a sus amigas, y con ese dinero poderle ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo trabaja como almacenista y lo que gana es muy poco para poder pagar los gastos del hogar.

Debido a que los zapatos los vende a plazos, tarda mucho tiempo en recuperar lo que invirtió para poder surtir otros zapatos. Esta técnica ya no le está funcionando puesto que el dinero no lo recupera rápido y si una clienta le queda mal en un pago ella se retrasa más. Por lo tanto Blanca está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar la mercancía que le solicitaron y más productos para ofrecerle a sus clientas.

loans.use: Put in customer orders and purchase merchandise for greater variety

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Client History: Rufino is a salaried carpenter. He does not have his own workshop and his wife does not work. He has a 3 year-old son.

This is the second time that he is requesting a loan and Kiva’s support. He repaid his last loan in December and now he is requesting a new one. His file qualifies him as a category 1 client, meaning that he repaid his loan on time. The amount requested will be used to buy manual carpentry tools in order to increase his income, to do furniture repair in general, and to be able to work for himself.

His work enables him to receive this loan because he has experience in his business. This business produces enough income to cover the loan and his personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Rufino es carpintero asalariado no cuenta con un taller propio sus esposa no trabaja, y tiene un hijo de 3 años.

Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y el apoyo de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en el mes de diciembre por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito. Su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de herramientas manuales de carpintería para poder incrementar sus ingresos y realizar arreglos de muebles en general y poder trabajar por cuenta propia

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. Esta actividad le da ingresos suficientes para cubrir tanto el préstamo como sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase of carpentry tools

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en: Alhaji B. is a young man who is trying to improve his livelihood through business.  At the age of 25, Alhaji is managing a general store in Kabala town of Sierra Leone.   His previous loan from SMT diversified his business and he was able to construct the kiosk for the shop from the profit.   With his profits, he supports his parents.  He is requesting an additional loan to expand the business further.

loans.use: Alhaji is a young entrepreneur who would like to strengthen his business further so that he can continue to care for his parents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a dryer

loans.name: Lake J A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty M.. She is currently in the business of poultry rearing and is requesting a loan to improve her poultry house and purchase more poultry. Betty is 48 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 18 to 28 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 200000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase poultry feed. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her poultry business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Harriet N. and Kevin N.. Harriet N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to change his business to sell new clothes. Kevin N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge.

loans.use: To increase poultry inventory

loans.name: Saydali

texts.ru:
Saydali K. lives in Rudaki district. He is 47 and has a secondary school education. He and his wife have five children. Saydali has a business bringing animals into Rudaki from faraway villages, where he can purchase them cheaply. Then he re-sells the animals in his hometown and in nearby Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. His business gives him an income that can support his big family. Saydali is applying for a loan in order to increase his sales volume. This will increase his family's income. Saydali plans to repay his loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Косимов Сайдали житель района рудаки. Ему 47 лет. Он и его жена имеет 5 детей . Образование среднее. Занимается бизнесом. Привозит из дальних кишлаков мелко-рогатый скот , где покупает по более низкой цене. А затем продает в своем районе и в городе Душанбе.( так как Рудаки находится рядом с городом Душанбе).Его бизнес дает доход , который позволяет обеспечивать его большую семью. Сайдали планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить доход , который необходим для его семьи. Погасить кредит Сайдали планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Увеличить товарооборот.

loans.name: Liberacion Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a sweet young woman who lives with her husband and 3 children (ages: 4,6,7) in the beautiful town of Samana. With her first loan, Rosa started a small shop that sells fried foods such as fish, chicken, plantains, etc. She will use this loan to purchase more materials, and she also wants to purchase higher quality meat and fish. She said that when she’s not working, she loves to watch TV, eat chicken, and learn how to be a great businesswoman. She enjoys spending time with her family, and wants her kids to grow up to be professionals in the DR.

All of these women and men are taking out their second loans with Esperanza, and are very excited about the future. Thank you to Kiva lenders for your support and generosity in helping these entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, and oil.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah B. sells sugar, oil, filtered water, and clothes that she sews herself. She is married, but her husband's income from carpentry is not sufficient for her and her three children.  Demand for her goods is high, and she wishes to expand the business to increase profits.
Hannah is requesting a loan of $350 to accomplish this.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Yusta K.. She is married and has four children, aged between 2 and 15. In 2000, Yusta established her small shop business. Working seven days a week, and five to eight hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. Yusta requires a loan in order to buy more goods in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $13. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more goods in bulk.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex E. sells jeans, shirts, and other items of clothing. He is single and focused on developing his future but his income is not sufficient for Alex achieve his dreams. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business

loans.name: Adjala

texts.en:
Adjala I. is married and has 2 children. She has never received schooling. Adjala sells tarazo chippings in Abrobiano at Elmina. She buys the large rocks/stones and manually cracks them into smaller chippings for sale. Her major customers are building contractors.

Adjala has been doing this since 2006. Her husband is a mason. Adjala uses her income to pay housekeeping expenses and utility bills. Adjala will use the loan to purchase more tarazo chippings for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjala plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tarazo chippings for re-sale

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is a wife of M. A. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house that she has lived in for the last 20 years. She is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. Her two younger sons and a daughter are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her other children and her husband work in a furniture-making business. Naziran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy material (such as wood and wood polish) to expand her family's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy meat for her meat-selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell. Shumaila baji wants a loan to buy furniture polisher for her furniture-polishing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for furniture making and other businesses

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie U. sells prepared foods like rice, beans and yams at the front of her house in the evenings (from 5:30–10:30PM). She lives along a busy road and attracts many customers due to the convenience of her location. She needs a loan to purchase more ingredients to cook food and sell to her customers. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare food for resale

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 40 años, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Casi toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura y hoy más que nunca esto le sirve para que pueda sostener a su familia, por ello él y su esposa se levantan muy temprano para poder ir al campo para ver sus tierras y pastear a sus animales, regresan cuando esta por cerrar el día, cuidan celosamente de sus cultivos porque de ellos depende las ganancias de su esfuerzo. Con este trabajo Cesar ha podido establecer su familia y su casa, esporádicamente el sale a la feria ganadera para vender sus animales cuando es una emergencia de gasto  porque la mayor parte es para el consumo propio de su familia. Es la primera vez que Cesar solicita un préstamo en MFP, por lo que s e compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. Solicita este dinero con el que podrá comprar sacos de abono para sembrar papa en una de sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Cesar is 40, lives with his wife and five children. He has worked in farming almost all of his life and now more than ever agriculture helps him support his family, that’s why he and his wife get up very early to go to the land and check on their crops, feed their livestock and return home close to the end of the day, they take jealous care of their crops because on them depends the profit of their effort. With this work Cesar has been able to support his family, his house, sporadically he attends the livestock fair to sell his animals when an emergency expense presents itself, otherwise most of the animals are for his family's consumption. This is the first time that Cesar requests a loan through Microfinanzas Prisma, for which he commits to be punctual on his repayments. He requests the money to buy fertilizer to grow potatoes in his land.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 3 Group

texts.es:
El contacto para  formar el presente comité fue la señora  Irmina Espínola que actualmente pertenece al comité Torype Oñondivepa 
de la zona del Barrio san Miguel, ella es amiga de la señora Zulma V. quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité .
 Este grupo se formo en el barrio San Miguel están en el tercer ciclo con 19 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas entre ellas.
Cada una realiza su propia actividad comercial que les permite acrecentar el ingreso de sus familias, sus mayores preocupaciones son el futuro de sus hijos. Estas actividades se detallan como sigue:
Zulma V. 	Venta de Útiles escolares 
Agar Espínola 	Peluquería 
Andrea Céspedes 	Venta De Ropa  
Isabel B. 	Venta de Bebidas
Maria Dávalos	Venta de Ropa
Nélida P.	Venta de Comidas 
Elodia G.	Modista  
Mercedes R. 	Modista 
Juana S. 	Venta De Ropa  
Aeropagita Beltrán 	Venta De Ropa  
Lilian M. 	Despensa 
Maria B. 	Venta De Ropa  
María G. 	Manicurista 
Isabel Beltrán 	Venta De Ropa  
Dionisia C.	Venta De Remedio 
Victoriana C. 	Venta de Producto de limpieza 
Celidonia E. 	Despensa 
Arcadia A. 	Venta de Bebidas
texts.en:
The contact person to set up this committee was Mrs. Irmina Espínola who presently belongs to the committee "Torype Oñondivepa" of the area of Barrio San Miguel. She is a friend of Mrs. Zulma V. who contacted her neighbors and friends to set up the committee. This groups initiated in the Barrio San Miguel, it is its third cycle with 19 members, one of the most united groups of the area.

Each member carries out a commercial activity that allows them to increase the family income. Their main worry is the future of their children. The activities are listed as follows:

Zulma V., sale of school supplies. Agar Espínola, hairdresser, Andrea Céspedes, sale of clothing, Isabel B., sale of beverages, María Dávalos, sale of clothing, Nélida P., sale of food, Elodia G., dressmaker, Mercedes R., dressmaker, Juana S., sale of clothing, Aeropagita Beltrán, sale of clothing, Lilian M., groceries, María B., sale of clothing, María G., manicurist, Isabel Beltrán, sale of clothing, Dionisia C., sale of medicine, Victoriana C., sale of cleaning products, Celidonia E., groceries, Arcadia A., sale of beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Mrs. Norma P., is 58 years old and a resident of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Mis.Occ. She has 2 kids and one is in college.She owns a "sari-sari store" (small grocery store) that forms part of their house where neighbors are their customers.

Since she already has a college student, Norma decided to improve their small business to support their children better. So she requested a loan at Paglaum MPC in the amount of 10,000Php. Aside from the financial assistance, she also receives add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. She believes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: additional capital for her "sari-sari" store

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
Khanlar K. is 48 years old. He is married with two adorable daughters. He is a small entrepreneur who sells various souvenirs in his store. His store is very famous in his community thus allowing him to have a good clientele. 

Currently, Khanlar has about 800 USD in inventory and his monthly net profit is about US$ 100-120. Today Khanlar is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 14 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. 

Khanlar’s main goal is to educate his beloved daughters so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will be key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase various souvenirs for his store

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres Luchadoras,” or Fighting Women, is a group of 15 women entrepreneurs seeking additional loan funds from Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. The group’s past loans have been successfully repaid and the group hopes to utilize additional loan funds to further business expansion and increase profit levels.

Marisol is one of the coordinators for the group in the city of Santiago. Marisol, mother of three (ages: 14, 5, 1), operates clothing and shoe sales from her home and throughout the streets of her neighborhood. Marisol dreams of improving the lives of her children and being able to pay for their physical needs through the profits of her business. Marisol’s past loan performance demonstrates a dedication to this goal.

Other members of Marisol’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities, including a “colmado” or small grocery store, a small restaurant, beauty supplies and undergarment sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and beans and is requesting a loan to build a storeroom for flour and beans that she can also sell out of. Mary is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: build a storeroom for flour and beans and sell from that storeroom

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg P., 27, is a divorced single mother of two. Her elder daughter Tsogzolmaa is seven and goes to elementary school. The younger daughter is five and attends kindergarten. Her family lives in one of her relatives' homes.

In 2007, she started her clothing retail business at the local market. Once a month, she goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, to buy men's and women's clothing. She mainly purchases cheap pants there for resale. During the last three business years, her working capital has increased from 600,000 tugrugs to 1,000,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD = 1450 MNT).

Oyuntsetseg is a humble and hardworking person. Her hope is to have her own place to live, and to raise her daughters to be good people. Oyuntsetseg requests a loan to buy more men's and women's clothing to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more men's and women's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.es: Jesica es una joven madre soltera de 27 años, que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en la casa de su familia junto a sus 2 hijos, Jeferson de 5 y Yasselin de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una buena vida. Muy cerca al mercado Bellavista (mercado importante de la ciudad de Puno), se encuentra la tienda de descartables de Jessica, ella vende platos, vasos, y demás artículos descartables a muy buen precio, lo que ha hecho que tenga muchos más clientes que el resto de tiendas. Para Jesica su trabajo es muy importante, pues es muy conciente de que gracias a este puede darle a su familia lo necesario para vivir, lleva un año en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es vender y convencer a sus clientes de llevarse algo, espera más adelante mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar mucho, lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir a la calle. Este es el primer préstamo de Jesica en MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal en donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Jesica planea invertir los novecientos nuevos en comprar más descartables, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 27 years old single mother. She lives in her family’s house with her two children, 5 years old, Jeferson and 2 years old, Yasselin. She has struggled to excel in life and hopes to give her children a good life.

Jessica’s store of disposables is located near the Bellavista Market, an important market in the city of Puno. She sells plates, cups, glasses and other disposable goods at very good prices. This has given her more costumers than other stores in the area. Work is very important for Jessica, because she knows that through it she has been able to provide her family with the necessary resources. She has been working at the store for a year and enjoys selling and being able to persuade the costumers who come into the store to buy something. The least favorite part of her work is to stay at the store all day without being able to go anywhere. She would like to enlarge her business and knows that this will require hard work.

This is Jessica’s first loan with MFP. She is committed to pay it on time as not to cause problems to the other members of the communal bank where she is appreciated. Jessica plans to use the nine hundred nuevos to buy more disposable goods to better supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the amount of merchandise

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
"I work on a 1-hectare farm. My parents owned the farm and we have been working it for 15 years already. Aside from the farm, I raise ducks. There 300 ducks in my farm which I use to supplement my income," says Nestor R., 39 years old, not yet married, from Agusan Del Sur. He would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase 2 sacks of feed for ducklings and 1 sack of fertilizer. The loan will help grow his duck and rice farm business.

CEVI aims to help small businesses to grow. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of feed for ducklings and 1 sack of fertilizer

loans.name: Claudia Aurelia

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=73220&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Claudia  antes trabajaba, pero decidió poner una bodega ahora trabaja en su bodega  hace cuatro años.
DesD. que Claudia esta en Finca, se siente mas tranquila , y respaldada con los prestamos. Le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal ha hecho amigas.  
Claudia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para compra D. productos, leche, fideos, arroz. 
El sueño D. Claudia es que su negocio crezca mas y vender abarrotes al por mayor,  quiere ser mayorista.
texts.en:
Claudia's first loan is located here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=73220&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Claudia used to work, but she decided to start a grocery store where she has now worked for four years. Since Claudia has worked with Finca, she feels more peaceful and is supported by her loans. She likes her communal bank's meetings and has maD. friends. Claudia needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to purchase milk, noodles, and rice. Claudia's dream is to grow her business and to become a wholesaler of groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of milk, noodles, and rice

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. sells fresh and smoked fish in Torkor near Kpando. She has received junior high education. She is married and has twelve dependents. Her husband is a fisherman with a small fishing boat and an old net.

Grace has been selling fresh and smoked fish since 2000. She is responsible for all the needs of the twelve dependents. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She is a petty trader (a small-scale salesperson) who sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, canned tomatoes, and bags of rice on top of a table. She says that the products sell very fast and you can easily recover your money and buy stock the next day.

She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With seven years trading experience, she wants to add other foods, like maize and eggs, that are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance.

loans.use: To buy food like cooking oil, rice, spices and canned tomatoes

loans.name: Asia Muhammad Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Asia baji, the wife of M. A., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 20 years. Her husband is a butcher and runs a shop where he sells chicken. He has 5 years of experience in this business. Asia baji is a very supportive and talented lady. She has a business decorating handmade fans. She purchases fans in the market and, after decorating them, she sells them in the community and other areas to earn income. She is applying for a loan to buy more chickens to expand her husband’s chicken business. This loan group consists of four additional people:
  • Shahida baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell.
  • Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy medicine to sell.
  • Najma baji wants a loan to buy vehicles spare parts to sell.
  • Muniran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle).
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Asia baji is seated second from the right in this photo. Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chickens for a chicken business

loans.name: Ilemi A Group

texts.en:
Selina is a member of the Ilemia A borrower group in Mwanjelwa,Mbeya,she is 35 years old woman,she is married  and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 5 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

selina started her own business selling charcoal 6 years ago,she works 1o hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Selina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Selina hopes to save money and expand her business.

Beatrice another member of the same borrower group,she also requested the loan amount 150,000Tsh In order to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand their  business

loans.name: Don De Dieu Plus Group

texts.fr:
Etina B. 32 ans, est présidente du groupe dénommé « Don de Dieu Plus », composé de 24 membres solidairement unis pour bénéficier des prêts octroyés par l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de développer leurs affaires. 
Etina est entrée dans le monde de micro-entreprise depuis 2004. Elle gère sa propre boutique et vend aussi des habits. Elle est cliente fidèle qui a reçu quatre fois les crédits de HOPE RDC et les a totalement remboursés. Le prochain prêt de Kiva lui servira à renforcer le stock en achetant des habits à revendre pour augmenter le bénéfice. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un jour, un grand restaurant à Kinshasa. La rigueur et le sérieux dans le travail sont les éléments qui font prospérer son activité. Etina est mariée et mère de deux enfants âgés de 7 et 16 ans. Tous deux vont à l’école.

loans.use: acheter le stock d'habits à revendre pour accroitre le bénéfice

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is engaged in calamansi (citrus fruit) business.  She plants and sell calamansi in wholesale price.  She has been nine years in the business and she is really enjoying working with the support of her family especially her husband. 

"The power of God within you is greater than the pressures around you”. This quote guides her to live a good life and have patience in order to make her business grow. At present, she wanted to borrow the amount of PHP32, 000.00 to have an additional capital for the maintenance of her business. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 39 años, es separada, vive con sus 2 hijas en su casa propia. Ella tiene una amplia experiencia en el negocio de la ferretería, pero hace 2 años decidió formalizarse arrendando un local donde no sólo vende artículos ferreteros, sino también ofrece el servicio de cerrajería. Todos los días, incluidos los fines de semana, Ana atiende su establecimiento y con su cálido trato logra el retorno de sus clientes, es por eso que en tan poco tiempo su ferretería ha prosperado. Esto la anima aún más porque se siente independiente económicamente y puede solventar las necesidades de sus hijas, quienes son la razón de su esfuerzo. El sueño a futuro de Ana es ampliar su local para incrementar su mercadería. Adicionalmente tienen unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz.
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y a trabajar en conjunto para lograr un clima de solidaridad en su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de hierro, que es uno de los artículos que se vende en su ferretería y tiene mayor demanda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Georgina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Georgina está integrado por Georgina de los Ángeles P., Vilma del Socorro Z.  M. y Heydi Raquel H. G.. 

La señora P. de 36 años vende tomates en el Mercado de Masaya, los tomates son un producto hortícola de consumo nacional. Z. M. tiene año y medio vendiendo ropa interior en Granada y H. G. desde hace un año vende ropa y zapatos ambulante.

Ellas desean poder seguir trabajando e ir aumentado su mercancía, venta y ganancia.
texts.en:
The Georgina group includes Georgina de los Ángeles P., Vilma del Socorro Z. M., and Heydi Raquel H. G..

Mrs. P., ,who is 36 years old, sells tomatoes in the market in Masaya, since tomatoes are a product that is eaten nation-wide. Ms. Z. M. has been selling underwear for a year and a half in Granada, and Ms. H. G. has been traveling and selling clothing and shoes for a year.

They want to continue working and to continue increasing their merchandise, sales, and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes

loans.name: Pilatos Bernardo

texts.pt:
Pilatos nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 32 anos de idade, casado e pai de um filho de 9 anos de idade que se encontra a estudar na escola primária de Boane. Fez 12 classe e espera ingressar no ensino superior no próximo ano. Vive em Boane na casa própria com a família e mais 2 sobrinhos.

Mudou se da cidade de Maputo para Boane no bairro de Mahelane com os seus pais há 12 anos. Actualmente trabalha para uma ONG que lida com o tema de HIV e sida nas comunidades de boane e zonas afins desempenhando as funções de coordenador do projecto há mais de 4 anos e com salário mensal no valor de 8.500,00mt com os quais sustenta a família e poupa algum no Banco comercial (barclays). 

Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na hluvuku no valor de 14.400,00mt para compra de material de construção (chapas de zinco e outros). Os primeiros empréstimos foram para a mesma actividade nos valores de 8.000,00mt e 10.500,00mt, respectivamente.

Compromete se a pagar o crédito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de concluir a obra e posterior apetrechamento.
texts.en:
Pilatos is a 32 year old man from Maputo, Mozambique. He's married and has a 9 year old son that goes to school. He finished 12th grade and hopes to get into college next year. He lives in his own house with his family and two nephews. He currently works as a Project Coordinator for a NGO that instructs people about HIV and AIDS in the nearby communities. He's been doing it for 4 years and makes U$290 per month, money which he uses to support his family and build his house. He is asking for a U$500 loan in order to buy construction supplies and finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor Pedro José Hernández O., tiene la edad de 51 años, habita en la comarca la Borgoña, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su compañera de vida, la cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos, los cuales estudian  y en tiempos libres le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios , don Pedro desde hace 26 años se dedica a la agricultura , el inicio estos trabajos ya que fue beneficiado por el ATN (con el apoyo de la reforma agraria) y logro obtener una propiedad , la cual ha venido trabajado durante este tiempo , agradece a Afodenic , por la buena aprobación de su octavo crédito ; ya que ha logrado mejorar su producción gracias a la asistencia técnica que le brinda . El necesita este préstamo para comprar insumos y fertilizantes que necesita el cultivo ya que en estos últimos meses a sido afectado por plagas.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro José Hernández O. is 51 years old and lives in the area called La Borgoña, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. Together with his life companion, he works as a trader in the market in order to provide for the household expenses. They have two children who are students and help with the farm work during their free time. The plans for his family include improving their living conditions and supporting his children in their education.

Don Pedro has been farming for 26 years. He started in this line of work because he was a beneficiary of the ATN (legislation that supports land reform) and was able to obtain his own property, which he has utilized this entire time. Thanks to AFODENIC, Don Pedro is now on his eighth loan. Because of the technical assistance provided to him, he was able to improve his production. He will use the funds to purchase supplies and fertilizers. In recent months, his crops have been affected by pests.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & farming supplies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is a 33-year-old caring mother of 3 children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She lives in beautiful Dalig village, Antipolo city, Rizal province in the Philippines. Her partner Joel, 37 years old, is a contractor whose income can’t sustain the family's needs.

As a mother, she dreams of sending her children to school through college and dreams of them finding a stable job for a better living. She hopes that her business will grow so they will have savings for future use. Like other poor families here in the Philippines they dream of the best for their family.

With her principle and conviction to get out of poverty, in 2009, she decided to join Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During her previous loans, she carefully invested in her business, which is buying and selling rice. Now on her second loan, she has asked for the amount of 10,000 pesos as additional capital, still for the same business, and also she plans to get involved in small catering of foods. Specifically, the loan will be used to purchase sacks of rice for selling, and vegetables, meats, and so on for the small catering business. This will be a great help for Gemma and her family because ASHI and Kiva are at their side to support those dreams.

loans.use: To buy 7 sacks of rice (7,000 pesos) and supplies for catering (3,000 pesos)

loans.name: Nais Patricia

texts.es:
Nais Patricia Cortéz T. es una señora de 47  años de edad quien vive con su esposo y tres de sus cinco hijos en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio

Doña Nais desde hace 20 años que tiene su propio negocio exactamente un taller de mecánica,  dice que tiene mucho apoyo por parte de sus vecinos ya que son sus principales clientes los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos por el servicio que brinda; con este negocio ha logrado tener  una actividad económica rentable que ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene y la ha ayudado a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢675.000(seiscientos setenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar materiales de construcción  tales como: baldosas, columnas, madera, cemento entre otros para mejorar y ampliar  el local así podrá brindar más y mejores servicios a sus clientes con mayor comodidad. 

Doña Nais es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Nais Patricia Cortéz T. is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and three of their five children in a community called Canalete, located in Upala province of Alajuela. It has a semi-mountainous terrain. Their activities are associated to agriculture and mostly farming. This is a community with great development opportunities and for the establishment of microenterprises, not only for the farming industry, but also for commerce. Nais has owned an auto shop for 20 years. She has a lot of support from her neighbors, as they are her main clients, who are very satified with her service. She managed to maintain a profitable activity, as this is the only income she has, which has allowed her to improve her family’s quality of life. As for now, she needs a ¢675.000 loan (six hundred and seventy five colones) to purchase construction material such as tiles, pillars, cement and others to improve and expend her business and to provide a better service for her clients in a more comfortable space. Nais is a member of the Canalete Community Lending Company, one of the 100 organizations members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and with it she expects to continue growing and a personal and monetary level. She also hopes to activity participate in her commercial activities for her community.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to improve and expand her shop

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
la señora Maria Suyapa C. tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive en el barrio Buenos Aires. Maria se dedica al comercio, tiene 3 años de tener su negocio propio, Maria vende 
comida, granos basicos, perfumes, zapatos, sandalias y mucho mas.
necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes y a veces se queda sin producto para la venta.
Maria se siente feliz ya que en poco tiempo esta viendo frutos de su negocio. su sueño es tener una tienda grande en la cual pueda tener de todo tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood. Maria is engaged in commerce and has had her own business for three years. Maria sells food, dried goods, perfumes, shoes, sandals, and much more.

She needs this loan to stock her business since the demands of her customers are great and sometimes she is left without any goods to sell. Maria is happy that, in only a short time, she has started seeing the fruits of her business. Her dream is to have a large store where she can have all types of product.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, pork, beef, sugar, rice, beans, sodas, juices, candy, soups, pastas, sauces, condiments and cakes

loans.name: Arcie

texts.en:
Arcie A. is from the village of  Naawan, Misamis Oriental. He is 52 years old. Arcie is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Arcie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish and ready-to-wear items in the local community. Arcie has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arcie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arcie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Arcie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco  tiene 33 años de edad está casado con la Sra. Natalia Rojas  hace 8 años  y vive en casa propia en la  compañía Tajy Loma de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.
       Él  empezó desde los 15  años a tejer  la tradicional sobrecama  que su padre llevaba a vender por la zona  de Luque,  hace más 20 años. Atrás  que su papá le dejo  totalmente a su cargo ya que el mismo no podía mas por su edad. 
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudieron comprarse dos motocicleta  la cual lo utiliza para realizar sus ventas, actualmente viaja con su Sra.  Llevan a vender los productos de las Artesanía de la zona ya con clientelas bien formada. 
         Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, sabanas y hamaca y otros.
texts.en:
Francisco, 33, has been married to Natalia Rojas for 8 years. He lives in his own house in Compañía Tajy Loma in the city of Carapeguá; they have two, school-age children. Since the age of 15, he has woven traditional bedspreads that his father would take to the Luque area to sell. A little over 20 years ago his father left him completely in charge because he, himself, could no longer work due to his advanced age. Thanks to his hard work and effort they were able to buy two motorcycles, which they use for their sales. Currently, he travels with his wife. They take the crafts throughout the zone where they have well-established regular customers. He is asking for funding to buy bedspreads, sheets, a hammock and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets, a hammock, etc.

loans.name: El Comienzo Group

texts.en:
The Comienzo Group consists of four women entrepreneurs: Esmirna G. V., Deysi del Socorro V., Serapia Gómez Alemán and Doris del Socorro. The principal activity in Esmirna’s business is selling tomatoes, bell peppers, and onions in the Oriental Market, where she has been working for 20 years. Recently her situation has been more difficult due to rising prices for these products as well as a shortage. Her husband, who lost his job, has recently begun a new business of purchasing and selling wood and lumber.

The other women in the group hope to grow their respective businesses: Deysi sells lumber; Serapie has a small general store, and Doris sells beverages and foods such as vegetables in the busy Oriental Market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Thereas

texts.en: Thereas sells iced fish retail. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers and hopes to grow it. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children all of whom attend school. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their household. She hopes for a loan  of N80,000 to purchase more iced fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more iced fish to sell

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 33 years old and married with three children, ages 2, 4 and 7. Innocent's wife is a farmer. Even though this activity does not bring in more money, it is helpful for the family. Both of them work hard in order to provide all the basic needs of their family. Innocent himself has chosen to be a businessman simply because it is more profitable than agriculture. Innocent is seasoned in this career. This is his fifth successful year in business. His shop is open from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening, every day except on Sunday.

Innocent is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing his business and resolving some family problems such as school fees for his children and other needs like good quality food. This loan will be helpful for his family and for his community, who will be satisfied by the products from his shop.

loans.use: To expand his business and for school fees, etc.

loans.name: Parissi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Parissi de l’association Dori est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, région de Ségou, quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 26 ans, au moins 4 enfants et font l’achat et la vente de d’articles divers tels l’arachide,  les condiments alimentaires, les boissons etc. 
Ce groupe est à son deuxième prêt  solidaire après avoir bien remboursé le premier.
Sara D. qui la présidente du groupe Parissi évolue dans l’alimentaire avec l’achat et la vente de boissons. Elle est la représentante de la société Bramali (brasserie du Mali) à Tominian. Elle vend toutes sortes de boissons et cela il y'a environ 10 ans. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter, des casiers de sucreries auprès de sa Société qui produit des boissons. Elle ravitaille les revendeurs et les petits villages environnants de Tominian au comptant très généralement. 
Sara envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 21.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour agrandir l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The group Parissi of the association Dori is composed of married women from the city of Tominian, region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women live in traditional extended families, average 26 years of age, and have least four children.  The women buy and sell a variety of goods, such as peanuts, condiments, beverages, etc. The group members are on their second solidarity loan after having repaid the first one.  Sara D., who is the president of the group, works in the area of foodstuff by buying and selling beverages.  She is the sales representative of the Bramali Company (brewery of Mali) in Tominian.  She has been selling all kinds of drinks for about ten years.  She intends to use her loan for buying cases of soft drinks from the Company, which produces beverages.  Generally accepting cash, she resupplies retailers and the villages surrounding Tominian. Sara envisions making a profit of 21,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to expand her enterprise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying soft drinks

loans.name: Cheryl Marlene

texts.en:
Cheryl Marlene L. is 35 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Cheryl Marlene has 1 year of experience in this business.  Cheryl Marlene needs a loan of WST $1000 to maintain vehicle.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Cheryl Marlene joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Cheryl Marlene's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to maintain vehicle

loans.name: I Will Do My Best Group

texts.en:
Hawa B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called I Will Do My Best. She is 20 years old, married, and has a 5-year-old child. She also cares for two siblings. She did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For four years, Hawa has been selling lappas (traditional clothing) on a table at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She serves her customers in a nice manner, which keeps them returning. But she faces problems with insufficient funds to operate her business.

Hawa started selling from profits generated from a friend’s business when helping her friend to sell. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more lappas for sale. Her goal is to build a bigger shop that can sustain her family in the future.

Hawa describes herself as a good Liberian business woman selling in the Redlight market.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Hawa is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more lappas (traditional clothing) for resale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda B. is from the village of Vira. She is 45 years old, widowed and has 2 school-aged children. Imelda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Imelda has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo tiene 48 años, su actividad económica es el taller de carpintería. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza créditos él se siente muy motivado por continuar trabajando pues es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido mantener activo su negocio. Los que ofrece en su vivienda, el trabaja con ciertas herramientas rusticas, sus 2 hijos menores que son los que están a su cargo le ayudan en lo que pueden en su actividad, por lo que esto hace que Reynaldo se sienta muy orgulloso. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de clavos, pega, maque, madera y herramientas. Siempre sueña con ampliar su pequeño taller y proporcionarle a su familia una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 48 years old. His business is a carpentry shop. He has operated this business for more than 21 years, so this is not the first time that he has taken out a loan. He feels very motivated to continue working, since the loans have allowed him to keep his business active. He works in his home using simple tools, and his two younger sons, who are still in his care, help him as best they can with the business, which makes Reynaldo feel very proud. The loan will be used for working capital, to purchase nails, glue, lacquer, wood and tools. His ongoing dream is to expand his little workshop and provide his family with a more comfortable standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Masias

texts.es: Masias, 46 años, es casado y tiene 6 hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en la selva tropical, donde tienen su propia casa. Hace más de 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de cacao y café, siendo la mayoría de las veces sus ventas muy exitosas. Con el tiempo ha logrado tener su propia molinera de arroz, en donde produce y vende a sus clientes a un precio competitivo, y eso le da mucha satisfacción económica. Generalmente trabaja con su esposa e hijos desde las 5 de la mañana hasta 8 de la noche, siendo su punto de venta al frente del mercado de su misma localidad. Por otro lado sus campos cultivados son cuidados y protegidos por sus operarios de confianza, pero en lo posible supervisa sus plantaciones cacao y café. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando con sus cuotas establecidas durante las fechas establecidas, además esta satisfecho con la institución, ya que lo brinda muchas facilidades de crédito. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su molinera de arroz, además derivará en la compra de insumos para su molinera.
texts.en:
Masias is 46 years old, married and has six children. They all live in the town of San Francisco, located in the tropical jungle where they have their own house. For the last twenty years he has been working in the agricultural field, specifically the growing and selling of cocoa beans and coffee. He has been successful with this business most of the time. With time he has bought a rice mill. He sells rice flour at a competitive price to his customers. This helps him economically. Generally he works with his wife and children from five in the morning until eight at night. He sells his product in the market in his town Trustworthy workers care for and protect his fields and crops. If he is able, he also looks after his cocoa and coffee plantations. This is his eighth loan with MFP. He is committed to paying back his loan payments on the due dates. He is very happy with this institution that allows him to get a loan. With the loan that he is requesting he will invest in the maintenance of his rice mill and also buy raw materials for the mill.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his rice mill.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely M. is from the village of Villa Corazon. She is 42 years old. Fely is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fely is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Fely from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tia

texts.en:
Tia T. is 53 and married with six children (ages 10 - 35).  She owns a business selling lava-lavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Tia has many years of experience in this business.  Tia needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2009, Tia joined SPBD.  This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik G.  was born in 1968 in Yerevan. She is married and has a son and a daughter. Her husband works in an ice-cream factory. At present, her son is in the army, protecting the Armenian state boarder. Her daughter is a student.

For about 10 years, Nazik has engaged in a  trading business. Nazik rents a stall in a trade center in Yerevan near her house, where she resells fruit and vegetables, which she buys from Malatia food market.  Nazik is a very lively person and she works very hard and thanks to that, she has a big quantity of customers, who are glad to do their shopping from Nazik's stall.

The profits from her sales allow her to take care of the needs of her family; supporting her son in the army; paying for her daughter's education. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 AMD to add her fruit and vegetable assortment.

loans.use: To add to her  fruit and vegetable assortment

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora, D. 61 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eduardo D. 64 años y su hijo menor, Gustavo D. 21 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Teodora, es el cultivo D. maíz y alfalfa, en las chacras que con tanto esfuerzo compró. Es así que trabaja todos los días en los campos, procurando que los insectos y que el cambio del clima no perjudique sus plantaciones, una vez llegada la temporada D. cosecha, sus productos son vendidos en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es la libertad que tiene cuando trabaja sus chacras, D. esa manera han transcurrido 30 años realizando esta actividad, aunque a veces le es pesado tener que transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, debido a que le es difícil conseguir un carro que quiera llevarla. En lo sucesivo espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, como la ha sido en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y esta muy comprometida con el desarrollo D. sus grupos. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Teodora, 61, is a woman who has always fought to get ahead in life. She lives in her own home with her husband, Eduardo, 64, and her youngest son, Gustavo, 21, for whom she wants to proviD. a better quality of life. Teodora is a corn and alfalfa farmer on farmland that she bought with much effort. Every day she works the fields making sure that the insects and climate changes don’t damage her plants. Once harvest time arrives the products are sold in Tarma’s wholesale market. What she likes the most about her work is the freedom she has while working in the fields. Thirty years have passed in this activity although it is sometimes very difficult to have to transport her products to market because it’s not easy to find a car willing to take it. In the future she’d like to buy more land in order to increase production. This is her 4th loan with MFP. She knows that she must be punctual with her repayments like she’s been so far to date. She is a very supportive member of her communal bank and she’s committed to her group’s development. She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more manure for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more manure.

loans.name: Mamón Group

texts.es: El grupo Mamón lo integran tres féminas trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es la Filena del Rosario
texts.en: Mamón Group is made up of three hardworking women who put effort into their work.  One of these women is Filena del Rosario

loans.use: To purchase leather, shoe soles, glue, etc.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar tiene 61 años, esta no es la primer vez que realiza financiamientos. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general hace mas de 14 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que conoce muy bien lo que sus clientes le solicitan.  A pesar de su edad tiene todas las energías y ganas de salir adelante por lo que busca la forma de  sobrevivir. El recorre todo los días las calles bajo este inmenso sol, logrando obtener nuevos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como sandalias, ropa, cosméticos entere otros.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 61 years old, and this is not his first loan.  He sells general merchandise, and he has been in this business for over 14 years.  Therefore, he really knows what his customers want.

In spite of his age, he has much energy and the desire to get ahead as he looks for the way to survive.  Every day he travels the streets under the interminable sun, and he manages to get new customers.

The loan he is requesting is to buy raw material like sandals, clothes, and cosmetics, among other things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 34 year old single man. He has been the owner of a grocery store since 2000, and has 20 years of experience in the business. Other than other grocery items, Mohammad also sells charcoal, which is necessary for BBQs and hookahs (waterpipes). This is the second loan Mohammad has requested from Al Majmoua, which he will use to pay for the rest of his pickup truck. Mohammad's clients are his neighbors, relatives, foreigners and nearby shops. His clients say that his experience makes his products special and unique. He hopes to expand his business into the wholesale market.

loans.use: To pay for the rest of his pickup truck.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila O. is the leader of this group. She is 56 years old and she is married. Her husband is engaged in farming in spite of his being a pensioner (his pension is about 3300 soms per month). The couple has raised a son, 34, who earns money by selling timber. 

Jamila runs her own business which involves sewing national clothes. This businesslike woman has a mini-workshop with necessary equipment. Out of total profits, the family has managed to open a small grocery shop. In order to purchase a sewing-machine and supplies for making her national clothing, Jamila hopes to get a loan. In the future she is planning to sell all her working data.

Jamila’s partners:

Karybek T., 63, is married. He has a son. Karybek and his wife raise money by cultivating and selling crops. During 10 years of working hard, the family has managed to increase cattle stock. The loan purpose is to purchase wheat and chemical fertilizers. 

Rahimberdi M., 52, is married. His family has 4 children. The family makes their income by cattle breeding; currently they are keeping 6 cows and 8 other livestock animals. The loan purpose is to purchase 3 livestock animals for increasing the total number of stock.

Gulnar C. is the treasurer of the group. She is 52 and widowed. Being alone, she has to bring up 4 children. The family makes money by cattle breeding and selling dairy products. In order to increase cattle stock, Gulnar intends to obtain a calf. For this purpose, she needs to get a loan. 
	
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing-machine.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El Señor Ramiro  comerciante, el  se dedica a la venta de ropa para varones en la actualidad cuenta con tres puestos de venta dos en anticrético y uno en alquiler, sus puestos son muy bien decorados y muy presentables la ubicación estratégica le favorece para la venta sus productos ya que se encuentra en la salida del centro comercial el importa su mercadería de Perú esta semana tiene planeado viajar para abastecerse antes de las  fiestas de fin de año ya que es época  de venta para todos sus productos, para eso solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería, el entrega también por mayor a clientes que le hacen pedidos, es una persona muy trabajadora de buen carácter, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a merchant who sells men's clothing.  He currently has three sales locations: two are leased and one is rented.  His stores are well decorated and presentable.  They are in a strategic location near the commercial center which helps sales.  

He imports his merchandise from Peru.  This week is he planning to travel to stock up on merchandise before the holiday season when there is a high volume of sales.  He will also buy in bulk for customers who have placed orders.

He is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise for his stores.  He is a very hard working person with a good character.  

He is thankful to this institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: Purchase men's clothing

loans.name: Sikoe Ole

texts.en:
Sikoe Ole N. is 36 years old. He is married to Naropill N. and is a father of eight school-going children. 

Sikoe is a farmer and has been farming his own piece of land for the last ten years.

He learnt about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to do spend forty thousands to prepare the land for the next planting season and spend the remaining ten thousand to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his maize plantation. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his maize output and use some part of the profit to develop his own plot.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more maize in large scale.  Sikoe believes he is hardworking and with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To prepare land for planting, and buy chemicals & fertilizer

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto D. is from the village of Tapon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 43 years old and married, with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Roberto owns  and operates a sari-sari (general) store, where he sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods  and beverages. Roberto has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Roberto joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roberto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Roberto is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as snack foods and beverages.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past twenty years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces milk and coffee which he sells locally. He also runs a small business in the same region.

He has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve the livelihood of his family. He plans to improve his dairy farming in the future by acquiring more dairy cows that will increase his income.

Joseph is 56 years old and married with four children who are all adults.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Isai

texts.en:
Isai is 35 years old. He is married with one child who is two years old. He is a carpenter. He makes and repairs home and office furniture (e.g. tables, chairs, beds, wardrobes, etc.).  He employs five people in his business.

He will use this loan to add to his stock of wood.  He says that once he gets this loan, he will make a profit and pay the school fees of his child and improve the welfare of the family.

loans.use: To increase his stock of wood.

loans.name: Yaqueline De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Yaqueline tiene 23 años de edad, y reside junto a su hijo en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ovinos, los cuales engonrda con alimento balanceado, para que una vez alcancen un nivel de desarrollo adecuado, los comercializa a los vecinos de la zona y a los comerciantes que llegan a su región.  Esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y a la vez apoyar a su familia económicamente.

Yaqueline desea comprar más alimento balanceado para la crianza de su ganado, y así incremente sus ingresos por las ventas realizadas.  Por ello ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
