Yaqueline is 23-years-old and she lives with her son in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura, located 4 hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. 

She raises sheep on a balanced diet so that they can reach the appropriate weight to sell to her neighbors in the area and traveling merchants that come to the region. This activity permits her to pay her personal expenses and support her family economically.

Yaqueline wants to buy more feed for her flock in order to increase her income. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles ($200 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her sheep

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok P., age 31, is a photographer in a local shop in Phnnom Penh City. She has worked at this business since 2000. She is unmarried and lives with her elderly mother, a homemaker who cooks good meals for the family members living with her. 

Sok P. would like to request a loan in order to buy furniture for her mother's house. This loan will provide those who live in the house with a greater level of comfort.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her mother's house, where she lives with other members of her family

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a single man who rents a house that has neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expense are personal expenses and helping his extended family. 

He has operated a milk business for the past one year, selling retail and door-to-door to his neighbours. In addition he also operates a vegetable stall. Daniel faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase fresh milk from farmers to resell to retailers. He decided to join Yehu because of the availability of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase fresh milk from farmers to sell to retailers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 50-year-old married woman with four children. With one of her children in school, Nelly works very hard to provide for them.

Nelly runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Nelly has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. Nelly also earns income as a retailer of gasoline and charcoal. 

In the future, Nelly would like to finish the education of her child and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Damira

texts.en:
Damira A. is 46, single and has two school-aged children. She sews Kyrgyz national traditional products, such as souvenirs, coverings and cushions made out of wool and felt. She started this activity in 2005 with initial capital of 5,000 KGS and has managed to raise her floating capital to 50,000 KGS.

Damira has applied for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase a stitching machine and cotton for her products. It will allow her to increase her sales and enlarge her client base. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business and save money to provide a good education for her children. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a stitching machine and cotton

loans.name: Olga Lucía

texts.es: Olga Lucía desde hace 20 años trabaja como Profesional de Belleza, sin embargo desde hace 17 años ella tiene su sala de belleza en su casa, donde atiende a todos clientes y les brinda un espacio para la buena atención, es por esto que para poder tener una mejorar su servicio y así incrementar sus clientes Olga Lucía necesita dotar la sala de belleza con implementos necesarios para su servicio, además de esta forma puede incrementar sus  ingresos y continuar enseñándole a su hija esta labor que por 20 años ha sido su forma de vida.
texts.en: Olga Lucía has worked as a beauty professional for 20 years. For the past 17 years, she has run a beauty salon out of her home where she provides all of her customers with special care and attention. This is how she has been able to improve her customer service and thus gain more customers. Olga Lucía needs to equip her beauty salon with the necessary supplies. What's more, this will allow her to increase her income and continue teaching her daughter the profession that has been her way of life for 20 years now.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies.

loans.name: Pandukht

texts.en:
Pandukht G. lives in Suser with his wife and four children. He works at the village hall as an accountant, but the salary is not enough to meet the family needs. So Pandukht is also engaged in agriculture. His farm includes 3 cows, 20 sheep, 1 pig and 2 turkeys. He grows 2 hectares of corn, 2 hectares of barley, and 1.77 hectares of alfalfa. The family receives its income from agriculture. 

Pandukht has applied to SEF to increase the livestock. With the requested loan he plans to develop the agriculture and ensure a prosperous life for his children.

loans.use: To pay for livestock.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 23 years old and single.   He sells scrap metals to earn a living. He joined the Baraka Ukweli group in Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access loans easily, because the members of the group guarantee each others loans.  Through the group, he has requested 20,000 KES to buy scrap metals.  Joshua hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals.

loans.name: Rona Lorraine

texts.en:
Rona Lorraine is single and 30 years old. She has a general store where she sells rice, oil, different kinds of groceries such as noodles, biscuits, shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, coffee and many kinds of dry goods. Rona Lorraine has had this business for almost eight years. According to her, the items that are easily disposed of are the rice, oil, coffee, milk, ingredients and eggs because all these are the basic needs.

Rona Lorraine is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional rice, cooking ingredients, milk, oil and eggs. She is grateful for the development of her retail store. She usually earns about PHP 12,000 each month in this kind of business. 

In the future, Rona Lorraine hopes to improve her business by buying additional products needed in her village and to save some of her profit to have some savings when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy additional rice, cooking ingredients, milk, oil and eggs to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is forty years old and married to Rebecca, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with four children. He has been a miner for the past two years which earns him a monthly income of 2,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

Robert is applying for his sixth loan from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy mining tools. Robert will use the anticipated profits to expand his mining area.

Robert’s dream is to have his own tractor.

loans.use: to buy mining tools.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 56 años de edad quien se dedica al comercio de productos AVON desde hace 10 años. Con este negocio saco adelante a sus dos hijos de 14 y 19 años los cuales le ayudan en el negocio.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, perfumes y cremas que tiene de encargo.
texts.en: Mrs. Ana Maria is a hardworking and enterprising 56-year-old woman. She has been selling AVON products for the past ten years. With this loan she will be able to help her children, ages 14 and 19, progress with the business as they currently assist her with the business. This loan will be used to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and creams.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en: Savorn is 59 year old. She sells fertilizer, oil and cake with her husband. Their income is $5 per day. She has three children. One of the children is studying and other two are working with $5 per day for each. Every month she has to spend $75 on food, $15 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $5 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy more fertilizer and oil to sell. She wants to enlarge her business when she has enough money. She plans to repair her house to be more comfortable to stay.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and oil to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El señor Jaime tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de muebles usados.
Está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en un nuevo negocio que es de venta y reparación de llanas para carro y así tendrá mayor ganancia para su familia ya que la venta de neumáticos es más productiva. 
Don Jaime planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá con el nuevo negocio, ya que con la venta de los muebles pagara los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jaime has been engaged in selling used furniture for more than five years.
He is requesting a loan to invest it in starting a new activity: selling and repairing car tires. This way he will earn extra money for his family, because tire sale is more profitable.
Jaime plans on repaying the loan with the earnings he will obtain from his new activity, while with the furniture sale activity he will pay for family expenses and for the education expenses of his children.

loans.use: To invest it in starting a car tires sale activity.

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.ru:
Нурлан – 36-летний фермер, занимающийся разведением скота и полеводством. Опыт в этой сфере,  полученный с самого раннего детства, и упорный каждодневный труд позволили ему стать успешным аграрием. 
Начав свою деятельность в посадки семян картофеля на общую сумму около 2,000 сом (KGS), Нурлан смог развить ферму с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Сегодня, в его хозяйстве насчитывается 3 лошади и 10 баранов, а также 1 га поливной земли, где он выращивает картофель и кормовые культуры. 
Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурлан обратился в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов. Доходы он планирует вложить в реконструкцию своего дома. В ближайшем будущем , Нурлан, являющийся заботливым сыном престарелой матери,  мечтает женится и стать отцом.    
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Nurlan is a 36-year farmer who raises animals and grows crops. Many years of experience, from a very early age on, and  hard daily work have allowed him to   become a successful farmer.

Having launched his business by planting potato seeds for the total sum of about 2,000 KGS, Nurlan has been able to develop a farm with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. Today he has three horses and 10 sheep, as well as 1 ha [2.5 acres] of workable land, where he  grows potatoes as well as plants used for animal feed.

In order to develop his business further, Nurlan turned to “Bai Tushum and Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy sheep. He plans to use his earnings in order to rebuild his house. In the near future, Nurlan, who is a loving son to his aged mother, would like to get married and start a family. MFC “Bai Tushum and Partners” offers loans through Kiva to socially vulnerable populations. MFC “Bai Tuhsum and Partners” is a leading microfinance company in Kyrgzystan. “Bai Tushum and Partners” is a reliable financial partner which contributes to the economic development in Kyrgystan through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 48 years old and divorced with four children, age 11 to 30. She runs a furniture store in Kroo town in the central part of Freetown. She has four employees working with her. She also takes care of four relatives. 

Gladys has been in this business for 10 years and sells beds, chairs, mirror glass and dining tables at her store. She also earns income from supplying imported eggs to customers. She says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of transportation from one place to another.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more timber for her furniture business. Gladys says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her business. In the future, she would like to open a showroom.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for her furniture business.

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.ru: Юлдузхон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 22 года. Замужем. У нее 4 детей. Она уже три года как занимается растениеводством. Юлдузхон выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Yulduzkhon lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 22 years old, married and has four children.  She has been involved in agriculture for three years.  Yulduzkhon grows vegetables and wheat for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: El Quisco Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “El Quisco”, lo conforman 19 emprendedoras quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía, bisutería, preparación de productos de amasandería, repostería y bazar. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de San Antonio. 
Adela presidenta del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra delante del grupo, sentada en una silla y usa lentes, bufanda blanca, chaqueta negra y pantalones negros.
Se dedica a la confección y reparación de ropa, desde hace 30 años, trabaja desde su casa, ahí cuenta con dos máquinas de coser costura recta y una máquina overlock. Confecciona ropa de trabajo para pescadores, pecheras y mangas, además de reparaciones de ropa durante todo el año a pedido.
Sus insumos los compra en la ciudad de Santiago.  También se dedica a la preparación de ceviches y mariscales, desde su casa y de manera artesanal. Para continuar con éste negocio debe tener un local amplio, por lo que pretende ocupar la cocina de su casa, para obtener los permisos de salubridad. 
Con el crédito comprárá potes, envases, bolsas, bidones de jugo de limón, para la preparación de mariscales.
Sus metas son ampliar sus dos negocios, el de costuras y en un futuro establecerse con un local establecido para vender sus productos de mar. 
Adela vive junto a su marido, sus dos hijas de 29 y 24 años de edad, además de dos nietos. Sus sueños son generar mayores ingresos para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, respecto al grupo Adela se siente muy cómoda ya que las reuniones son amenas, el grupo es comprometido y afiatado. Sobre las capacitaciones ellos se encuentran muy entusiasmados. 
San Antonio es un puerto de la región de Valparaíso, siendo esta una de sus principales características, ubicado en el litoral central de Chile. Se desarrolla en forma importante la pesca y venta de pescados y mariscos. Pese a la actividad portuaria y comercial del puerto, existe un alto índice de cesantía.
texts.en:
The "El Quisco" community bank is made up of 19 entrepreneurial women who work in different industries, including the crafts, jewellery making, baking and retail. They all live in the city of San Antonio. 

Adela is the president of the community bank and in the picture she is sitting down in front of the group. She is wearing glasses, a white scarf, a black jacket and black trousers. She has been making and repairing clothes for 30 years. She works from home, where she has two sewing machines - one for straight stitches and an overlock one. She makes working clothes for fishermen, aprons and sleeves, as well as repairs on demand all year long. She buys her materials in the city of Santiago. Before she used to make ceviche and seafood soup, but her business was shut down because she didn't have purpose-built premises. In order to continue with the business she has to have spacious premises, even if that means occupying the kitchen in her home, to ensure high levels of hygiene. 

With the loan she will buy pots, containers, bags and cans of lemon juice to prepare seafood dishes. Her goals are to expand her two businesses, the sewing business and in the future to have stable premises for her seafood selling business. 

Adela lives with her husband, her two daughters aged 29 and 24 and two grandchildren. Her dream is to generate more income to provide her family with a better quality of life. She is very happy and grateful for the services received from Fondo Esperanza. She is also very pleased with Grupo Adela, because the meetings are  fun and the group is committed, trustworthy and enthusiastic about the training. San Antonio is a port in the Valparaiso region, located in the central coast of Chile. The main industries are fishing and trading in fish and seafood. In spite of the commercial and shipping activity there is a high rate of unemployment at the port.

loans.use: to buy pots, containers, bags and cans of lemon juice

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is now 53 years of age and lives with her five children. She is now a widow but she has strong faith and a determination to improve their standard of living and give her children a bright future. 

The main source of their income is from farming: they plant rice and vegetables and raise livestock for sale. They have been in this business for almost 18 years and usually earn a profit of only 7,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. Their profits are utilized for their basic necessities and daily expenses of their children. 

They often suffer from financial difficulties due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, but through their patience and hard work, they can afford their basic necessities. She aims to improve her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income. But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. She is hoping that the loan will help a lot to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Mario Fidel

texts.es:
Don Mario tiene 30 años de edad, es un comerciante de mariscos desde hace siete años quien vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos.
 Él distribuye a toda la zona oriental, lo que son pescados y camarones generalmente a restaurantes, el cliente se levanta todos los días por la madrugada para llegar a las playas y comprar los  mariscos frescos y comprar por mayoreo. 
Luego visitan los restaurantes que con anterioridad le han hecho pedidos para dejar el producto. Él se moviliza en un vehiculó que compro de la venta de mariscos y con mucho esfuerzo lo han ido pagando con responsabilidad y puntualidad lo que él mismo menciona le hace sentirse muy orgulloso porque entiende la importancia de tener un record excelente en sus créditos. 
Don Mario necesita su préstamo, para contar con fondos y comprar el producto que comercializa pero en cantidades grandes para poder venderlo por libra y de esta forma obtener ganancia que le ayuden al sustento diario de sus hijos y esposa. 
Él es sumamente conocido en la zona y tiene muchas amistades que le compran mariscos. Uno de sus objetivos primordiales en la vida es darle a sus hijos una buena educación y con ello asegurar que en el futuro puedan defenderse y tengan la oportunidad de superarse cosa que él no tubo por circunstancias de la vida.
texts.en:
Don Mario is 30, and lives with his wife and five children. He has been selling seafood for seven years. He distributes to all of the eastern region; fish and shrimp, mostly to restaurants. He gets up every day early in the morning, to get to the beaches and buy fresh seafood at wholesale. Then he visits the restaurants that have previously put in orders for him to deliver his product. 

He gets around in his vehicle that he bought from the proceeds of his seafood sales. He has been gradually paying it off with a lot of effort, being responsible and on time with his payments. He himself comments that this makes him feel very proud; because he understands the importance of having an excellent record with his loans.  

Mario needs his loan in order to have working capital and to buy the product he sells; but in large quantities so that he can sell it by the pound. This way he earns profits that help him support his wife and children from day to day.  He is extremely well-known in the area, and has a lot of friends who buy seafood from him. 

One of his fundamental aims in life is to provide his children with a good education, and that way make sure that they can get by in the future, and have the opportunity to improve themselves; something that he didn't have because of his circumstances in life.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Мирзоали женатый,  имеет одного ребенка. На протяжении 11 лет занимается откормом крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Скотоводство приносит хорошие доходы. Мирзоали хочет получить займ для закупа корма и крупного рогатого скота. Он надеется на одобрение  займа.
texts.en: Mirzoali is married and has one child.  He has been involved in fattening up cattle and small livestock for 11 years.  Animal husbandry brings in good earnings.  Mirzoali wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of fodder and cattle.  He hopes to have this loan approved.

loans.use: to buy fodder and cattle

loans.name: Areli

texts.es: Areli de 24 años de edad, es una madre soltera de un hijo de 7 años a quien dedica su vida y trabajo. Vive solo con su mamá, en la comunidad de Pucharini. Con el dinero que recibe de la mantención de su ex pareja, Areli puede darle a su pequeño hijo una educación decente, pero como es consciente que al pasar el tiempo siempre surgen nuevas necesidades se encargó de hacer producir las parcelas de sus padres, en ellas siembra paltas, café y plátanos. A la vez cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes, verduras, gaseosas y demás productos los que vende en una bodega instalada en la casa de su madre. “Ambas actividades son rentables, la siembra cada lapso de tiempo produce bien, mientas tanto de la tienda obtengo dinero para el gasto diario”, explica. Para el futuro, Areli piensa ampliar su negocio con productos más surtidos y producir en mayor cantidad, de esa manera ella podrá brindarle a su hijo mayores oportunidades de educación, “uno de mis sueños es tener mi casa propia y formar una familia cariñosa”, cuenta entre risas. Con fe, éste sería su préstamo número 4 de MFP, para eso Areli necesita de su ayuda, por su parte, ella se compromete a ser firme y puntual en sus cuotas, al igual que sus compañeros del banco comunal llamado “Trabajadores de Pucharini”, del que se siente muy a gusto. Una vez que el dinero del crédito llegue a sus manos, logrará comprar semillas de café y plátanos, así como para iniciar un nuevo cultivo de yucas. Cone el dinero restante pagará el servicio de flete y personal para que limpien sus parcelas de malas hierbas.
texts.en:
Areli is 24 years old and a single mother of a seven-year-old son. For this reason, she dedicates herself to her life and work. Areli lives with her mother in the community of Pucharini and receives financial support from her ex-partner so that her young son can have a decent education. Since she is aware that new needs arise over time, Areli took charge of her parents’ land so that she could plant avocados, coffee, and bananas. She also has a business selling groceries, vegetables, sodas, and other products from her mother’s house. “Both activities are profitable. Planting crops produces good results each time, but the store generates income for daily expenses,” explains Areli. In the future, she plans to expand her business by being well-stocked with more merchandise and producing crops in greater volume so that she can provide her son more educational opportunities. “One of my dreams is to have my own home and to raise a loving family,” she says with laughter. With faith, Areli promises to be steadfast and punctual with her payments, just like her fellow members of the Communal Bank called “Trabajadores de Pucharini” (Workers of Pucharini). She feels very comfortable with her group.

Once the money is in her hands, Areli will buy coffee and banana seedlings and also start a new crop of cassava. The rest of the money will be used to pay workers to remove weeds from her parcels of land.

loans.use: to buy coffee and banana seedlings and to pay workers to remove weeds.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a father of 3 children aged between 11 and 4, and all attend school. He is aged 35 and has been farming for 10 years with produce of maize, tomatoes and cabbage which he takes to the local market. He also runs a butchery business in the local market for additional income.

Moses has made a loan request amounting to 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow at 41,600 KES and purchase poultry birds at 38,400 KES. He says the proceeds from the two businesses will help him provide his family with their basic needs. He hopes to rise to the ranks of major suppliers of poultry farmers in the area.

He however recognizes the high costs of inputs and unreliable price fluctuations in the local markets.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 46 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus 5 hijos a los que cuida “sola” en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Acolla. Ella es una mujer con múltiples oficios, pues tiene que salir adelante para cuidar de sus hijos. Durante las mañanas se dedica a la venta de dulces y comida en un pequeño restaurante que puso en el interior de la escuela de su localidad, ahí obtiene un dinero considerable, ya que es la única que vende estos alimentos. Además de sembrar papa, trigo, quinua y habas, los cuales cuida en sus terrenos propios, que le fueron heredados por parte de su padre. También cuida de sus animales como gallinas y cerdos que comercializa en la ciudad de Jauja, en la feria que se realiza una vez a la semana. Pero como es conocida, cuenta que en la cosecha de alimentos; los mismos comerciantes visitan sus terrenos productivos para comprar en su totalidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadoras” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo integran personas responsables y solidarias.
Elizabeth, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46, and an unassuming woman.  She lives with her five children, who she looks after by herself in her own house, located in the settlement of Acolla. 

She is a woman with many trades, as she has to get ahead to look after her children. In the mornings, she sells candy and meals in a small restaurant that she has set up inside the local school. There she earns a good amount of money, as she is the only one selling this food. 

In addition, she grows potatoes, wheat, quinoa and lima beans, which she looks after on her own land that she inherited from her father. She also looks after her animals, such as chickens and pigs that she sells in the city of Jauja, in the market that is held once a week. But as she is well known, she says that during the harvest, the same merchants visit her productive lands to buy all of her crop.

She belongs to the "Mujeres Luchadoras" communal bank, and this is her third loan with MFP. She hopes that all of you will support her in meeting her goal. In addition, she promises to make her payments on time, as her group is made up of responsible and supportive people.

When she receives her loan, Elizabeth willl use the money to buy natural fertilizers to spread among her potato plants.

loans.use: To buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and had three children. She is widowed and stands as both father and mother to her children. It is important for her to maintain her business because it is her only source of income. Her children cannot help her because they are still studying. 

Grace has been selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village for almost 10 years.  She puts up the business outside her house. 

Grace is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy onions, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes to sell in her food stall.  She aims to give a better quality of life to her children and keep growing as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: buy onions, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Gudelia, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, porque quiere comprar más mariscos (pescado, conchas, ostras, camarones), y teniendo la disponibilidad económica podrá realizar la compra cuando se le dé la oportunidad, ya que este producto se daña rápido, debe estar realizando comprar periódicas.
Ella considera que a avanzado con su negocio, manteniendo solo producto fresco para ofrecer a los clientes, esto le ha permitido mejorar sus condiciones en ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Gudelia is once again requesting a loan because she wants to buy more seafood (fish, clams, oysters, and shrimp) and wants to have the capital to do so when the opportunity presents itself.  Because this product spoils quickly, she must make periodic buys.  She feels that selling only fresh product has allowed her to improve her family income and condition.

loans.use: to buy sfresh fish.

loans.name: Fausena

texts.en: On the table seen above, Fausena  has some watermelons displayed on it. She sells different kinds of fruits at Ayensudu near Elmina.  She is married and has 3 children. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of fruits to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Victor Andrés

texts.es: El joven Víctor Andrés es un emprendedor quien inicia hace unos meses su propio negocio donde presta el servicio de cafetería en una vereda el municipio de Bello localizado al norte de Antioquia. Dado que el dueño del local donde tenía anteriormente su negocio lo extorsionó, requiere actualmente de la compra de nuevo surtido en productos tales como snacks, café, panes y gaseosas para mejorar el existente del nuevo local donde tiene su cafetería y poderle prestar a sus clientes un mejor surtido. El sueño del joven Víctor Andrés es abrir otro local.
texts.en: Young Víctor is an entrepreneur who started his own business a few months ago: a business where he provides coffee shop services along one of the streets in the town of Bello located in northern Antioquia.  Because the owner of the locale where he used to have his business swindled him, he needs now to buy a new assortment of products like snacks, coffee, bread and soft-drinks to improve the existing inventory in the new locale he now has his coffee shop in and be able to provide his customers with a better assortment.  Víctor Andrés’ dream is to open another locale.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Allakan Soutra Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe ALLAKAN SOUTRA sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans,  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MILLION KIN, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de LOULOUNI. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures se sont bien dénoués.
MARIAM 1ère à droite sur la photo fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires dans ce groupe de femmes ALLAKAN SOUTRA, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une vendeuse très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  25kg de sel gemme, 2 cartons de cube magie, 1 bidon de 20 litres,  3 paquets de l’ail. Elle s’approvisionne à LOULOUNI les jours de foires et à Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend en détail, dans sa famille et les jours de foires au marché de la ville de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes au comptant souvent à crédit . 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The four members of the ALLAKAN SOUTRA group are married women who are on average 34 years old and have three children each.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Million Kin, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Loulouni.  In order to meet their customers' needs, the members of the group are requesting a third loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution.  Previous loans were properly repaid.  Mariam, the first woman from the right in the photo, sells condiments.  She is quite well-known in her field and is a very popular seller.  She plans to use this loan to buy 25 kilos of rock salt, 2 boxes of Maggi cubes, one twenty-liter container and 3 packets of garlic.  She buys her supplies in Sikasso and in Loulouni on market days.  She sells her merchandise for retail to her family and at the Loulouni market, on market days.  Her customers are mostly women who pay her in cash, often on credit.  Mariam is expecting average monthly profits to reach 31,250 CFA francs, part of which will be used to pay off her loan and the interests, while the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Mahoukponmide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUKPONMIDE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Conforte, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 30 ans est mariée à un pêcheur nommé Julien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Conforte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Conforte et son mari. Conforte n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis cinq ans, Conforte vend des chaussures et des tous cousus dans sa région ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Conforte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Conforte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUKPONMIDE un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures et des tous cousus.

loans.name: Zina's Group

texts.en:
Zina is a member of this group from Iraq. Zina is 51 years old divorced, mother of one; she started her sewing business seven years ago to support her family.
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provides for divorced and widow women to buy table and over sewing machine to increase her production and income .
The story of Zina and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Zina's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy table and over sewing machine.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia is a 52-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. For twenty eight years, this woman earns a living by selling dried fish to the community. Aside from this, she also helps her husband in fishing; her husband is a fisherman. She and her husband needs to work everyday to sustain and support the needs of their school-aged child. Nemia is determined to continue her journey. She wants to improve and expand her business. And with the help of her loan, she will be able to buy more dried fish to sell that will help her improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Servet

texts.en: Servet M. and his wife Nigiar run their agricultural business for 6 years. They till 400 decares land on which they grow tobacco, common balm, squashes.  Before this they have had a cow farm but economic reason made them close it and start with agriculture. Now their business is doing well. Sometimes during the season they hire more than 20 workers. Servet M. and his wife need $ 1200 to supply seedlings and fertilizer for their farm.

loans.use: To supply seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell at her grocery store.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella sells glasses and does eye exams in Guayaquil. After working at an optometrist’s office for some time, Estrella saved enough money to start her own business. She had to make a $480 investment in the glasses kit that she uses to take people’s measurements. After she takes the measurements and her clients choose the frames, she sends the glasses in to get the correct lens put in. She mostly sells in her community, but also travels to colleges, churches and hospitals selling her products. She is very popular because there are not any optometrists that will go to their clients, especially in these marginalized communities.

She is currently separated from her husband and has the responsibility of providing for herself and her 15 year old child while he finished high school. Her dream is to finish her studies at the university so she can be a certified optometrist.

Estrella is a repeat Kiva and Mifex lender. She invested her first loan very successfully by purchasing new frames and a second display case. She made great profits on her investment and used them to make several improvements to her newly acquired home. Estrella’s goal is owning her own store where she can keep more products in stock and she will be able to provide better service. She is planning on building the store in a section of her new house. She was very grateful for the loan and hopes to continue working with Kiva and Mifex.

loans.use: Invest in more frames and make some changes to her house that will allow her to work from home

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth Morón Salazar is married to a taxi driver and is the mother of 4 children. She has been a Pro Mujer partner for more than 2 years. She prepares and sells a type of fried empanadas known as empanadas tucumanas, by contract and to order. At the same time she also works selling various products, decorative items, small appliances, jewelry and other items that she brings from the city of Oruro.

At the present time Ruth is simply maintaining her commercial business while focusing principally on her fried empanada business. She acquired an industrial frier, which allows her to sign contracts for greater volume and in this way increase the income she provides to her family. Ruth needs capital to be able to build her inventory of merchandise now, in preparation for the holidays at the end of the year. As December nears, the prices she pays for the merchandise she sells will increase, reducing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth Morón Salazar, casada con un chofer de taxi, y madre de 4 hijos, es socia de Pro Mujer hace más de 2 años, se dedica a la preparación de empanadas fritas (tucumanas) según contrato y a pedido. Paralelamente a esta actividad, la señora Ruth se dedica a la comercialización de productos varios, como ser adornos, electrodomésticos, joyas, y otros que trae de la ciudad de Oruro.

En la actualidad la señora Ruth, mantiene su negocio de comercio de productos y principalmente la preparación de empanadas fritas a contrato. Para esto ella adquirió una freidora industrial, la que le permite firmar contratos por una mayor cantidad, de esta forma generar mayores ingresos para su familia.

Ruth necesita de capital para poder preparar toda su mercadería en vista de la cercanía de las fiestas de fin de año, puesto que a medida de que pasa el tiempo y se acerca el mes de diciembre, los precios de la mercadería que comercializa, se incrementa y por tanto reducen sus ganancias.

loans.use: Ruth  needs capital to be able to build an inventory of merchandise now in preparation for the holidays at the end of the year. As December nears, the prices she pays for the merchandise she sells will increase, reducing her earnings.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny, married and the mother of a one year old son, belongs to the Fortitude association in Villa Tejada. Her main occupation is the preparation and sale of desserts made of milk and gelatine (called harlequins in Bolivia), which she sells in street fairs and open air markets. Prior to this business, Fanny worked with her mother sewing and selling clothes. They owned a market stall in the 16 de Julio market. Unfortunately, Fanny's mother passed away recently and she was unable to keep the business going on her own.

She has been in business for 3 months now, in an effort to generate the income necessary to help support her young son. She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials and supplies necessary to continue her business and to establish herself and her products in a very competitive market.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Fanny Ercilla A., casada y madre de un pequeño de apenas 1 añito de edad, pertenece a la asociación Fortaleza de Villa Tejada, Su actividad principal es la preparación y venta de postres hechos a base de leche y gelatina (arlequines), los cuales ella sola prepara y vende de forma ambulante en los mercados y ferias de la zona. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad, Fanny colaboraba y trabajaba con su madre en la confección y venta de ropa. Eran dueñas de un puesto en la Feria 16 de Julio. Lastimosamente la mamá de Fanny falleció y a raíz de esto, no pudo proseguir con el negocio de confección. Son tres meses que ella viene realizando este trabajo con el fin de generar los recursos necesarios para la manutención de su pequeño hijo. Por tal motivo Fanny precisa de dinero para mejorar su producto y abastecerse de suministros que le permitan continuar y establecer su producto en un mercado muy competitivo.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and supplies needed to make and sell her products in a very competitive market

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana B. works with her family to maintain the nearly 5 hectares of their farm. About half is her property and the other half is her mother’s. Her mother is elderly and can no longer work in the fields, so Ana takes care of her property as well. In addition to working the fields, which are primarily planted with wheat, she also raises animals. As for other farmers in the area, this year was a very hard one for Ana, as the weather conditions were not favorable and she was not even able to recover the costs of planting her wheat. She is need of a loan to pay for 850 kg of new seed stock and to have her land plowed ahead of the next planting.

loans.use: seeds and plowing expenses

loans.name: Salamah

texts.id:
Salamah is a hard-working mother. She can cover the family's living expense using the profit earned from selling food business. Her husband also helps her business. With the capital of Rp 500,000 (about $53) per day, she can earn profit of Rp 50,000 (about $5.3) if she sells all the food dishes. Salamah is pregnant at the moment so that she cannot travel to offer the food. She wants to open a new business to sell Nasi Lalap (rice with salad). She plans to hire 2 more people to help the business. She already has a stand to sell Nasi Lalap. Her husband will continue the selling food business. With the capital of Rp 4,500,000 (about $478), she hopes she can increase the profit of the food business so that she can have more capital for the Nasi Lalap business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Salamah adalah seorang ibu yang giat dan rajin bekerja. Usaha Jual Sayur yang digelutinya mampu mencukupi kebutuhan hidup keluarga. Dia dibantu oleh suami. Modal Rp 500.000,00/hari akan memberikan keuntungan usaha sebesar Rp 50.000,00. Hal itu apabila semua barang dagangan habis. Salamah saat ini hamil, kondisi tersebut tentu tidak memungkinkan baginya untuk berjualan keliling. Dia ingin membuka usaha baru, yaitu Jual Nasi Lalapan. Dia berencana untuk mengajak 2 orang yang akan membantunya berjualan. Saat ini dia sudah memiliki rombong untuk berjualan Nasi Lalapan. Sedangkan suaminya melanjutkan Usaha Jual Sayur. Modal usaha sebesar Rp 4.500.000 dia harapkan dapat meningkatkan keuntungan Usaha Jual Sayur dan untuk modal Usaha Nasi Lalapan.

loans.use: For capital

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Adilia lives in Sabana Grande, a town in Managua City. She is 54 years old and married with 5 children, all of whom are grown-up and have left home. Adilia lives alone with her husband, who is retired and receives a monthly social security pension. Adilia’s job is buying food such as nacatamals (a type of Nicaraguan tamal), curds, meat soups and tripes, which she sells on weekends. Adilia needs money to buy two pigs to feed and fatten and then use for their meat. She wants to concentrate on selling pig meat which is why a percentage of it will be sold and the rest will go into the nacatamals.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Doña Adilia habita en la Comarca Sabana Grande, un municipio de la ciudad de Managua. Ella tiene 54 años de edad es casada. Tuvo 5 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y viven independientes. Doña Adilia solamente vive con su esposo, quien está jubilado y mensualmente recive una pensión por parte del seguro social. Doña Adilia se dedica a la venta de comida: nacatamales, cuajada, sopa de res y mondongo, estas ventas las realiza los fines de semana. Doña Adilia necesita el dinero para comprar 2 cerdos, engordarlos y destazarlos. Quiere dedicarse a la venta de carne de cerdo, es por eso que destinará un porcentaje de esa carne para venta y el otro lo ocupará para hacer los nacatamales.

loans.use: To purchase two pigs, for their meat

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.en:
N. Tuhfa was born in 1965 in the B.Gafurov region. She is married and has a child. Mrs. N. rents a stall in the Khujand in the one of the large flea bazaars. She sells a wide assortment of clothing for children, men, and women.

Mrs. N. is requesting a loan of $625 to modernize her business. She wants to import new goods such as house slippers, pajamas, and bathrobes.

loans.use: To modernize her business by importing new items of clothng

loans.name: Macario

texts.es:
Marcario owns his own vehicle which he uses as a taxi. This is the only support the family has since his wife is a works in the home full-time. Macario’s home is located in the Bajo Llojeta zone on the western side of La Paz.

This will be the 8th time that Macario has requested a loan from IMPRO. His loan history gives him a credit rating of 1, which means he has fully repaid his loans and in good order.

The currently requested loan will be used for the maintenance of his vehicle, specifically for an oil change and maintenance of the engine and breaks.

Macario is approved for this loan based on his work history and experience as a chauffeur. He has been a client of IMPRO since June of 2001 and all of his loans have been fully repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Macario, tiene un vehículo que trabaja como taxi y es su única fuente de ingresos, su esposa se dedica a las labores de su casa. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Bajo Llojeta ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, Es la Octava vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo (cambio de aceites, mantenimiento del motor, frenos, etc.). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como chofer. Es cliente nuestro desde Junio de 2001. Todos sus préstamos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married and she and her husband take care of a 50 year old person. Nuru sells clothes, which she began doing in 2006. She works every day from 8 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $47 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina I. is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and earns income hawking and selling female shoes and clothes. Paulina learnt this business by herself, and has been involved in it for 5 years now. Currently, Paulina needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy more female shoes and clothes for sale, so as to increase her profit and be able to take better care of her children and family's needs.

loans.use: Purchase of female shoes and clothes for sale

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. Twumasi is a 28-year-old business woman. She is married with three children who are currently in school. Yaa trades in cosmetics with items like earrings, lip gloss, beads, perfumes and powders etc. She sells by mobile hawking because she does not have a shop yet. Yaa believes that with the loan she can buy good quality standard goods to meet the tastes and preferences of her customers and to make a better income. This, she believes, will provide her with the increased income she needs to help build her own small container shop and ease the drudgery of hawking. Yaa is a member of the community group called Holy Trinity Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for one another, as social collateral, to access loans and to apply peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of earrings, lip gloss, beads, perfumes and powders etc

loans.name: Go Be-Foe 1 Group

texts.en:
Emma B. is 30 years old and married with three children. Emma would like to expand her business selling fish and diversify her market-outreach in the villages. She is glad to apply for a loan again from Kiva. She has said that Kiva is her source of life. She is happy that she is now using her own capital generated from a previous Kiva loan, whereas previously she had to purchase fish on credit at a high price.

Isatu B. sells fire wood and palm oil, and Salamatu L. owns a stall selling palm oil and rice. The three entrepreneurs have been working together as a group for more than a year and the members guarantee each other. Together they are requesting a loan to expand their individual businesses.

loans.use: Purchase more died fish, firewood, palm oil and rice.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa P. sells saucepans, fabric, and other items. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Theresa and her husband to live on. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Alma

texts.es:
Doña Alma D. inicio su negocio hace alrededor de 5 años, cuando ella y su esposo deciden invertir el aguinaldo de el en comprar zapatos de un catalogo que pidió prestado, mismos que vendió entre sus familiares y amigos, como le fue muy bien en sus ventas, pudieron continuar pagando la colegiatura de sus hijos, y el dinero que les sobraba lo reinvertían en mas zapatos para poder obtener un poco mas de ganancias.

Alma D. solicita la cantidad de US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancia y ampliar un poco más su margen de utilidades y aumentar un poco mas sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alma D. started her business about 5 years ago, when she and her husband decided to invest his Christmas bonus in shoes from a catalogue that was loaned to him. They began selling shoes to friends and relatives, and because it went so well, they were able to pay for their children’s schooling. With the money leftover, they bought more shoes to continue their business.

Alma D. is asking for $300US, which she’ll repay in 4 months, to buy more merchandise, increase her profits and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar mercancia

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi baji is a widow of M.Rafiq and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house she has lived in for the last 22 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her oldest son has a food business. Her second son has a fruit-selling business. Her youngest son runs a barber saloon. Allah Rakhi baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She has successfully repaid three loans to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her son's fruit selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other people. Bashrian baji wants a loan to buy paper to resell. Kosar baji, Safia baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy more garments to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for five small businesses

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 20 años de edad, es casada, madre de dos hijos, estudió el sexto grado de primaria y vive en el Sector Orcomplaya del C.P Uros Chulluni, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Desde hace dos años es socia del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” de Puno. Con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró bordados en bayeta, balsas, collares, joyeros, etc. para su negocio de artesanía en la Isla Flotante Los Uros. Sus padres no contaban con medios económicos y por esa razón no continuo sus  estudios. Actualmente sigue con el negocio de venta de artesanías.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados en bayeta como cojines, manteles, cuadros, etc.

Su deseo es mejorar su negocio para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Claudia is 20 years old, married and mother of two children. She finished through the sixth year of primary school and lives in the sector Orcomplaya del CP Uros Chullini, district, province and department of Puno.

For the last two years she has been a member of the Community Bank "Melchorita Saravia II" of Puno. With the loan of $100 USD she purchased embroidered wool, rafts, necklaces, jewelry cases, etc.for her crafts business on the Floating Island Los Uros. Her parents did not have the financial means and that is why she did not continue with her studies. She currently continues with her business of the sale of arts and crafts.

With the loan of $325 USD, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy embroidered wool cloth pillows, tablecloths, pictures, etc..

Her wish is to improve her business to be able to build her house.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase embroidered wool cloth pillows, tablecloths, pictures, etc.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Maximina tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Ella es natural de su tierra, Tayacaja, sus padres inculcaron en ella  todos los conocimientos  en cuanto a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, es así que hoy en día ella aplica estos conocimientos, siembra papa, maíz, habas, cebada, quinua, entre otros, ella vende directamente lo que producen sus tierras. Adicionalmente, vende ovejas y otros animales que cría en su pequeño establo, los vende en cantidad, dos veces al año. Es la primera  vez que Maximina  solicita un préstamo en MFP y se compromete a ser puntual  en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará insecticidas y abono para sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Maximina is 42 years old and she lives with her husband and 5 children. She is originally from Tayacaja and her parents nurtured the knowledge of agriculture and livestock care in her. Today she puts that knowledge into practice, having potatoes, corn, hay, quinoa grain plantations among others. She sells direct to her customers what is produced on her land. In addition, she sells lambs and other livestock that she raises in her small stable, selling in large numbers twice a year. This is the first time Maximina is requesting a loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to be on time with her payments. With the funds requested she will purchase insecticides and fertilizer for her fields.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Doña Lucrecia  heredo éste negocio de sus padres; Desde pequeña aprendió el oficio de la panadería y asumió la administración del negocio desde muy joven, Se ha desempeñado con mucha eficiencia y compromiso, ella dice que adim ha sido una bendición en su vida  ya que le ha brindado créditos y capacitaciones, las cuales ha puesto en práctica en su negocio y le ha dado muy buenos resultados.
Cuenta con su esposo como principal socio y con sus hijos que le ayudan en la comercialización de sus productos tantos en el barrio como en las pulperías locales; cuenta con clientela fija lo que le permite estar en constante producción para abastecer a sus clientes. 
A doña Lucrecia le gustaría que su negocio se expandiera para obtener mayores ingresos y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, sabe que para alcanzar ésta meta debe ser responsable. Tanto con los créditos otorgados por ADIM, así también con sus proveedores y sobre todo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucrecia inherited this business from her parents. She learned how to bake as a small girl and took over managing the business at a young age. She has worked with great efficiency and commitment; she says that ADIM has been a blessing in her life as it has provided loans and education, which she has put into practice in her business with very good results. Her husband is her business partner and their children help her sell their products in the neighborhood as well as in the local stores. She has a steady clientele which enables her to be in constant production to meet her customers’ demands. Lucrecia would like to expand her business in order to obtain greater income and be able to improve her family’s living conditions. She knows that in order to reach this goal she needs to be responsible, with the loans from ADIM as well as her suppliers and above all with her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital; invest in growin gher business and expand her market

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodosia G., a 41-year-old mother of two children in San Vicente, Dapitan City, is married to a laborer.  Because surviving only on his income was difficult, she started a sari-sari, a small convenience store, selling primarily to the people in her neighbourhood.  

With the help of financing from the Paglaum Cooperative, which she joined last April, she has been able to finance the daily needs of her family. Having already received and repaid three loans, she is now requesting $225 to purchase additional stocks for her store. 

Teodosia is looking forward to seeing her sari-sari develop into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Diorita

texts.en:
Diorita M. lives in Barangay Paragu, one of the agricultural areas in Tumauini, Isabela. She is married to Hipolito, who manages their corn and tobacco farming. Their only daughter, Melanie, is 35-years-old and already married.

She has been managing a village store business for almost 30 years. Diorita was glad that she was able to make it despite the problems that they have encountered during the past few years. She opens her store at 5AM in the morning and stays open until 8PM, seven days a week. She is earning a net income of PHP100.00 which is a great help in meeting their daily needs.

Diorita hopes to buy more stock in order to improve her store. Thus, she wanted to ask for a loan of $125 (PHP5,000.00) that she can use for the continuous operation of her store.

loans.use: To increase inventory in the store

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Consolata has been a woman retailer in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for the past 2 years. She is a member of the Upendo group loan (Group code 2001). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.

Consolata is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy additional items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Consolata is married, and has two children: ages 25 and 20. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Tuninge, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her business.

loans.name: Parveen Mai M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
My name is Parveen Mai and I’ve lived in a city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the last 10 years. My husband's name is M. Mushtaq, and he sells different types of utensils, such as steel and glass. He buys the utensils from different cities (Lahore and Muzafarabad) and sells them in his native city. He has a good number of customers. He has been in this profession for the last 6 years.

I am a mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of my kids are enrolled in a local school near my house. I operate a business sewing clothes. I do this work to pay the school fees for my kids, because they want to get a good education and make be independent. My family is very happy with my co-operative and sincere behavior. I am requesting for a loan to expand my husband’s business selling utensils.

I am the group leader of 4 other women from my area. Zainab baji requests a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) to sell. Hamidan baji requests a loan to buy thread to sell. Ghazala and Leeb baji and Khursheed baji each request a loan to change the body of their auto-rickshaws (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy utensils to sell

loans.name: Saumaleafu

texts.en:
Saumaleafu M., 25, is married with 2 children. She has 3 years of experience in the male and female outfit or sewing business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 4 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Saumaleafu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase cotton materials and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Mrs. Angelita I. is married to Mauricio I. and has two children. She requested a loan of Php 5,000.00 as additional capital for her hog-raising venture.  She will use the proceeds for the purchase of feed and vitamins for her hogs and for the purchase of more piglets. She is planning to put up capital for her own sari-sari store as an expansion to her hog-raising business and for added income as well. Her other future plan is for her children to finish their studies and hopefully establish their own careers.

loans.use: To purchase feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Nosirjon

texts.ru: Мусоев Носирчон проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 26 лет. Женат, имеет одного сына. Носирчон занимается земледелием более 3 лет. Помимо этого, он  еще работает трактористом 5 лет. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы минералы и посеить овощи. А на полученный доход хочет сделать дома пристройку.
texts.en:
Nosirjon M. lives in Tursunzade. He is 26 years old and is married with one son. Nosirjon has been an agricultural worker for 3 years, and he has also been a tractorist for 5 years. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase minerals and plant vegetables. He would like to use the profit for expanding his house.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Flor De Tajibo Group

texts.es: El grupo “Flor de Tajibo” fue conformado y creado en el barrio la esperanza, zona central de montero, un grupo con entusiasmo de trabajar con el apoyo de un financiamiento económico que ayudara a mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de cosméticos por catálogos, pan, ropa, zapatos, abarrotes en tienda de barrio, comida y a sus negocios de sastrería y construcción de viviendas con la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a genera mayores ingresos para brindar a sus familias una mejor calida de vida. La competencia no es problema para los socios de este grupo pues solo necesitan el impulso que les brinda la Institución para seguir adelante sin preocupaciones. A pesar de no contar con mucha experiencia en créditos solidarios los socios de este grupo conocen la responsabilidad que se requiere para el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The Flor de Tajibo Group was created and organized in the La Esperanza neighborhood in the central zone of Montero, Bolivia. They are a group who work enthusiastically with the economic support which will help them to improve their small businesses, which include: selling bread, clothing, shoes and prepared food; selling cosmetics by catalog or groceries in the neighborhood store, and also trades such as tailoring and housing construction. They will obtain materials, ingredients and tools that will help them to generate greater incomes in order to provide their families with a better quality of life. Competence is not a problem for this group, they only need the boost the institution will provide them in order to get ahead without worrying. Despite the fact that they don't have a lot of experience with solidarity loans, the members of this group know the responsibility that is required in order to fulfill their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Mr. Marcos G. B. is from the Republicano neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 35 years old and married to Mrs. Petrona Paredes, 34. They have four older children and own their own home.  

Marcos works making and selling tapioca, a traditional Paraguayan food, to a well-established clientele. It provides him a steady income. He has good references, both professional and personal, as he is a hardworking man. He would eventually like to be able to trade in his car for one with more capacity to carry his products.

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of ingredients for making animal feed in bulk.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
51-year old Lorna P. is a farmer and mother of five children. She says that she started her business when she just young. Her farm really helps her family in paying the school fees and paying the expenses for their household. Now, as children have already grown up, she is still managing a rice farm to support their needs.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and chemicals. She is very hopeful that buying all the farm necessities will, in turn, give her family a bountiful harvest. 

Actively, she participates in the CEVI credit program. She receives, not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Dulzora

texts.en:
Dulzora B. is from the village of Tumpagon in Cagayan de Oro City. She is 64 years old. Dulzora is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Dulzora runs a food stall where she sells bread and coffee. Dulzora has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Dulzora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dulzora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Dulzora is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will Dulzora's 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: La sra. Candelaria se dedica a al venta de papa y verduras en una tienda ubicada en la zona de Pampahasi, su esposo se dedica a la venta de cd´s y dvd´s, en la tienda del lado, ambos trabajan y se colaboran mutuamente para los gastos de la casa y para el estudio de sus hijos. Ella tiene pedidos por cantidad para las pastelerías-heladerías del centro de la ciudad, ya es muy conocida en este rubro. Es una cliente que retorna después de un año. El crédito será invertido en la compra de papas por carga ya que los pedidos que tiene aumentaron.

loans.use: INVERTIRA EN COMPRA DE PAPA AL POR MAYOR

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is engaged in the hog raising business as her source of income.  She us 54byears old and she is already a widow and she was left with their four children. In order to cope with their family needs, Teresita also works in the field for extra income.  She can earn a labor fee of PHP100.00 a day and sometimes she even washed clothes of her neighbors and earn an income of PHP150.00. 

Being a single parent is hard especially in providing the needs of her children.  Teresita wanted to borrow a loan amount of PHP12,000 from the KIVA fellows for the maintenance of her hog raising business and to purchase feeds supply.  She hopes that her request will be approved to be able to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena B., 31, is married to Edison B.. They are blessed with two children: Mark Edison, 9, is in grade 4 in primary level, and Mark Joseph, 5, is in the nursery level. According to Ma. Magdalena, the expenses for the schooling of their two children is not much right now. However, she wants to save early for their future needs in school. Hence she is pursuing her sewing business, which is their main source of income. She has been running this business for two years with help from her husband, who is also a sewer. With both of them working, they hope to increase their income.

When she joined the Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she used the loan as additional capital for her business; now she will do the same. She plans to use the loan to buy one sewing machine, which is a five threads machine. She really needs this machine for her sewing business. She thinks this machine coupled with their perseverance will make their business more productive.

Ma. Magdalena’s dream is to continue to run her business and have more sewing machines, so that she can help their neighborhood who has no source of income for employing them as sewers. And if her business will grow, her family will be benefitted the most, as she can save for the future of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sewing business

loans.name: Ruiseñor Group

texts.es:
María Iliana S. A. hace dos años y ocho meses que comenzó haciendo paletas con la ayuda de su nuera. Luego consiguió un frízer y empezó a comercializar los productos Eskimo en diferentes presentaciones. 

Eskimo un empresa nicaragüense que elabora productos lácteos diversos, tales como helados, sorbetes, leche y sus derivados. Es la mayor compañía heladera fundada en 1942 y que tiene presencia en todo el país. 

S. invertirá el crédito para adquirir más variedad de productos y en un futuro desea que sea convertir su negocio en una sorveteria completa, contar con un local, mesas y tazas entre otros.

Martha Lorena P. vende tortillas, frijoles cosidos y nacatamales estos son de consumo diario para los nicaragüenses y su meta es llegar a vender desayunos y almuerzos.

Xochi Raquel M. R. tiene pulpería y fritanga. La fritanga es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se compra para la cena. Estos suelen ser carne asada, pollo frito, tajadas con queso, pollo asado, enchiladas, chancho con yuca……etc.
texts.en:
María Iliana S. A. started making popsicles two years and eight months ago with the help of her daughter-in-law. Then she got a freezer and started to sell different types of Eskimo products. Eskimo is a Nicaraguan company that makes diverse dairy products like ice cream, sorbet, milk, and its derivatives. It is the largest ice cream company, which was founded in 1942, and it is has a presence in the whole country. S. will use the loan to get a greater variety of products. In the future she wishes to convert her business into a complete sorbet shop. She wants to have a place with tables and cups among other things. Martha Lorena P. sells tortillas, cooked beans, and “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale), which the Nicaraguans eat daily. Her goal is to sell breakfasts and lunches. Xochi Raquel M. R. has a mini-market and a “fritanga” stand. A “fritanga” is restaurant that is popular in Nicaragua for its excellence. It consists of selling fried foods that are prepared soley to be put on the grill. Generally, you buy them for dinner. They can be made of roasted meat, fried chicken, cheese slices, roasted chicken, enchiladas, and pork with yucca…etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream, popsicles, sorbets, and cones

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef has owned an electrical repair shop in his town since 2006. He's 25 years old and single. He is the only provider for the family.

Today, Youssef is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional tools in order to develop and expand his shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady C. est une femme mariée, elle est âgée de 24 ans et membre du Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle fait de la transformation et vende de pâte d'arachide, elle vend également des tissus importés. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de s'équiper et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Madame Khady C. is 24 years old, married, and has been a member of the Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 for five and a half years. She processes and sells peanut butter, and she also sells imported fabrics. The profit she generates allows her to buy equipment and provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her business

loans.name: Ymelda

texts.es:
La socia YMELDA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijas. La hija mayor se llama Gabriela y tiene 2 años y la menor Rafaela tiene 3 meses de nacida. Ellas viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de agencia de transportes  turísticos “MADEYSE”. Ella hace servicio de transporte de turismo al Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de sus carros de transportes y comprar algunos repuestos. Ella comenta que el motor esta fallando y necesita ser revisado.
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ymelda is a humble mother and a member of the "Virgen de Chapi" village bank. She is 37, lives with her partner, and has two children. Her eldest daughter, Gabriela, is 2, and the youngest, Rafaela, is 3-months-old. They live in the Santiago District in the Cusco Province. Ymelda has a small transportation service called "Madeyse", which runs tours to the "Sacred Valley of the Incas." She has been in business for a number of years and, thanks to her determined efforts, things have gone very well. Our member is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is getting her family ahead. She needs a loan to do maintenance on her vehicles and buy spare parts. She mentions that her engine is failing and needs service. Ymelda is grateful for the opportunity this loan offers her and is committed to making timely payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member needs a loan to service her vehicles and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando, tiene  70 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad. El señor Orlando posee un negocio de ofrecer los servicios de molino, hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio para mantener el sustento diario de su familia, por lo que tiene que mantener los estudios de sus hijos. El crédito será invertido en proporcionarle mejoras a sus molinos, que son su medio de vida también algunas herramientas que son necesarias. El sueño de Orlando es preocuparse por mantener su negocio en pie para seguir proporcionando mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Orlando is 70 years old. He’s married and has 4 children of age. He’s been a grain miller for more than 21 years. He uses all his earning to support his family and pay his children's college expenses. The loan will be used to improve his mills, which are his only resource and to purchase tools to fix them. Orlando’s dream is to keep his business afloat to keep making home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tools and fixing his mills

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
