A la vivienda de la señora Yolanda A. le esta haciendo falta material para empezar la construcción de una cuarto ya que tiene un negocio de papelería y le esta ocupando un habitación.
Es por eso que desea construir un cuarto al frente de la casa y acondicionarlo para su negocio ya que tiene mucha demanda de mercancía y no tiene suficiente esparció para exponerla.  
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de su negocio ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor Fernando Ramos, quien trabaja de supervisor de unas farmacias.
texts.en:
Yolanda A. needs building materials to complete a room addition to her house because she runs a stationary shop in one of the bedrooms and she needs the space. She would like to build a room in the front of the house and set it up as her business since demand for her products is high and she doesn't have enough space to exhibit her merchandise. She plans to repay the loan with profits from her business since her husband, Fernando Ramos, who works as a pharmacy supervisor, takes care of family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Isabelle Fifamè

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, H. Isabelle Fifamè vit depuis 15 ans environs au quartier Dowa, dans le cinquième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Isabelle Fifamè est mariée à GBETOHO Jacques. Le couple a cinq enfants et un autre enfant à charge. Mais seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Dowa. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Isabelle Fifamè vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, oignons, piments, etc.)au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. Isabelle Fifamè mène cette activité depuis environs 5 ans, une activité qui lui génère de revenu qu'elle utilise pour l'agrandir et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Isabelle Fifamè se ravitaille au Nigéria, pays limitrophe du Bénin. Isabelle Fifamè a obtenu deux fois de crédits auprès de ALIDé, et ces deux crédits ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la concurrence qui sévit sur ce marché, Isabelle Fifamè désire renforcer davantage son activité et mieux attirer les clients. Mais Isabelle Fifamè manque de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C'est ce qui amène Isabelle Fifamè à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin, Isabelle Fifamè H. has lived for around 15 years in the Dowa neighborhood of the fifth arrondissement or district of the town of Porto-Novo. Isabelle Fifamè is married to Jacques GBETOHO.The couple have five children of their own and another child in their care. But only certain of the children are at school. The family lives together in Dowa. The couple take responsibility together for the household expenses. Having never been to school, Isabelle Fifamè sells condiments for sauces (fresh tomatoes, onions, chili peppers etc.) at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. She has been carrying out this activity for around five years, and it generates income which she uses to expand the business and meet her children's needs. Isabelle Fifamè gets fresh supplies in Nigeria, a country which borders on Bénin. She has had two loans from ALIDé and both were repaid without incident. In view of the ruthless competition in this market, Isabelle Fifamè would like to strengthen her business and be able to attract her clients more easily. However, she lacks the financial means to do this and for this reason is applying for a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baskets of fresh tomatoes, onions and chili peppers

loans.name: Reynaldo Andrés

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo Andrés G. C. vive con su esposa en el Barrio La Borgoña tiene 43 años de edad y su esposa trabaja como comerciante, tienen 3 hijos que estudian y apoyan en los trabajos agrícolas, ellos se dedican  a la agricultura desde hace 20 años y uno de los problemas que más los ha afectado a sido la multiplicación de plagas que amenaza con la buena cosecha, ellos comenzaron sus días en este rubro dado al apoyo financiero de su padre.

Dentro de los planes que tienen a futuro está la compra de una caponera. Este es un medio de transporte que moviliza pasajeros a cortas distancias. Pero dentro de las prioridades, esta la inversión de materiales agrícolas, que el brinden una mantenimiento correcto a las tierras, garantizando la venta y recuperación del capital invertido.
texts.en:
Reynaldo lives in the " La Borgoña" neighborhood along with his wife. He is 43 years old and his wife works as a salesperson. They have three kids who study in school and help with the farm work. They've been farming for 20 years and one of the things that has affected their harvest has been the blights. They began working in their given field with his father's financial backing. Their future plans include the purchase of a " caponera," a small three wheeled vehicle which is used to transport passengers for short distances, but their priority is investment in agricultural supplies that they need to properly manage the land, ensuring that they can recover their investment.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in agriculturel supplies

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Alberto H. M. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la colonia Villanueva, tiene un pequeño negocio en el que brinda el servicio de corte de cabello, tiene clientes locales y de otras colonias aledañas a su negocio. sus clientes salen satisfechos del trabajo que el realiza.
Jose en estos momentos tiene la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, constriur para hacerlo mas grande y poner otra silla para dar servicio de cortes de pelo, tiene un  ayudante y quiere que el haga tambien el trabajo de cortes de pelo, Jose esta preparando a su ayudante para que sea un buen barbero, el es joven y esta casado, tiene un hijo.
Jose con este credito hara crecer su negocio y tendra mejores ganancias, asi mismo ayudara a su empleado a tener mejores ingresos por los cortes de pelo.
texts.en:
Jose Alberto H. M., 23, lives in Colonia Villanueva. He has a small barber shop. His customers are both locals and from neighboring areas. His customers leave satisfied with the work he does. Jose needs to enlarge his business and has to build in order to do so. He wants to add a second barber chair. He has an assistant and he wants him to do haircuts, too. Jose is training his assitant to be a good barber; he is young, married and has a son. Jose will use the funds to enlarge his business so that his profits will be better; he will also help his employee to have a better income by doing haircuts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, stone and bricks.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen sells yams at the Market in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells yams at wholesale and retail prices to make a living. Yams can be eaten boiled, roasted or fried. She is a widow with 4 children and she is 60 years old. With the profits she makes in her business, she supports her children in their school and business. She is requesting for a loan amount of 50,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Los Pinos Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario LOS PINOS conformado por 3 integrantes las Sras. Carmen, Edith, Maria las tres integrantes son oriundos de santa cruz localidad la guardia y cuentan con el negocio de venta de comida hace 12 años en el mercado central la guardia. 

SLa Sra. Edith se dedica a la  venta de desayuno hace 11 años en el mercado central la guardia, la Sra Edith tiene 4 hijos a su cargo la señora es casada pero actualmente esta separada,  pero aun con esta separacion la señora ha logrado salir adelante y con el credito que le otorgo emprender podra refaccionar y contruir su casita aun asi la señora tiene el sueño de engrandecer su negocio de venta de postres y masitas. 
                                                                                                                 la Sra. Carmen tiene 4 Hijos a su poder y tiene su concubino(Que viven juntos sin estar casados)con el señor Carlos  que se dedica al transporte. El credito que le otorgo emprender podra construir 2 cuartos,  la señora tiene el sueño de tener un restaurant muy grande y muy conocido. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                               La Sra. Maria Cuenta con 2 Hijos a su poder y tiene su concubino el señor Aquilino que se dedica al transporte  el credito que le otorgo emprender fue para la construccion y refaccion de su casa,la señora tiene un sueño de tener una heladeria en la localidad de la guardia.

Las tres integrantes estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The "Los Pinos" Group is made up of three members: Carmen, Edith, and Maria. The three members are natives of La Guardia, near Santa Cruz, and for twelve years have run their food sales businesses in the La Guardia central market. Edith has been selling breakfast in the La Guardia central market for 11 years. Edith has four children. She is married but is currently separated, but even with this separation she has managed to keep going, and with the loan Emprender gave her, she will be able to refurbish and build her little house. This lady dreams of expanding her business selling desserts and pastries. Carmen has four children and lives with her partner Carlos, who works in transportation. With the loan Emprender gave her, she will be able to build two rooms. This lady dreams of having a large, well-known restaurant. Maria has two children and lives with her partner Aquilino, who works in transportation. The loan Emprender gave her was for construction and refurbishment of her house. This lady dreams of having an ice cream store in La Guardia. All three members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in them with the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction and refurbishment

loans.name: Boureima

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boureima Traoré est un homme marié de 30 ans et sans enfant. Il vit avec sa femme à Bougouni ville (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) dans le quartier Torakabougou.
Après l’école coranique, il est resté longtemps sans emploi.
C’est dans le souci de s’insérer dans la vie économique qu’il  décida d’apprendre auprès de son ami,  le commerce notamment l’achat et la vente des chaussures et vêtements.
Avec 6 années expériences, il maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité à Bougouni.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, il rejoint le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, des  paires de chaussures  et des vêtements de différentes sortes et qualités.
Il s’approvisionne à Lomé et à Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue ses ventes dans sa boutique, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et femmes. 
Les fêtes religieuses et les grandes cérémonies (baptême, mariages) sont les périodes où les ventes de ses articles sont intenses.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans ses activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Boureima Traoré is a 30-year-old married man who has no children.  He lives with his wife in Bougouni City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali), in the Torakabougou district.  Following Koranic school, he was without employment for quite a while.  Wanting to take part in the working world, he decided to learn commerce from his friend, especially the buying and selling of shoes and clothing. With six years of experience, Boureima has a command of his business and is highly sought-after in Bougouni.  With regard to improving his business, he joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  With this loan, he intends to buy pairs of shoes and some clothing of all different types and qualities.  He stocks up in Lomé and in Bamako (capital of Mali).  And he makes his sales out of his store to a customer base composed of men and women.  Religious festivals and major ceremonies (baptisms, marriages) are the times when his sales are intense.  With this loan, Boureima plans on making a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will enable him to cover family expenses and to reinvest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes and clothing

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús M. es socia del banco Comunal  La Paz, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, ubicada  en el valle del sur a 2535 metros sobre el nivel del mar, es la capital de la provincia del  Azuay y es  la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador. 

Teresa de Jesús tiene 49 años, se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal concibió dos hijos que se encuentran de 29 y 27 años y ya  son casados,  vive sólo con  su esposo que trabaja como  chofer de un camión y viaja por varias ciudades del Ecuador. Ella vende productos naturales Herbalife hace ya diez años sólo durante sus momentos libres ya que viaja junto a su esposo comercializando papas, maíz, carbón  y todo lo que encuentren a precios convenientes.


Fue  invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres triunfadoras y es nuestra socia hace  un año, con el  crédito que le entreguen va a comprar multi vitamínicos, suplementos alimenticios entre otros productos Herbalife.

Su  meta es tener un negocio grande donde pueda comercializar varios productos para el hogar  y la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa de Jesus M. is a member of the La Paz Community Bank, and lives in the city of Cuenca, (located in the valley, south about 2535 meters above sea level) which is the capital of the province of Azuay, and is the third most important city of Ecuador. Teresa is 49 years old, is married and has two sons who are 29 and 27 years of age and are married. She lives alone with her husband who works as a truck driver and travels through several cities in Ecuador. She's been selling "Herbalife" natural products for ten years now during her free time, since she spends most of her time traveling with her husband selling/purchasing potatoes, corn, coal and everything they find at good prices. Teresa was invited by her sister to join this great group of women achievers and to become a member of this bank, a year ago. With this loan she will buy multi-vitamins, dietary supplements and other Herbalife products. Her goal is to have a business where she can sell more products for the home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Co,mprar suplementos alimenticios, proteinas y multi vitamínicos Herbalife (To purchase additional supplements, multi-vitamins and Herbalife products)

loans.name: Dagga

texts.fr: Dagga N. est âgée de 66 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 29 mars 2008 et a 03 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle est détentrice d'une petit boutique devant la porte de sa main où elle vend divers produits tels des biscuits, du savon, des boites de conserve, des détergents, etc.. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer sa boutique en marchandises. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dagga N., 66, is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) since March 29, 2008 and has received three consecutive loans. She has a little shop in front of her house, where she sells biscuits, soap, tinned foods, detergent, etc. With her new loan she is going to stock up on the items she sells. Her profit allows her to participate in improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little commercial enterprise

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en:
Shakhla, 45, lives in Baku city with her husband and three children, ages 10, 12 and 15. All five members of her family share a room in a communal apartment. Shakhla’s business is a store known as “1000 trivial things” in Azerbaijan because it sells everything that a person might use in daily life, from umbrellas and needles to screwdrivers. She has been working at this business for the past nine years.

Shakhla is now seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy new merchandise for her shop. As you can see from her picture, she doesn’t have much merchandise left as her husband's illness left them with little money to buy new things for the shop.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia is a single mother of six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t have to take care of any additional family members. She owns a bar selling all types of beers and local drinks. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.

She has been in this business for 15 years. She buys these crates of beer from delivery vans, and local gin from suppliers who get them from Fort Portal district. Leonia works seven days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season. She aspires of owning a fully stocked bar. Leonia joined MCDT because of the low interest charged. Leonia resides and rents a one-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local brew.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Santa María”, está ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano llamado del mismo nombre en el distrito D. Ate, es una alcancía que trabaja con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 4 años, está conformado por 10 socios, asume el cargo D. presidenta la señora Jacinta Juana D. 47 años D. edad, es madre soltera D. 2 hijos en edad académica, se dedica a su bodega desD. hace 7 años en el cual venD. productos alimenticios D. primera necesidad como pan, huevos, leche, azúcar, arroz, gaseosas entre otros. Jacinta incursiono en este negocio porque su esposo la abandono con todos los gastos y no tenia apoyo D. nadie, y sus dos hijos estaban pequeños, además los fines D. semana se dedica a la venta D. anticuchos y panchitos en las afueras D. su casa, grupo D. socios se dedican a las actividades D. servicio como ayudante cocinero, otro presta servicio D. albañil y chofer D. transporte público y otro grupo se dedica a la venta D.  comidas y refrescos en los mercados.
Nuestros socios decidieron el nombre D. Santa María ya que en el lugar donD. viven tiene dicho nombre y se sienten más identificados con él, con su reciente préstamo todos los socios lo invertirán para ampliar su pequeño negocio y con ello tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
Los socios están muy contentos y valoran el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a la devolución  del préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The Santa María Communal Bank is located in the “Asentamiento Humano” (legalized squatter settlement) with the same name in the Ate district. It is a communal bank that has worked with EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad for four years. It is comprised of ten members. Jacinta Juana is the president. She is 47, a single mother, and has two school age children. She has had a grocery store for seven years. She sells basic need foods like bread, eggs, milk, sugar, rice, and soft drinks among other things. Jacinta got into this business because her husband left her with all of the expenses, she did not have help from anyone, and her two children were young. Also, on the week-ends she sells “anticuchos” (a dish maD. with lamb's heart) and “panchitos” (hot dogs) in the areas surrounding her house. The members of this group devote themselves to activities like being a cook’s assistant, providing bricklaying services, and being a public transportation driver. Others in the group sell food and refreshments in the markets. The members decided on the name Santa María because the place where they live has that name, and they felt more recognizable with that name. All of the members will use the new loan to invest in expanding their small businesses. This way they will have a better quality of life. The members are very happy with and value the support provided. They pledge to return the loan punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand their small businesses in order to have a better quality of life

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a citizen of Ismail Nagar, which is an area of a city called Lahore in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms, and lives there with her family. 

She herself operates an embroidery business. She learned this art from her mother and is excellent in it. She started doing this work independently after she married as a way to spend her leisure time, but later she selected it as a profession. In this way she has able to support her husband financially. Her husband's name is K. H.; he is a daily wage labor.  

Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her embroidery business. With the amount she will buy required items such as clothes, beads, sketches and colored thread to make more embroidered dresses to fulfill larger orders. 

Zarina is a regular client of Asasah who has successfully completed two loans and maintained good credit behavior. She hopes that this investment will bring positive change to her business and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her embroidery business

loans.name: Sootaga

texts.en: Sootaga S. is 45 and married with three children aged 6 to 12. She owns a business venture selling baked goods in the local community and has one year of experience in this business. Sootaga needs a loan of WST 1,000 to buy raw ingredients to make more cooked foods. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or approximately US$93 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Sootaga joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Sootaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients to produce more cooked foods to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es soltero, vive en un departamento en alquiler en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Francisco trabaja en la Caja Nacional del Seguro y con el sueldo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para su formación educativa para continuar sus estudios profesionales.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Francisco is single and lives in a rented apartment in the Miraflores area of La Paz. Francisco works in the Caja Nacional del Seguro (National Security Bank) and uses his salary to maintain his home. He is requesting a loan for his education to continue his professional studies. This is the second time that he has requested a loan and our socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue with his professional studies

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Paulina; tiene 45 años de edad y es casada, ella tiene 2 hijos  trabaja vendiendo animales menores en el mercado de ttio, La socia vende pollos, patitos en su stand del mercado de Ttio; ella es comerciante minorista y solicita el préstamo para comprar mayor numero de aves de corral, La socia desea diversificar su negocio y traer otros animales para la venta.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Perlas” (The Pearls), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 45 years old, married, and has two children. Paulina is a small businesswoman who sells small animals, such as chickens and ducks, at the Ttio Market. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry. Paulina wants to diversify her business by bringing other types of animals to sell.

Paulina appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel C. is a 24-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Sitio Calumpang, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of 6000. Maricel is now borrowing PHP 19000 so that she can purchase more goods to sell. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maricel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sadic

texts.en:
Sadic V. is from the village of Macabibo Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. He is 49 years old. Sadic is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Sadic owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from producing and selling nipa (huts) to tourists and local community members. Sadic has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sadic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sadic is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sadic from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make nipa huts for sale

loans.name: Edith Tsindoli

texts.en:
Edith K. is 41 years old. She is married to Buxton K. who is an electrician. They have two children, Joseph 28 years old in the university and Joash who is 20 years old and in secondary school. They live in an area that is not far from Vihiga town.

Edith has been running an auto spares shop selling car paints and spare parts as well for the past 11 years. Her clients mainly consist of motor vehicle mechanics and local motorists who come to buy spare parts and car paints as well as items that can be of use in the motor vehicles from her. She is in need of money to enable her to buy motor spare parts and paints to add to her stock. That is why she applied to get a loan in KADET.

Her desire is to establish a full auto spare parts shop and also open up a garage. She also hopes to give back to the society by educating orphans in her village.

loans.use: To buy motor spare parts to add to her stock

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Шарипова Муслима проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 42 года. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке "Тиджорат". Арендует торговую точку, где продает одежду и обувь. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Она намерена привести сезонные товары.
texts.en: Muslima Shapirova lives in the Yavan district.  She is 42 years old, a widow and has 2 children.  She has a secondary education.  Muslima has been involved in retail sales at the "Tidjorat" market.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells clothing and shoes.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.  Muslima intends to bring in seasonal mechandise.

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Leonarda Avelina

texts.es:
Leonarda es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito D. Paucarcolla, provincia D. Puno, departamento Puno, tiene 52 años D. edad, está  casada y tiene  tres  hijos.  Pudo estudiar la primaria pero no la terminó.
Leonarda se dedica al desollado D. cordero (ganado), los mismos que son entregados a los revendedores  en los mercados D. puno y algunos restaurantes D. la zona. Ella  esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, el primer préstamo, que fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles,  le sirvió para comprar animales menores y  así poder iniciar con su negocio. 
La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio comprando otros animales menores.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y  tener una bodeguita.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y las charlas que recibe por parte D. la promotora.
texts.en:
Leonarda is a member of the community bank "Santiago Apóstol" [Saint James], located in the district of Paucarcolla in the province of Puno in the department of Puno.  She is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  She went to primary school, but she didn't finish.

Leonarda works skinning sheep, which are brought to retailers in the markets in Puno and restaurants in her area.  

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy young animals and start her business.

She is asking for a new loan of 500 nuevos soles to invest in her business by buying more animals.

Her dream is to move her business ahead and have a store.  The things she likes best about her community bank are the punctuality and the talks given by the promoter.

loans.use: Purchase animals

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom S. and her husband, Mr. Onn Ngoun, have been married since 1994 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six, approximately 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarom just started a business growing rice and lotus. Her husband is a fisherman and assists his wife in the farming business as well. 

Sarom had asked for a Kiva loan once before, she now is asking for her second loan of $800 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm. She will also use part of the loan to purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides for farm, and nets for fishing business

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa P. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mamabajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Marisa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marisa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear clothing, blankets, sandals & shoe products in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like pillows & blankets. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like pillows & blankets

loans.name: Sobirahon's Group

texts.en:
Sobirahon A. is the leader of this group.  She is 51 years old and divorced. She has two sons and two daughters. The older son works in construction, the second provides auto repair services, and the daughters study at the university.

In order to earn money, Sobirahon breeds cattle and then resells them at a higher price after fattening.  In this way she earns about $85 per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase two bull calves for breeding. 

In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle and save money to celebrate her daughter’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two bull calves

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in Mian Channu, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She came here nine years ago. Since then she has been living in a two-room brick house in an area called Amrat Nagar.
 
She is 35 years old, married to B. M., who is involved in a timber-selling business. Since gas is not available, her husband is helping people by selling timber to them. His business is working well for him as he sells a good quantity of timber every month.
 
Naseem herself is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and fulfill her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family by taking care of their food and clothing and so forth. She has two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is studying in fifth class while her second son is in third class. Her daughter is 8 years old and studying in class two.
  
Naseem has applied for her first loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy timber in bulk to sell to his clients. The bulk purchasing will help him fulfill the urgent need of his customers and make an extra income.
 
Naseem hopes that after the loan investment her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position.

loans.use: To buy timber for selling

loans.name: Dina Jessela

texts.es: La Sra. Dina Jessela S. R. ella es trabajadora activa de la empresa “ISSDHU” desempeñándose como Ingeniera en Sistema  tiene  dos años  de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno lo ha   realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para solventar unas deudas a particulares, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Dina Jessela S. R. is an active employee of the ISSDHU Company where she has worked as a systems engineer for the past two years. She has received three loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction material such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, and other items to expand and improve her home.

The loan she is requesting will be used to repay a few personal debts. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit in helping her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Repayment of personal debts

loans.name: Bation's Group

texts.en:
Norma B. is from the village of Cogon, City of Ozamis. She is 55 years old, married and has one school-aged and five adult-aged children. Norma is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lydia B.'s Group.

To make a living, Norma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and earns approximately $50 a month. 

In 2011, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note:
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her retail store

loans.name: Christina Wayua

texts.en:
Christina N. is a 69 year-old widow. She supports 10 members of her family. She buys livestock, fattens them, and then sells them. She has been in the business for a period of about 19 years, with an income of KES. 5,000  per month.


She has a good credit history with KADET, and she is applying for her fifth loan, after having successfully repaid the previous loans in good time. She intends to use the entire loan amount to buy two bulls to fatten and sell later at a profit. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy two bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty works hard to support her five children. Betty is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Betty requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy her mechanic's tools.

Betty has been in this business for five (5) years.  

In the future, Betty would like to increase her income and develop her transport operation.

loans.use: To purchase new mechanic's tools

loans.name: Policronio

texts.en:
Policronio is a 46-year-old married man living in Trinidad, Bohol.

Policronio runs a motorcycle business and has had this business for 5 years. This business earns 3000 PHP per month. He also tills a small parcel of land, where he grows rice.

Policronio is asking for a loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. This will help improve his business.

In the future, Policronio hopes for his business to improve.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y aceite, ella atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Angelica is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  Angelica sells essentials such as rice, sugar, noodles and oil.  She serves in her store from 6.00am to 9.00pm and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Angelica would like to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting her loan to buy essentials.

Angelica is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy essentials

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support two children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her fishing business.

Letecia has been 6 years in this business. She earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 52 years old. She is married with four children. She lives at Magsaysay, Baliangao with her husband and children. Her husband is a farmer. In order to help her husband, she runs a grocery store. Nora is able to earn a monthly net income of 4500 out of her business. She has been operating her business for more than 10 years   

In 2006, Nora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her third loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase new stock for her grocery store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for the future of her children.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Shem

texts.en: Shem is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for eight years, and with this business, he has been able to pay school fees and complete building his house. His hardship is the high price of commodities, and his vision is to have a wholesale business. Shem needs the money to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA D. BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lorenza; ella tiene 61 años D. edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. cereales como trigo, habas y cebada y lo venD. en forma ambulatoria y también tiene un terreno D. cultivo donD. siembra maíz y habas, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. cereales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cereales al por mayor.  
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the "Reynita D. Belen Ccorao" community bank which is located in Ccorao district, in Cusco province and department.

Lorenza is 61 years old, widowed, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling cereals such as wheat, beans and barley.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and also owns a plot of land where she grows corn and beans.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Lorenza would like to expand her cereals business.  She is requesting this loan to buy cereals wholesale.

Lorenza is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cereals wholesale

loans.name: Embajadores 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Odania lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She is the coordinator of her group, Embajadores 1 & 2 ("Ambassadors 1 & 2"). The group is made up of Haitian members, all of them who emigrated from Haiti during different periods. Odania's story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where sugarcane and the tourist industry dominate the economy.

Odania sells clothes such as jeans, shirts, skirts, underwear and other things for kids, women and men. She is excited to be seeking her eighth loan with Esperanza; notably, she has successfully repaid her previous loan, which enabled her to grow her business. With each of these loans she has been able to expand her business by introducing new products.

Odania plans to use this loan to invest in her business and invest the profits in more merchandise. She will save some money to achieve her future plans for her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is age 29 and married. They have one child. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years. He learned about KADET through a registered client. He applied for his second loan, which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to make a profit and use it to purchase sheep to fatten.

He dreams that when he reaches age 35, he will be stable and his children will live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Llauquen Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Llauquen”, está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se desempeñan en los rubros de preparación de comida costumbrista, venta de ropa y perfumes. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Castro. 
Nilda quien es la presidenta del banco comunal y que en la foto se encuentra de pie en el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha. Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida costumbrista de la zona del sur de Chile. Entre estas preparaciones se encuentran el milcao, chuchoca, empanadas, pan casero y el curanto. Se desempeña en este rubro desde hace 14 años, ocupa su casa para la preparación de esta comida, para esto cuenta con una cocina a gas, a leña, fuentes, peroles (Recipiente de metal en forma de media esfera y generalmente con dos asas que se usa para cocinar ) y ollas. Comenta que su horario es totalmente flexible y que la temporada de más alta demanda es durante el verano, ya que se realizan muchas fiestas costumbristas y ferias. Sus ingredientes los compra generalmente en supermercados, donde los precios sean más económicos. 
Con el crédito comprará gas, papas, harina y una maquina extendedora de masa.
Sus metas son expandir su negocio y construir un quincho para ofrecer sus comidas en el mismo lugar para que sus clientes consuman directamente el producto. Ya que Nilda se dedica al Reitimiento consiste en la matanza y posterior cocción de un chancho (cerdo) y otros alimentos en un caldero para obtener manteca.
Nilda vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, quienes le ayudan a promocionar sus comidas y atraer nuevos clientes. Uno de sus sueños es que uno de sus hijos termine de estudiar, ya que así podrá optar a mejores trabajos. Además le gustaría viajar dentro del país para conocer algunos lugares. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, debido a que puede contar con un capital que le permita invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta con mucha alegría y cariño las reuniones del banco comunal, ya que el grupo es muy unido y solidario. 
Castro es capital de la isla de Chiloé (la isla más grande de América del Sur), en la región de Los Lagos, zona sur austral de Chile. Su paisaje natural se conserva casi en su totalidad sin intervención del hombre. Además posee una cultura de gran riqueza mítica y costumbrista. Uno de sus grandes atractivos son sus Palafitos, edificaciones (casas) construidas sobre pilotes de madera en la ribera, sobre el mar.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Llauquen" and is comprised of 17 entrepreneurs who are active in traditional food making activities and clothing and perfume sales.  All of them are from the city of Castro.

Nilda is the president of the communal bank and is the first one standing on the left.  She makes and sells traditional food in southern Chile.  Among her products are milcao, chuchoca, meat pies, home-made bread and curanto.  She has been in this business for 14 years and runs it out of her home.  She has a gas stove, firewood, serving trays, and metal pots.  Her workday is flexible and the summer season is when her foods are in highet demand because of the local festivities and fairs.  She buys ingredients at the supermarkets where prices are lower.  With the loan she will buy gas, potatoes, flour and a dough stretching machine.

Her goals are to expand her business and build a stand where her customers can enjoy the food directly.  Nilda makes lard out of pork that she butchers locally and mixes with other foodstuffs.

Nilda lives with her husband and her two children, ages 19 and 17, who help her market her food and attract customers.  One of her dreams is to see her children finish their education so they can get a better job.  She also wants to travel around the country and visit different locations.

She is very happy and grateful for the services she receives through the Fondo Esperanza, since this allows her to have the necessary capital to invest in her business.  She also enjoys the cheerfulness and affection at the meetings at the communal bank, since the group is very united and supportive.

Castro is the capital of the island of Chiloé (the largest in South America), in the region of Los Lagos, in Chile's austral south area.  Its natural landscape is almost totally preserved from human intervention.  It also has a richly mythical, traditional culture.  One of the great attractions are the houses called Palafitos which are built on wooden stilts out over the sea.

loans.use: To buy gas, potatoes, flour and a dough stretching machine.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old and married to Evans.  They have two school-aged children.  She sells clothes as her primary business and also has a taxi as her secondary business.  She has been in this businesses for three years, making a monthly profit of KES.10,000.  

She has requested a loan from KADET LTD of KES.25,000, with which she plans to purchase more clothes for sale.  With the anticipated profit, she plans to educate her children, who are already in secondary school, to higher levels of education.  She hopes that in the near future she can be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Doña Santos tiene 39 años de edad, tiene tres hijos varones y dos hijas mujeres, su esposo se dedica a trabajar la tierra, y su residencia se encuentra en la Comunidad de Las Américas en el Municipio de Patuca. Doña Santos inició su vida laboral vendiendo nacatamales, luego de un tiempo con las ganancias que lograba ir obteniendo se le ocurrió la idea de comprar una bolsa de churros y la colgó en la pared frontal de su vivienda y los niños que pasaban por allí para ir a la escuela se los compraban, así que luego pensó en vender abarroteria en general e hizo un pequeño espacio en su casa para instalar unos estantes y asi comenzar a comprar todo tipo de productos, aunque no fueron muchos los productos que compró ya que no contaba con el capital suficiente pero ahora con los prestamos que ha obtenido en FAMA poco a poco a ido surtiendo su pulperia. Su horario de atención es de 7:00 am a 7:00 pm, y cuando sus hijos regresan de clases le ayudan a atender la pulperia. El mayor desafio que enfrenta Doña Santos es que el lugar donde ella reside es un tanto retirado de la principal via de acceso al Municipio y el acarreo de los productos se le es muy dificil y ademas el costo del transporte es caro, por eso su meta es llegar a tener un carrito pick-up y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios. Doña Santos solicita el prestamo para comprar productos como arroz, azucar, manteca, jabon de lavar ropa y trastes, refrescos, frijoles, café, pan, churros, dulces, jugos, entre otros. Actualmente tiene cinco ciclos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Doña Santos is 39 years old and has three sons and two daughters. Her husband is in charge of working their land. Their home is located in the community of Las Américas in the town of Patuca. Doña Santos started earning her livelihood by selling tamales. Sometime later she bought a bag of donuts and came up with the idea of starting a new business. She used her earnings to begin placing bags of donuts on the front wall of her home so that children passing by on their way to school could buy them. Santos later thought about selling groceries and set aside a small space in her house for installing a few shelves so that she could begin selling all types of products. She was not able to buy many products since she did not have sufficient capital, but now that she has access to loans from FAMA, Santos is able to gradually stock her store. Her schedule of operation is from 7am to 7pm. When her children come home from school, they help with managing the store. The greatest challenge that Doña Santos faces is the location of her home, which is some distance from the main road that leads to town. This makes it difficult to have products delivered and the cost of transportation is expensive. For this reason, her goals are to acquire a small pick-up truck and to help her children finish their studies.

Doña Santos is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, lard, laundry detergent, dish soap, soft drinks, beans, coffee, bread, donuts, candy, juices, and other products. As of now, she has participated in five loan cycles with FAMA and has completed her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Chahongir

texts.ru:
Чахонгир умный, образованный и добрый человек. Он женат и у них двое детей. Он работает инкассатором в финансовом группе «Вавилон». Его зарплата не хватает ему для содержанию своей семьи, он хочет содержит их в хороших условиях и улучшить своё жилищное условия.  С этой целью он начал дополнительный бизнес, чтобы максимизировать своего дохода. Он  занимается скотоводством более 5 лет. Он хочет расширить данный бизнес и получить большую прибыль для содержания своих детей. Он хотел бы получить кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота и корм для них. Чахонгир заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за их доброты и милосердие.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Chahongir is a smart, educated and kind person.  He is married and has two children.  He works as an armoured guard at the "Babylon" financial group.  His salary is not enough to support his family, and he wants to provide good living conditions for them and improve his housing situation.  He started a secondary business in order to maximize his income and achieve this goal.  Chahongir has been involved in animal husbandry for over five years.  He wants to expand this business and make a large profit to support his children.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock and livestock feed.  Chahongir is grateful to all creditors in advance for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 40 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de le  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilL. se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

María Teresa se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprarse un carro para poder transportar los productos para posterior venderlos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 40 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Vencedores Unidos' community bank is located in Anchoveta, on the road to L. Templanza, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

María Teresa is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys and sells her products in Comercial Peña.

María Teresa is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests and plant diseases.  Her dream is to buy a car so that she can transport her products to sell.

In her free time, María Teresa enjoys going out for walks with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is age 36. She is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya with her farm producing potatoes and cabbages for the local market. She has been in farming for 10 years. She sells second hand shoes in the local market to generate more income. She is married with one child who is nine years old.

Lucy has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank. She will use the income generated to educate her child. She aspires to buy a piece of land to construct her own residential house.

She adds that it has been easy dealing with Juhudi Kilimo because of its reliability.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various cuts of beef in large quantities.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is engaged and has one child, 12 years old, who she adopted. She has been running a hair salon for the last four years. She would like a loan to buy new equipment for the salon in order to see her business prosper. The loan will also be used to start her side business of selling mobile air time cards. This business has helped her provide for her family. With the profits she will make a savings for her future. She would love to see her business grow and prosper.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to use in her salon.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
A talented 46-year-old lady, Zubaida operates a sewing business in her home. She does this work to support her family financially. She is the mother of four children: one daughter and three sons. All of her sons are electricians by profession while her daughter stays at home and supports Zubaida in completing her sewing work. 

Her husband is a scrap dealer. He sells scrap to different scrap dealers and factories for a profit. He has been in this business for many years.
 
She is requesting a loan from Asasah, a Kiva partner, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy another sewing machine because currently she has one which is not enough for her and her daughter to complete their work. She is hopeful that with the additional machine, they both will be able to receive more orders and finish them on time. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zubaida.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her sister’s daughter and a brother. 

Barbara has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Barbara sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Barbara has requested  for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.

The main business challenges for Barbara include seasonality, thieves, and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to start building rental rooms. Barbara lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and school.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito, es un hombre soltero de 48 años de edad, el tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad e independientes, el se dedica a brindar el servicio de coccina ( tallarines, arroz con pollo, etc) ya que desde muy pequeño le encantaba cocinar, porque le parece que este negocio es rentable y porque le gusta atender bien a sus clientes.
Benito es un hombre, ejemplar, luchador, trabajador y muy responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante, Benito brinda este servicios desde el año  2001 , gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/ 400 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Benito invertirá este crédito para la inversión de un local propio, para que de este modo pueda generar mayores ingresos. El  sueño del señor Benito es tener su restaurante para que en un determinado futuro pueda tener un mejor calidad de vida  , su asesor cree es que una excelente cliente y que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente .
Benito vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
texts.en:
Benito is a 48-year-old single man.  He has two children who are adults and live independently.  Benito's business is providing a food service (tagliatelle, chicken and rice, etc.)  He started this business because he has loved cooking from a very young age, he believes the business to be profitable, and he enjoys serving his customers well.

Benito is an exemplary, tenacious, hard-working and very responsible man who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  He has been providing this service since 2001.  He earns, on average, 400 soles a week.  With this loan for 1,500 soles which he will receive thanks to Kiva, Benito will invest in his own premises so that he can make more income.  Benito's dream is to own his restaurant so that, in the future, he can enjoy a better quality of life.  His field officer believes him to be an excellent client who will make his repayments on time.

Benito lives and works in Ica.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital.  It is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peru's traditional national drink, Pisco.  We find the client's home and business in this hot, arid climate.

loans.use: to invest in his own premises

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a kind and humble person. He is 41 years old and has three children. He is married to Analiza, who is a housewife. 

He uses his skills to generate an income. He offers t-shirt printing, sticker designs and streamers. Aside from printing services, he also raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for future sale as a source of income. 

As of now, George would like to strengthen his printing business to earn more income. He is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy paints, ink and pens to use in his printing services.

In the future, George would like to earn consistent profits so he can pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy paints, ink and pens to use in his printing services

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, nuevamente solicita un préstamo, pues necesita compra materiales agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz, como abono y herbicidas, pues su siembra se encuentra adelantada y quiere dar un nuevo fortalecimiento para que produzca abundantemente.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para que pudiera realizar el cultivo, dándole una nueva cosecha para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Florentín is asking for a new loan because he needs to buy agricultural supplies for his corn crop such as fertilizer and herbicides.  His sowing is making progress and he wants to strengthen it so it produces plenty.

His previous loan helped him plant his crop, giving him a new harvest to sustain his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice, age 47, is married to a businessman. She has 3 children between 26 and 29 years old. She sells a local soft juice made from sorghum. With the loan she will buy more sorghum for making juice. She plans to use the profits from the business to make some savings and buy a domestic animal to raise. She dreams of having a large stock of sorghum in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for making juice.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis de 27 años convive con Eliana hace 5 años, con quien tuvo a Fernanda, su hija de 5 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, provincia de Chanchamayo. Elvis es un esposo y padre ejemplar. Todo su esfuerzo tiene como motor su familia. Desde pequeño aprendió las labores del campo, es así que inició con sus propios sembríos en parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. 
De esa manera ha podido surtir y equilibrar su producción. Él cultiva café, achiote, maíz y plátano.
“De mi parcela de café obtengo como 10 sacos de café, cada saco es de 50 a 60 kilos”, menciona. 
La siembra de achiote es rentable, para los comuneros de la zona, por los suelos y condiciones climáticas. Elvis produce 1000 kilos cada año y vende rápidamente para las empresas de condimentos y a otros compradores que se lo llevan como colorante.
Elvis quiere ampliar sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Con eso quiere darle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija y esposa. Ésta sería la primera vez que Elvis obtendría un crédito de MFP, por tal razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente emocionado por ser parte del banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”. De recibir el dinero, podrá iniciar una siembra de plátanos, para ello comprará mamones de plátanos, cada uno a 50 céntimos. Necesitará 900 mamones con mínimo. Con lo restante comprará abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Elvis, age 27, has lived with Eliana for five years. They have a five-year-old daughter named Fernanda, and live in their own home in the native community of Pachacutec, in the Chanchamayo province. Elvis is a model husband and father, and his family is the motivation behind all his hard work. He learned farmwork at a young age, and started off his own crops on parcels of land that his community and parents gave him.
He has been able to improve his production, and he cultivates coffee, annatto, corn, and bananas.
"I've been able to get something like 10 bags of coffee from my coffee crop, each bag weighing 50 to 60 kilos," he says.
Annatto is a profitable crop for the local farmers because of the normal weather conditions. Elvis produces 1000 kilos each year, and it sells quickly to the seasoning businesses, and to other buyers who use it as a dye.
Elvis wants to expand his land and increase production. With the income from doing so, he wants to give his wife and daughter better living conditions. This will be his first loan with MFP, so he gives his word that he will be punctual in paying off his quotas. He is excited to be a part of the "Los Claveles de Pachacutec" communal bank. Upon receiving this money, he will be able to start sowing bananas. In order to do so, he will buy banana offshoots; each one costs 50 cents. He will need at least 900 offshoots. With the remaining money he will buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy 900 banana offshoots and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 57 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married and a mother of three children. She has been in the farming business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mary will use the loan to buy seedling and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedling and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Maximo de 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 20 y 16 años, por los cuales trabaja muchísimo para que sean felices y que tengan una buena calidad de vida,; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores tienen un don particular, cocinan de manera deliciosa y sobre todo son personas muy carismáticas y amables. Cuando Maximo dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar las noticias para poder estar enterado de lo pasa en la actualidad; asimismo le encanta disfrutar uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “arroz con pato”.

Con mucho carisma Maximo abre su negocio de venta de abarrotes desde tempranas horas de la mañana, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 35 clientes en el dia, el cree que le va bien en el negocio porque brinda una buena atención al público.

Maximo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que le han brindado su apoyo por segunda vez y gracias a ello podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio en especial arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, entre otros; lo que le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer y así seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una gran tienda y ser un gran microempresario”.
texts.en:
Máximo, 46, lives with his wife and two children aged 20 and 16 who he works hard for so that they will be happy and have good quality of life. When Máximo has any free time available he likes to listen to the news in order to be well-informed about current events and he also likes to enjoy one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz con Pato” (Duck with Rice).

With much charisma Máximo opens his grocery store very early in the morning and works about 10 hours daily taking care of up to 35 customers daily.  He believes he does well in the business because he provides good service to the public.

Máximo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this is the second time they’ve provided support for him and thanks to it he will be able to buy more merchandise for his business, especially rice, sugar, oil and milk, among others that will make it possible for him to have more variety of products on hand to offer and continue striving daily to make his greatest dream reality: to have a great store and to become a great micro businessman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Gbenoukpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENOUKPO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, nommée Victoire (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 31 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Victoire est mariée a un revendeur du nom de Germain. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous a leur charge. Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Victoire vend des friperies et des fruits de saison de façon ambulante depuis six ans. Victoire  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Victoire ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBENOUKPO sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des friperies et des fruits de saison.

loans.name: L'heure De Dieu A Sonne Group

texts.fr: L'HEURE DE DIEU A SONNE est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Dossi Clotilde (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 36 ans. Dossi Clotilde  est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Sylvain. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Dossi Clotilde et son mari. Pour cette raison, Dossi Clotilde vend du gari (farine de manioc, du riz, de l'huile végétale et du haricot dans sa région depuis cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Dossi Clotilde s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Dossi Clotilde sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe L'HEURE DE DIEU A SONNE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du gari, du riz et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
A well known flower shop specialized in organizing special events was established fifteen years ago, and developed through a talented thirty three year old married mother of one child called Berta.
Berta is a highly motivated person, who invested her business in supporting her husband in developing their family' living, and making sure they can provide their only child the best education.
She invested her skills, and developed her flowers selling shop in parallel with her husband's business, who works as a musician and a DJ which helped her promote her work and acquire more customers.
