Today, Berta is investing in developing and diversifying her business especially for the coming Holy Christmas season, for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase and diversify the Christmas gifts and gadgets collection, in addition to new released Christmas themed decorations.
Berta is working hard to stay capable of expanding and developing her business to make sure she maintain sustainability.
This is Berta's sixth loan cycle from Al Majmoua, with a good standing paying back history. Her previous loans were invested in developing her current business and she proved to be a responsible and creative person.

loans.use: To increase and diversify the Christmas gifts and gadgets collection, in addition to new released Christmas themed decorations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock different varieties of newspaper and magazines

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin has 2 years of experience in this business.
To begin his business he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought a pregnant cow. He wants to increase his income level to be able to meet the demands of his family. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 pregnant cows. Amin is 27 years old, lives in Salyan region Khaladj village, married, and has a child.

loans.use: To buy 2 pregnant cows

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.en:
Ingrid has a business where she raises and sells chickens. She started off a couple of months ago when her husband gave her $20 to invest in 60 chicks. With another $20 she had in savings she bought the chicken feed and set up her backyard to raise the chicks.

She is looking to take out another loan with Kiva and Mifex. With her previous loan she invested in 300 more chicks for her operation. Things went very well as she was able to make a profit. But there was one flaw. Her chickens often suffocated due to the lack of ventilation. She is seeking this loan in order to buy a fan and improve the living conditions in the coop.

loans.use: to buy a fan for her chicken coop

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa is a 30-year old single woman. To help her family, she has a cafe with a partner, Margarita M. J., who is another member of the Jastic 2 group. The other members of the group are Dona Ernestina Bautista (clothes sales) and Antonia M. J. (sales of plastic containers for storing food). With the loan, Rosa and Margarita will improve the look of the cafe to draw more customers; Ernestina will buy more clothes in different sizes to increase her customer base; and Antonia will buy more supplies of containers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA tiene 30 años, soltera. Para ayudar a su familia tiene una cafetería en sociedad con Margarita Méndez Juárez quien es otra integrante del grupo Jastic 2. Las otras integrantes del grupo son doña Ernestina Bautista (venta de ropa) y Antonia Méndez Juárez (venta de posillos de plástico para mantener alimento). Con el préstamo Rosa y Margarita hermosearan el local para una mejor atención a sus clientes, Ernestina comprara mas ropa en diferentes tallas para aumentar su clientela, y Antonia comprara mas surtido de trastes.

loans.use: Cafe

texts.id:
M. (23) is married. she was active member of yamida for 1 years ago. To help support her family, M. sells snacks and household goods in a kiosk in front of her house. From the kiosk, she earns about $10 per day. M. needs $100 loan to expand her kiosk's offering and fix her kiosk. Hopefully with the renovation and expansion, she can better help her husband and increase her family income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use:
$ 50 to expand product offering
$ 50 for kiosk renovation

loans.name: Maria Luísa

texts.pt:
Maria Luisa C. is 52 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She sells fruits, vegetables and some other basic need goods, such as bread and cookies from her residence in Bagamoyo, Maputo. She joined the program in 2005 as a member of the Espereança Group getting a loan in the amount of 1.800MT. Her business has seen a steady gradual growth and she has never made a late payment towards her loan balance. She is now in her fifth cycle and she will borrow 8.000MT that will be paid in 6 months. This loan will be invested in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Luisa C. tem 52 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 5 filhos. Vende fruta e alguns produtos de 1ª necessidade como pão, biscoitos,etc. na sua residência sita no bairro Bagamoyo em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em 2005 como cliente grupal, membro do grupo Esperança e tomou como 1º empréstimo 1.800MT.Tem verificado um crescimento gradual no seu negócio e nunca teve atrasos nos pagamentos dos empréstimos.Está agora no 5º ciclo e vai tomar 8.000MT para pagar em 6 meses para continuar a reforçar o seu negócio.

loans.use: Stock Increase.

loans.name: Lalu

texts.id:
Lalu uses a basic cart to sell Es Kelapa Muda (a popular sweet drink made from the clear juice and meat of a young coconut). When the weather is warm he can sell approximately 20 to 30 coconuts at a price of 2,000 to 2,500 Rupiah each. Lalu increases his price when he is in his strategic selling location next to a school. He brings in approximately 30,000 Rupiah per day. However, during the rainy season, when it is not as hot, his sales dry up. To overcome this problem, he sells small snacks instead. Lalu, and his wife who works with him, would like to borrow 1,000,000 Rupiah to purchase more snacks to sell during cool weather. They must make at least 15,000 Rupiah per day to meet their living expenses including raising their only child.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Lalu menggunakan rombong yang sederhana untuk berjualan es kelapa muda. Rata – rata dia bisa menjual 20 – 30 butir kelapa muda dalam cuaca panas dengan harga per butirnya Rp 2.000,00 – Rp 2.500,00, ditambah lagi lokasinya strategis, yaitu dekat dengan sekolah. Keuntungan rata- rata per hari Rp 30.000,00. Namun, di saat musim hujan dagangannya menjadi sepi. Untuk mengatasi hal ini dia menjual makanan ringan. Dia memerlukan pinjaman sebesar Rp 1.000.000,00. Lalu berjualan bersama dengan isterinya. Mereka harus memenuhi biaya hidup Rp 15.000,00 dan menghidupi anak semata wayang mereka.

loans.use: to help grow his business and to purchase more snacks to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes belongs to the Virgen de la Natividad communal bank, situated in the corner of Jr. Revolución and San Martín Nº 520 in the Calleria district in Ucayali. She is 54 years old, and is the mother of 5 children, all independent. Her husband is a teacher. Mercedes, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300, decided to invest in the sale of prepared meals.

Currently, she sells breakfasts and lunches in her front porch. She wakes up at 4 a.m. to go to the market to buy the provisions that she will need to prepare her meals. At 6 a.m., she is ready to tend to her clients who love her flavoring. In the afternoon she rests so that she can be energized for the following day.

With the loan of S/. 1,500, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 case of oil, 1 case of milk, vegetables, fruits, etc.

Mercedes is very happy, and she feels great because the meals she prepares have a strong following. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mercedes pertenece al banco comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en esquina del Jr. Revolución con San Martín Nº 520, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años y es madre de 5 hijos, todos independientes, su esposo es profesor. Mercedes con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad vende desayunos y almuerzos en la puerta de su domicilio. Se levantan a las 4.00 a.m. para ir al mercado a comprar sus víveres que va a necesitar para la preparación de sus comidas, a las 6.00 a.m. está lista para atender a sus clientes que gustan mucho de su sazón y en las tarde ella descansa para tener energías para el día siguiente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de leche, verduras, frutas, etc.

Mercedes está muy feliz, se siente muy bien porque la comida que prepara tiene mucha acogida y está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo .

loans.use: Purchase of provisions to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Num

texts.en:
Mrs. Num L., 47, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She works as a house wife cooking food for her family members. Her husband, Mr. Yim Chun, works as a construction foreman making on average, around $12 each day. Additionally, one of her children works as a blacksmith, two are garment workers, and the rest of whom are unemployed.

Mrs. Num L. is humble to request for a loan to purchase more construction tools to facilitate her husband’s work. She believes the new tools will reduce his labor force and make his job much faster and more productive.

loans.use: to purchase more construction tools to facilitate her husband’s work

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en: Shukufa T. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She settled with her family in Beylagan in 1993. She is 59 years old, married, and has five children. She raises chickens in her yard and sells them in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has been engaged in this business for more than seven years. She applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan in the amount of $700 for developing her hen business.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Ramzieh

texts.en: Ramzieh is 61 years old, and has 6 children. She works and lives in Aley. Ramzieh sells a variety of products. This will be her first loan, and she would like to purchase new merchandise to further expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Mr. Mohamed F. is 25 and married. He sells general food products and cosmetics. Mr. F.’s store is located in Adéta, a small village approximately 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Many women like to purchase cosmetics in his store, and he sells sufficient quantities of these products. With this second FECECAV loan, he would thus like to purchase straightening creams, pomades, nail polish, hair extensions and wigs. He also hopes to purchase twelve bags of rice, ten containers of oil, five boxes of soap, ten boxes of powdered milk and five boxes of mayonnaise. These purchases will allow him to increase his supplies so that he can meet his customers’ needs and earn more profit. In doing so, he believes he can truly improve his life.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Mohamed F. est âgé de 25ans et marié. Il est spécialisé en alimentation générale et en produits de beauté. La boutique de Monsieur Mohamed est située à Adéta, un petit village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise .Comme beaucoup de femmes aiment acheter les produits de beauté dans sa boutique et comme il les vend en quantité suffisante, avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, il souhaite acheter les savons de défrisage, les pommades, les vernis, les mèches et les perruques .Il espère acheter également 12 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, 5 cartons de savons de toilette, 10 cartons de lait en poudre et 5 cartons de mayonnaise. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter la capacité de sa boutique pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits. Il compte vraiment améliorer sa vie.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for his store

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta is a very happy farmer who is committed to her work as she is to her role as a mother. This is why she has always tried to work hard in the countryside, leaving very early in the morning, despite the intense cold. Throughout these activities, she has never stopped caring for her husband and her children, who love and help her with her work on the farmland. Although her children are small, they try where possible to offer friendly company to their mother.

Violeta, motivated by her love for them, wishes to increase her agricultural production and sell in nearby cities at affordable and profitable prices, to overcome her family’s poverty. She wishes to obtain a loan to optimize her work and increase profits for the benefit of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

VIOLETA, es una agricultora muy alegre y comprometida con su trabajo de manera similar con su rol como madre, es por ello que siempre ha tratado de trabajar lo más duro en el campo, saliendo muy de mañana a pesar del intenso frío.Dentro de estas actividades nunca ha dejado de atender a su esposo y a sus hijos quienes la aman y la ayudan con su labor en sus terrenos y aunque sus hijos son pequeños tratan en lo posible de brindarle una compañía agradable a su madre.

Violeta por amor a ello desea incrementar su producción agrícola y trasladarlos en las ciudades más cercanas y venderlas a precios módicos y rentables, de la misma forma poder sacar de la pobreza a su familia. Desea obtener un préstamo para optimizar su labor e incrementar sus ganancias en beneficio de su amada familia.

loans.use: Capital to optimize her agricultural work

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old. She is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. She lives with her family in the Dunga slums of Kisumu, Kenya. She is the proprietor of a fruit stall she started in 2005. She requests US $600 to purchase more stock of fruits in bulk.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fruit.

loans.name: Phamthi

texts.vi:
Before joining the TYM Fund, Mrs. U. faced a lot of difficulties in doing business because her husband passed away and her 2 children were still going to school. In 2003, she joined the TYM Fund to borrow money. At first, she invested in raising chickens. However, later on, she realized that growing decorative plants brought more profits. Therefore, she decided to invest in growing plants. Because she has learned lots of experience from other people, she has a lot of customers. Currently, her 2 children are all grown-up. She and her children work on growing the plants to meet local people’s needs. With an earning of 200 USD/month, their living conditions have improved. This time, she wants to borrow 1100 USD to invest in both raising animals and growing decorative plants.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

 Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị Uẩn gặph rất nhiều khó khăn về kinh tế do chồng chị mất sỡn, các con đang tuổi đến trường.Năm 2003 chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. . Ban đầu chị vay vốn và đầu tư vào chăn gà nhưng sau đó nhận thấy việc trồng cây cảnh đem lại lợi nhuận cao hơn nên gia đình chị đã quyết đinh đầu tư phần lớn vốn vay vào dự án này. Nhờ chăn chỉ học hỏi kinh nghiệm và khéo tay nên cây cảnh nhà chị được nhiều khách hàng ưa thích. Hiện nay các con chị đều đã trưởng thành nên chị và 2 con tập trung để trồng và chăn sóc cây cảnh bán cho người dân địa phương. Với 3.000.000đ thu nhập ổn định từ chăn nuôi và bán cây cảnh cuộc sống của ba mẹ con chị Uẩn đã được cải thiện rõ rệt. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 18.000.000 đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và trồng cây cảnh .

loans.use: Raising animals and growing decorative plants

loans.name: Rola

texts.en: Rola K., 29 years old and the mother of one child, lives in Northern Lebanon close to the town of Baalback.  A very active woman who works as a hair dresser, her creative mind is always searching for ways to better develop her shop.  Rola is requesting a $500 loan from Al Majmoua to purchase various new hairdressing tools including scissors and hairdryers. This will be Rola's first loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new hairdressing tools

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida N. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. She first applied when she heard from her sister about the MicroInvest loan procedure. She knew she could improve her business and open a trade outlet in the local bazaar to sell eggs. She has sufficient business turnover but she wants to work further with the MicroInvest. Now Mrs. N. is applying to KIVA for a loan of 3100 STJ for the educational program of her daughter. She dreams of a good future for her children and thanks KIVA for the support and hopes for good co-operation.

loans.use: Farida would like to increase her business in order to give her children good educations.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Doña Eulalia tiene 54 años D. edad, estudió el quinto año D. secundaria, es casada, madre D. 3 hijos y vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa s/n, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chuchito, departamento D. Puno.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” D. Juli. Con el préstamo D. S/. 300 aumentó su capital para comprar cosméticos y vender en la ciudad del Cusco. Trabaja con diferentes productos D. acuerdo a la temporada, por ejemplo en estos meses está vendiendo ponchos D. plástico para la lluvia, en el mes D. Diciembre venderá productos naviD.ños.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará  10 docenas D. ponchos impermeables y cosméticos que venderá en Cusco.

Su deseo es que su hijo menor sea profesional, ya que los mayores lograron serlo.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 54 years old. She finished the fifith year of high school, is married, is mother to three children and lives in Jr. Santa Rosa s/n, Juli district, Chuchito province, Puno department (region).

She is one of the founding members of Juli's "Small Roma" Community Bank. With the loan of 300 Soles, she increased her capital in order to purchase and sell cosmetics in the city of Cuzco. She works with different products according to the season. For example, in current months, she is selling plastic ponchos for the rain, but in December, she will sell Christmas products.

With this loan of 1,000 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy ten dozen waterproof ponchos and cosmetics which she will sell in Cuzco.

Her wish is that her youngest child becomes a professional since the older ones have managed to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ten dozen waterproof ponchos, as well as cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Ilda

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Nobleza" (Nobility) Village Bank. She is 36 years old and lives with her partner and their three children.

Rosa sells construction materials such as bricks and sand. She also runs her own brick-making business in the Pacaycasa District of central Peru. She employs a number of workers, who make the bricks from Pacaycasan earth, then Rosa fires them herself in a rented oven and delivers them to her customers’ homes or construction sites.

Rosa is requesting a loan of 3,400 soles to pay her workers with. She has been a FINCA client for 12 years; over the years, FINCA loans have helped her build her house and buy a motorcycle taxi to rent out to a driver.

loans.use: Pay brickmakers' salaries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 36 años, vive con su pequeña hija Mariela de 3 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comestibles desde hace 3 años, luego de que tuviera que afrontar sola el cuidado de su pequeña hija de 3 años, a la cual se dedica íntegramente.  A Elizabeth le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede cuidar a su pequeña hija, permitiéndole al mismo tiempo, atender su negocio, el cual ya va creciendo poco a poco gracias a todo el esfuerzo que ella hace para sacarlo adelante. Elizabeth tiene puestas todas las esperanzas en su tienda, ya que sabe que gracias a ella podrá darle una buena educación a su pequeña, es por eso que requiere de nuestra ayuda para poder cumplir todas sus metas. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado implementará su tienda con más cantidad de productos, entre ellos panteones, que son muy vendidos en estas épocas de Navidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old and lives with her young 3-year old daughter Mariela. She has been selling food for the past 3 years, after she was faced with being the sole caretaker of her little 3 year old daughter, to whom she is completely devoted. Elizabeth enjoys her work as she is able to care for her little girl at the same time as tending to her business, which is slowly growing thanks to all her efforts. Elizabeth has pinned all her hopes on her store, as she knows that it is thanks to her business that she will be able to give her little one a good education; it is to this end that she needs our help, to be able to achieve her goals. In her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, she was always very punctual in her repayments. She will use this loan to buy a greater quantity of products, including nativity scenes which are very popular during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the stock of her store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. is a 29-year-old married woman with 3 children. Both she and her husband were deprived of higher education (they only attended elementary school) and their humble abode is a nipa hut, consisting of bamboo and recycled materials.

She and her husband can only afford to operate a fishing business to generate income for the benefit of their family. Their daily sales provide just enough income to cover the family's living expenses, but they have had to make difficult decisions along the way. For instance, they have three children to raise and to feed, and the couple almost did not send their children to school due to their limited income. However, she and her husband are determined to see to it that their children live a better life and have more opportunities than they had.

As a result, Rosalie and her husband patiently and politely sought assistance in the form of a capital infusion for their fishing business. They are extremely thankful for Paglaum MPC, which helped to initially finance their business. They are now seeking a loan in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase a fishing boat, a fish net, and other fishing accessories. At this time, they are satisfied to be able to maintain their current business and to have access to Paglaum, which allows poor people like Rosalie to better their lives.

loans.use: To expand and improve the business by purchasing fishing accessories (e.g., a fishing boat, a fish net, etc.)

loans.name: Alfiya

texts.en:
Alfiya is married with two children. She and her family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Alfiya sells nice quality fabrics for national dresses at a large local market. Her family is actively helping her with her business, which she started about 4 years ago. Alfiya would like to ask for a loan of $1200 USD to increase her inventory, which will keep her supplied until the spring season. She believes this timely investment will help generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Alfiya’s responsibility and strong character will assist her with the current loan repayment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new fabrics to increase the variety of goods for sale.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara is 50 years old. She lives in the town of Khachmaz. She has been in the tailoring business for ten years. Now, Gulnara needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy cloth to sew clothes.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sew clothes

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is twenty-four years old. She is single and lives alone in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to make some income to improve herself.

Juliana is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She sells to the school pupils in the local school compound. She procures bags of rice and other ingredients such as vegetables, cooking oil, etc. from the local wholesalers. She also sells on a table top by the roadside in the evenings. Juliana has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to make some savings before marriage.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice

loans.name: Karea's Group

texts.en:
Karea W., age 60, is married with eight grown-up children. She has a clothing shop, which she started in 2002.   She works daily from 8am until 5pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $296. 

This will be Karea’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use this loan to increase her capital and start selling handbags.
 	
Karea will share this loan with her loan group, Temeke, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Karea is first on the left, standing with a covered head.

loans.use: To start selling handbags

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. is married to Manuel B. who works as a farmer. They are blessed with five children. The couple lives with their children in the village of Dummon, Quezon, Isabela. Their only source of income is their small "sari-sari" store (a typical store in the village). The couple is wishing to send their children to school and to pursue their education.

Leonida needs additional capital for her store in order to increase her income, and for this reason, she is requesting a loan amounting to Php 12,000 for the expansion of her business. She wants to buy more products for her store in order to earn more profit. In that way, they will be able to attain all their goals in life.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Jamila Begum John Masih Group

texts.en:
Jamila begum baji has been a citizen of a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is an uneducated lady; she wanted to study but her father couldn’t pay for her education expenses because he had few financial resources. Her husband is a salesman and sells candies to shops. He has 2 years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to buy candies wholesale so that he will be able to sell them to the shopkeepers and earn more income.

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Sheena Mahak baji wants a loan to buy medicines to resell. Kishwar baji wants a loan to buy computer spare parts to sell. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Salma baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: buying candies wholesale to sell to shops

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia S. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Alicia owns and operates a pub. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional drinks. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional drinks. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional drinks for her pub

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es:
La señora María Cecilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su mamá emprendió un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
María Cecilia belongs to the El Tiempo es Oro Community Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 30 and in a common law marriage. She has two dependent children who attend school. Encouraged by her mother, and needing to contribute to the household income, she used her first loan for 300 PEN to set up a small business of selling groceries. She got very good results from the beginning due to the quality of her products, her comfortable prices, and the good attention she gives her customers. She currently continues with the same business, which is located in her house. Her primary customers are her neighbors. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy more products to stock her business. She will buy products such as kilos of rice and sugar, eggs, supplies for personal hygiene, household cleaning supplies, packages of soft drinks, sweets, and other products to keep her customers happy. She feels very happy about the work and service offered. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue like this for a long time, helping many families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to augment her products

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 34-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Mouhamad has been working as a car painter for sixteen years. Mouhamad requested a loan of $3,000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his garage. Mouhamad is special in his work because of his efficiency. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mouhamad first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mouhamad decided on doing his work because of his experience and wanting to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and paint for his work.

loans.name: Kazeem

texts.en: Kazeem is 32 years old and married with 2 children. He is a fashion designer. He is requesting a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase tailoring materials. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Cossy

texts.en:
Cossy is a 22 year married with two children aged 11 months and 4 fours.  One of her children goes to school. She resides and owns a two roomed house where she is staying with three people. Cossy takes care of additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area where she deals in cold drinks and refreshments.  She incurs extra transport costs from and to shopping. Cossy sells to an average of 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees. Feeding the family She has been in this business for the last five years Harriet has been with MCDT for years servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes.  Cossy is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a rental rooms 
 

.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Brigitte B. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BELFORT depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Avec son prêt elle va développer une activité de vente de miel et les bénéfices lui servirons à participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la maison, à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et à payer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Brigitte B. is 47 years old, married and mother of 7 children. She has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for 7 years and has benefitted from 14 loans, all of which she has had no problems repaying. With this loan she will develop her business selling honey and the income will allow her to cover some of the daily household expenses, to improve her family’s quality of life and to pay for her children’s education.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her business selling honey

loans.name: Mariette

texts.en:
Mariette U. is 37 years old and she is married with four children aged between 12 and 6.
She lives in kicukiro district, Kigali province capital of Rwanda where she sells her clothes since 2004. she employs one person in her business.

Mariette is requesting her  first loan from Vision finance company in order to expand her business so that she gets more profit  through this profit she plans to save money for her future

loans.use: Purchasing more clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ROSA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA SEPARADA DE SU MARIDO SE DEDICO A TRABAJAR SOLA Y MANTUVO A SUS DOS HIJOS HASTA QUE ESTOS SE INDEPENDIZARON, AHORA ELLA TRABAJA PARA SU PROPIO BIEN. ES RESPONSABLE CON SUS PAGOS Y TRABAJA TODOS LOS DIAS SIN IMPORTAR LAS INCLEMENCIAS DEL TIEMPO ACTUALMENTE SE ESTA HACIENDO CARGO DE UNA SOBRINA LA CUAL SUFRIA MALTRATOS DE SU MADRASTRA. EL CREDITO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE PELICULAS DE ESTRENO EN EL FORMATO DVD.

loans.use: Invertira en compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es una alegre persona, tiene 46 años y vive con su pareja y su hijo Jean Carlos de 16 años de edad, todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años él se ha dedicado a brindar servicio de taxi, ya que siempre tuvo inclinación hacia el manejo de autos, gustándole desde que era muy joven. Walter recuerda que comenzó su trabajo como cobrador en microbus de transporte público y posteriormente a fue chofer de un auto que alquiló. Es así que desde entonces se dedica a esta actividad con mucha alegría, ya que se distrae mucho realizándolo, pues recorre diferentes distritos de la ciudad. 
Pero salir desde muy tempranas horas en la mañana y regresar tarde en la noche le resulta muy cansado; además, a veces se encuentra con pasajeros problemáticos que no quieren pagar la tarifa. Felizmente él ama su trabajo y quiere seguir progresando y gracias a los duros esfuerzos que hizo logró refaccionar su propio auto y ahora trabaja muy orgulloso en él, pues se ahorra el pago del alquiler logrando mejores ingresos.

Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita refaccionará su auto para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Walter is a cheerful person. He is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and their 16 year old son Jean Carlos. Walter has been providing taxi services for 10 years. He has always had an inclination for driving cars, since he was fascinated by them as a kid. Walter says he began working as a public bus driver and later as a chauffeur of a rented car. He takes pleasure in all of his jobs because they have provided a distraction from reality and he gets to travel to different parts of the city.

Walter begins his day in the early morning hours and returns home tired very late at night. He has encountered problems with passengers who refuse to pay their cab fare. Fortunately, he loves his job and wants to continue succeeding through his hard work. Walter has managed to repair his own vehicle, which gives him a feeling of satisfaction. Since he does not have to rent a vehicle, he is able to save more of his income.

This will be Walter’s fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. He has always been known to be punctual with his payments. With the money he requested, he will make repairs to his vehicle so that he can provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 28-year-old married man with 4 children. He has owned a bakery since 1993 where he services the neighboring villages. Today, Mahmoud is requesting to borrow $800 to add new decor and renovate his bakery in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: add new decor

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 23 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su pequeña de 4 añitos, en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de primera necesidad, para ello cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, con quien hace dos años y medio acondicionaron un espacio de su vivienda apropiado y acogedor para su bodega. En el primer año fue difícil porque no vendía rápido sus productos y a veces se le malograban o se vencían, pese a esa dificultad siguieron adelante, ya que le agrada muchísimo esta actividad, porque le gusta hacer amigos y conversar. 
Hoy, gracias a su perseverancia, han ganado clientela y Mónica se esmera en darles una buena atención, ya que gracias a estos clientes su negocio sigue en pie.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se muestra muy agradecida, ya que estos créditos son de mucha ayuda. Con el dinero que ahora solicita incrementará los productos comestibles para surtir mejor su bodega.
texts.en:
Mónica, 23, lives with her life partner and father of her 4-year-old daughter in their own house. She sells basic food items. Her husband supports her efforts and together they arranged a part of their house to act as a welcoming and appropriate general store. The first year was very difficult because her sales were slow and sometimes her products would stay on the shelf beyond their expiration date or they would spoil. Despite this obstacle, they stuck to it because she loves this work because it allows her to make friends and chat. Today, thanks to her perseverance, she has acquired a steady clientele and Mónica takes great pains to provide good customer service because it is thanks to these customers that her business continues afloat. This is her third loan with MFP and she is most grateful because these loans are a big help. With the funds requested she will increase her stock of food items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up an internet stand

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena R. is from the city of Balibago 1st in Tarlac. She is 26 years old. Magdalena is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Magdalena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice grain to local community. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Magdalena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Magdalena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her   family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en:
Mrs. Rotha Chhoun is 28 years old. She lives in Tonle vollage in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who has a piece of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Tao Choun, is a motorbike taxi driver in the local village. Both of them try to work hard but they still earn less income than needed to support the family. 
Mrs. Rotha Chhoun wants to expand and improve her farming so she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and the rest of the loan she wants to get a new motorbike for her husband. Mrs. Rotha Chhoun is a mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and the rest of the loan she wants to get a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has been married to her husband, Pampilo, since 1988. They have five children: the oldest is now 19 and is in college.

Virginia and her husband started farming two years after their marriage. Virginia can say that farming is not an easy job but she is still determined to succeed so she gives her best every day. She wants to earn more so that she can sustain her children’s education and the growing needs in her household.

Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She is now requesting a loan of Php 7,000 which she will use to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Freddy Ramón

texts.es:
Freddy Ramón G. T. es un señor de 33 años de edad el  cual vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace 8 meses Don Freddy consiguió trabajo en un lugar donde se siembra piña pero comenta que su trabajo se encuentra bastante lejos de su casa y que se le ha dificultado  la manera de llegar hasta él, ya que los caminos no están en muy buen estado y además hay muy poco transporte público, además comenta que tiene una parcela, pero ha tenido que dejar  de darle mantenimiento ya que no ha tenido el suficiente tiempo para dedicarle puesto que llega muy tarde a su casa. 

Por lo cual don Freddy  ha decidido comprar una moto para poder transportarse mejor y así agilizar  la forma en la que viaja así también podrá  ahorrar y aprovechar más  el tiempo. Por lo tanto requiere un préstamo de ¢654.000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro mil colones) para comprar la moto y así poder tener un vehículo propio que le permita seguir adelante  y facilitarle su modo de viajar.

Don Freddy forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo pero  don Freddy destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito se puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Freddy Ramon Garcia T. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the hamlet of Cano Negro situated in the canton of Los Chiles in Alajuela province. The hamlet is located in mountainous terrain and is very close to the northern border of Costa Rica. The area’s principal economic activities are farming and agriculture of which staple grains, sugar cane, and oranges constitute the main crops. Eight months ago, Freddy secured a job at a pineapple plantation. However, the plantation is located at some considerable distance from his home and Freddy finds it difficult to get to work due to the poor state of local roads and public transportation. Due to the time spent travelling to and from work, Freddy has been unable to tend to the allotment he owns. Therefore, Freddy has decided to buy a moped to solve his transportation problems and to save on money and time. He is asking for a loan of ¢654 (six hundred and fifty four Costa Rican Colons) to buy the moped and, thus, equip him with his own form of transport. Freddy forms part of the Community Lending facility Emcrecoba, one of 100 affiliated organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and Freddy expresses thanks for the opportunity to focus on productive activities that such organisations and loan facilitators provide him.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moped

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, en León, el señor Francisco N. R. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a la actividad de la ganadería donde a diario dedica gran parte del tiempo a la crianza de ganado tales como vaquillas que posteriormente le saca el máximo provecho en la extracción de leche para su respectiva comercialización.

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de una vaquilla para aumentar su hato ganadero y de esta manera proceder a su crianza y en un futuro muy corto obtener el ingreso para el mantenimiento de su familia que tanto depende de él.
texts.en:
In Nagarote municipality, in León, Señor Francisco N. R. engages energetically in rearing livestock, spending a large part of each day tending his heifers that previously have provided him great benefit through milk production for commercialization. He is requesting a loan to invest directly in the purchase of a heifer to enlarge his herd, so he will soon be able to provide the income to maintain his family that is so dependent on him.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda S. is a proud members of ASHI in Caniogan center of Rizal Central Branch (RCB). During her membership in ASHI, her performance has been notably good in repayment and in attendance in center meetings. Erlinda joined ASHI to secure additional working capital for her sewing business. The business is still growing and therefore she is requesting a loan of 35,000 pesos to pay for an assortment of cotton and fabrics. Erlinda requests this loan through ASHI so that she can support the growth of her business and be able to meet the growing demands of her customers. Without capital Erlinda’s business will not grow and she will not be able to give satisfactory service to her customers. Through the support of ASHI and Kiva, she hopes to see herself and her family someday improve their standard of living and move away from the ties of poverty. Erlinda is married to Marlon and is blessed with five children. Despite many challenges in her life, she never gave up fighting against poverty. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To pay for an assortment of cotton and fabrics

loans.name: Hector Otoniel

texts.es: Héctor es de 65 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos todos ya están separados de él, tiene establecido una tienda de consumo en la plaza del mercado local, junto con su esposa han salido adelante, los dos atienden el negocio, es el cuarto crédito que solicita en ASDIR, los anteriores los ha pagado sin problema demostrando su responsabilidad, necesitan el financiamiento para ampliar su tienda comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Héctor, 65, has five children who live independently. He has a grocery store located in the local market. He and his wife have gotten ahead in life together. Both tend to the business. This is his 4th loan with ASDIR; he repaid the previous ones in a timely fashion. They need this funding to buy more stock merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a 36-year-old man living in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with two children, aged 12 and 6 years. His wife is currently a student, meaning the welfare of the family is Geofrey's responsibility. He dreams of seeing his wife through her education. He is employed as a cashier for a giant hardware shop in Hoima, Uganda. He has obtaining credit from HOFOKAM and this is his third loan through which he has been able to finish his residential house and also buy a motorcycle for his business. He intends to use the loan funds to finish construction of his residential house with a water tank

loans.use: finishing construction of his residential house with a water tank system.

loans.name: Pelelina

texts.en:
Pelelina S. is 35 and married with 7 children (ages 1 - 25).  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Pelelina has 1 year of experience in this business.  Pelelina needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Pelelina joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Pelelina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. Janet also takes care of her mother.  She sells charcoal in Bwaise and sells to all categories of people. She buys this charcoal from delivery trucks. She wants to use this loan of 400,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal. Janet sells at retail and wholesale. Janet works six days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and thieves. She joined MCDT because she wanted to generate capital. She aspires to go directly to the villages to buy charcoal. Janet resides in and rents a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, market dues, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Galiya

texts.en:
Galiya L. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her 7-year-old daughter currently attends a local primary school, and her husband works for the Water Piping Facility Board.

Galiya operates a vegetable business in the city. She has been engaging in this trade for sixteen years and has gained significant experience. She purchases her vegetables from wholesale traders and sells them from a rented stall as a retailer.

Galiya has been planning to expand her business in order to improve her family's quality of life. She is a hardworking and very energetic person. She says, “My dream is to finish my own house and live in it with my family.” She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables for her business and will use the remaining part to complete construction of her home.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell and to complete construction of her home

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.es: Bernalda, de 53 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive con su hermana y su familia en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a la venta de comida en su carro salchipapero (especial para frituras), y con él  sale a trabajar en una zona cercana a su casa. Las ventas son buenas, gracias a lo sabroso de sus platillos, que son la delicia de sus comensales, ella ofrece comida rápida como salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas), alitas de pollo frito, entre otros. Ha ganado varios clientes, no solo por la exquisitez de sus platillos, si no también, por su gran carisma y sencillez. Por las mañanas también trabaja al lado de su hermana en la venta de condimentos, lo cual le da algunos ingresos extras a su economía, además le gusta mucho laborar durante todo el día. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando, pues desea instalar un local propio donde pueda  ofrecer sus platillos con mayor comodidad.Es el  segundo préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y promete que será muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas, porque desea seguir adelante. Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de  ingredientes que necesita para continuar con la preparación de sus ricos platillos.
texts.en:
Bernalda, 53, is a very enterprising woman who lives with her sister and her family in her own home. She sells food from a "salchipapera" cart (especially fried foods), and with it she goes out to work in an area close to her home. Her sales are good, thanks to her tasty dishes, which are the delight of her guests. She offers fast food such as salchipapas (sausages and fried potatoes), fried chicken wings, and others. She has attracted various customers, not only because of the exquisite dishes, but also because of her charm and unassuming nature. In the mornings she works alongside her sister selling condiments, which gives her additional income. She prefers to work all day. In the future she wants to continue to work; she wants to set up a place of her own where she can offer her dishes in greater comfort. This is her 2nd loan with MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments, because she wants to get ahead. She is planning on investing the money requested in the bulk purchase of the ingredients she needs to continue making her delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Irma Deisy

texts.es:
La sra. Irma Deisy M. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene su pulperia en su casa de habitacion, este negocio es visitado por muchas personas ya que tiene variedad y buenos precios en los productos que vende.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar mercaderia como ser arroz, frijoles, quesos, confites, refrescos, churros, aceite, margarina, manteca etc.
tendra mas venta y asi tendra ingresos para satisfacer sus necesidades y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma Deisy M. is an enterprising woman who sells popular consumer products from a store inside of her home. Her business is frequented by many people since it offers a variety of products and good prices.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, cheese, candy, soft drinks, donuts, oil, margarine, lard, and other items. Irma would like to generate more sales so that she can have income to meet her needs and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Hanifan's Group

texts.en: Hanifan A. lives in the  city of Lahore in Pakistan  which is  famous city for its history and culture. She has four daughters who all are getting their education and two sons who have  their own businesses. Her husband makes shoe soles and she also assists him in his work. By seeing his good work the factory owners have given him the opportunity to work for them and complete their orders. But Hanifan and her husband are unable to avail themselves of this opportunity because they have too little stock to fulfill large orders in time. Therefore, Hanifan has applied for a loan from Asasah so they can buy  raw materials such as leather and nails in bulk and and thus be able to fulfill orders immediately. Hanifan and her husband hope that by completing orders in time the factory owners will give them more business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making shoe soles

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna C. is from the village of Bobontugen, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Lorna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies like sweetened rice or rice cakes in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Afissa

texts.en:
Afissa is 55 years old and she is a widow.  Afissa makes a living by selling different kinds of fruit and this is her 10th successful year in this business.  Her business hours are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

 After realizing that she is not satisfying the demand of her customers,  Afissa thinks she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will expand her business through purchasing more fruit for sale.  If successful, Afissa will start saving and keep investing in her business for a better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: a large quantity of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Juliana; tiene 52 años de edad y es conviviente, ella tiene 4 hijos  trabaja comprando y vendiendo ropa casa por casa o lleva a empresas y ofrece mercadería, la deja en dos partes, La socia ya conoce con quienes trabajar y cuando trae ropa de la ciudad de Lima, ella lleva a sus clientes a ofrecer. La socia necesita el dinero como capital de trabajo, ella comprara ropa al por mayor para ofrecer en Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the community bank "Las Perlas" (The Pearls), which is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. Bank member Juliana is 52 years old and lives with her partner. She has 4 children. She works buying and selling clothing house to house, or she takes it to businesses and offers them merchandise. She leaves it in two places. She already knows with whom to work, and when she brings clothing from the city of Lima, she offers it to her customers. She needs money for working capital. She will buy clothing at wholesale to offer it for sale in Cusco. She is applying for the loan to invest in her business. She is grateful for the loan offered through this means, and at the same time she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una señora de edad muy avanzada, pero con mucha ganas de trabajar, se ha esforzado para salir adelante con su familia ya que son de pocos recursos económicos. 
Hoy en día se dedica a la venta de leña, maíz, frijoles, el cual ella misma esta cultivando en unas manzanas de tierra. Un hijo está con ella y su  esposo que trabaja como cadete de taxi. Lo que ambos se apoyan para lograr mejores ganancias
Para ella ha sido difícil ya que ha trabajado muy duro en acarreo de sus ventas. Atreves de los prestamos ha logrado las mejoras en su pequeña casa, son catorce créditos que Afodenic ha dado por su buen comportamiento de pago el cual ha logrado pagar en tiempo y forma ya que se ha beneficiado para lograr su objetivo.
Con este financiamiento comprara leña, maíz y abonos y venenos ya que cultivara maíz para seguir aumentando sus ventas y lograr mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana is an older woman but has a lot of desire to work. She has put in a lot of effort to get her family ahead since they have few economic resources.

Now she works selling firewood, corn, and beans, which she grows herself on a few ‘manzanas’ of land (1 manzana is equal to approximately 7000 square meters in Nicaragua). One son is with her and her husband works as a taxi driver. They both support one another to better their income.

It has been difficult for Juana since she has worked very hard in carrying her goods. Through the loans, she has been able to make improvements to her small home. AFODENIC has provided her with 14 loans to help achieve her goal due to her satisfactory loan repayment which she achieved by paying on time.

With this loan she will purchase firewood, corn, manure and insecticide to grow corn and continue increasing her sales and improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, fertilizer, insecticide and firewood for growing corn

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel S. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Isabel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Isabel raises pigs for fattening and sale. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) whenever she sells one of her raised pigs. In 2009, Isabel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Isabel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Letty Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Letty nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que ella es socio fundadora del Banco Comunal y que además esta muy contenta ya que ha crecido y por la ayuda que les ha brindado la institución a todas las socias. Tiene 41 años de edad y está casada hace 25 años de la cual ha tenido dos hijos de 25 y 17 años, él menor vive con ellos y estudia en colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella tiene un comedor en el sector donde ella vive, trabaja de viernes a domingo desde las 8 am hasta las 15h00, prepara el delicioso encebollado de pescado que es un plato muy solicitado por los habitantes del sector y de la provincia, su hijo le ayuda cuando tiene tiempo libre.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos, además de dos mesas y 8 sillas que le hacen falta ya que a veces los clientes se van por no tener donde sentarse. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y que su hijo sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales community bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales which is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  The inhabitants of this town carry out a number of different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

Letty tells us with a lot of pride that she is one of the founding members of the community bank and that she is very happy because it has helped her to grow her business and because the bank has helped all its members.  She is 41 years old and has been married for 25 years.  She has two children aged 25 and 17.  The youngest lives with her and is in school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Letty has a small restaurant in the neighborhood where she lives.  She works Friday through Sunday from 8.00am to 3.00pm.  She prepares fish and onion stew which is the most popular dish amongst the locals in her neighborhood and region.  Her son helps her when he has any spare time.

This loan will be used to buy products for preparing her food, as well as two tables and eight chairs which she needs because sometimes her customers don't have anywhere to sit.  Her dreams are to have a big restaurant and for her child to be a professional.

loans.use: To buy (food) supplies, two tables and eight chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pineapple suckers or slips for planting.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura is a 49-year-old mother of four who lives with her family in Siquirres, Limón, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Rosaura describes her as a hard working, busy entrepreneur who fills her time with a variety of activities. 

An experienced businesswoman, this will be Rosaura´s 6th loan with Fundación Mujer. Rosaura has been successful in combining her business instincts and diligent work ethic in order to take advantage of past loans and make improvements to her business.

Rosaura runs a sewing business, where she produces various types of clothing for men, women and children such as bags, pajamas,socks and shirts. She is applying for the current loan as a method to increase her working capital in order to satisfy the demands of her clients. With this loan, Rosaura plans to invest in a new sewing machine, fabric, threads, needles, and other sewing materials. 

On a typical day, Rosaura wakes up early and takes care of household chores. After cooking and cleaning, she dedicates her time to the activities of her business: making sales, sewing clothes, collecting on repayments, making purchases, etc.  At the moment, Rosaura runs her business from her home. In the future, her goal is to open a central location in order to offer her sewing products to clients.

loans.use: For the purchase of a sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Janephar

texts.en:
Janephar K. is 35 years old. She is married to Evans and is a mother of four school-aged children. She is a farmer and has her own piece of land, which she has been working for the past six years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She is planning to buy fertilizer and chemicals for maize planting. Maize has been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Janephar’s dream is to practice large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for maize planting

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a forty-three-year-old married female with seven children. She owns a semi-permanent house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in produce for the last twenty years amidst the hardship of the high cost of produce. Her vision is to expand the business and educate her children. Grace needs the loan to buy beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: Buying beans and groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Eunice Ene

texts.en:
Eunice is 23 years old and married to Manbui Mereu. They have three children. For the past three years, Eunice has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town. 

Eunice was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy 15 young goats which she will rear and later sell at a profit. In the future, Eunice hopes to practice dairy farming to diversify and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Nang

texts.en: Nang C., 28, is married and resides with her two children in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for rice products. C. is a farmer and a tailor, earning an income of USD $4.26 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD $2.93 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD $50 on food and USD $25 on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD $1200 to purchase fertilizer and chickens to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and chickens to raise for sale

loans.name: Jesus Nolberto

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 31 años de edad. Es soltero y  reside en el caserío Santa Clara ubicado en el distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque..

Se dedica desde hace mas de 3 años a la compra y venta de animales. El los cría a campo abierto, en un terreno que posee, cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y eventualmente a los vecinos y pobladores del distrito. Con los ingresos que el obtiene de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

El desea comprar animales para engorde y alimentarlos con productos balanceados y  poder asi mejorar el desarrollo de sus animales y venderlos a mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Jesús es una persona trabajadora, activa y bastante responsable adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran alguien tranquilo y confiable.
texts.en: Jesús is 31 years old, single and lives in the village of Santa Clara in the district of Pítipo, an agricultural area located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has made a living for more than three years buying and selling animals. He raises them in an open field on land he owns, and when they reach a good level of development he offers them to business people in the region and eventually to his neighbors and others who live in the district. He uses the money he makes from this activity to make headway for his family. Jesús wishes to purchase animals to fatten and also buy balanced feed to improve the animals' development so they fetch a better price. For this, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. Jesús is a hard-working, active and rather responsible person who also works in agriculture. People who know him consider him to be calm and trustworthy.

loans.use: Purchase animals to fatten

loans.name: Shamim Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhter is a housewife who stays at home and tends to her household responsibilities. She is a very hard working lady and tries her best to give comfort to her family. 
 
She lives with her family in Mian Channu, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. Her house contains two rooms and she has been living in it for 20 years. 

Her husband has a donkey cart in which he delivers goods from one place to another. He started this business 20 years ago.   

Shamim has two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son operates his own donkey cart, the younger one is studying, while her daughter stays at home.
 
Shamim is a member of this group that has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. She wishes to use her portion of the loan to improve her husband’s loading business. Now he needs a new donkey cart because his current cart has become rough and rotten and urgently needs replacement.
 
She is hopeful that this investment will be good one for her family and earn her husband better profits.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Norway Group

texts.en:
Bahati M., who is in her early forties, is married with one son. She has had a business selling food for one year. She works from 5am to 2pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Bahati's first loan from Tujienge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to increase her food stocks. Her dream is to build a good house.  

Bahati will share this loan with her loan group, Norway, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Bahati is in yellow, first from the left.

loans.use: To increase food stocks to expand a business.

loans.name: Burema Women's Group-Kihihi

texts.en:
32-year-old B. Ellias is affiliated with Burema Women's group-Kihihi. He has been doing tailoring for the past two years in Kihihi Town. Ellias who is happily married with two kids says he got apprentice training on how to sew clothes from a tailoring school in Mbarara which is a neighboring town. He says the skills he learnt had to be put into practice and at length he established his own tailoring business. 

Before all this, Ellias was tending to his farming gardens from which he harvested crops that he used to resell later. He still maintains his farming source of livelihood, saying he is able to supplement with profits from his tailoring business the little he gets from selling his crops. Weekly this business generates shillings 80,000. He says with this loan, he is going to purchase textiles for making clothing. He says he will be able to make more clothes to resell once he buys the textiles.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to make clothing.

loans.name: Haguruka Ukore Group

texts.fr: Fréderic N. est commerçant, agriculteur de mais, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Il a 29 ans, il est marie, ne au Rwanda, et il a 2 enfants entre 1 an et 3 ans.  Il a fini 4 ans d’école primaire, et ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 kgs de mais, payer la main d’œuvre et autres dépenses pour son agriculture.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer les quantités à cultiver.  Il voudrait devenir un grand agriculteur dans le secteur de Rubavu, et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
