Fréderic N. is a merchant, and he grows corn. He has been a client of ACB since 2008. Born in Rwanda, he is 29 years old and married, and he has two children, who are 1 and 3 years old. Fréderic finished four years of primary schooling, and this loan is his first cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 15 kg of corn and to pay for labor and other farm expenses. 

His strategy for business growth is to improve his yields. He would like to become a major grower in the Rubavu area and to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 15 kg of corn and to pay for labor

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es: Miryan de 23 años de edad, es una mujer soltera activa y trabajadora, vive en su propia vivienda y da de si misma por sobresalir en la vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Miryan, es el cultivo de las plantas de café y cacao; tierras que heredó de sus padres, ella labra sus tierras con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo en su ardua labor de desmonte de malezas, cosechas y traslado de los productos cosechados hasta las carreteras para luego expenderlos en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir con las plagas que se apoderan de los brotes de sus cultivos. Ana con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de cacao y café, pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. Se siente muy contenta por ser socia de su banco comunal y aportará de si misma por el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
23-year old Miryan is single, energetic, and hardworking. She lives in her own house and makes an effort to get ahead in life. She earns her living growing coffee and cocoa on land that she inherited from her parents. 

Miryan works in her fields with labourers who help with the weeding, harvesting, and transportation of the produce to the highway from where it is taken to market. She likes the freedom of this job as it is she who decides what is best for her crops. It’s a job she’s been doing for five years. The most difficult part is dealing with the insects which infect the new shoots.

With the loan money Miryan plans to buy cocoa and coffee seeds, but her first priority is to buy more land so she can grow more crops. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that she must be punctual with the repayments if she wishes to get another loan in the future. She is very happy to be a member of her community bank and will contribute to its development. With the 1,000 soles Miryan will buy cocoa and coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and coffee seeds

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school and Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store like shampoo, groceries, etc. Susan has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar and other miscellaneous goods. 

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 48 years old and married with six children. He does quarrying so as to earn a living. He has employed five people in his business. He has sustained his business for twenty years because of his hard work and determination. He hopes that through Faulu Kenya, he will grow his business. He has requested 15,000 Kes to buy tools for quarrying.

loans.use: To buy tools for quarrying

loans.name: Jain

texts.en: Jain sells millet. She is 30 years old, married, with seven children and all of them go to school. Jain has requested a loan to stock more millet to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with her extra profits.

loans.use: Stock more millet to sell.

loans.name: Edwin Raul

texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán, which is located on the border of Ecuador and Colombia. He lives with his mother and his two children, a daughter who is five and a son, seven. Edwin is a responsible father who cares about his family's well-being.

Edwin has a small crop of potatoes near his house. He is seeking his first loan to buy fertilizer so he can improve his crops’ yield. He began growing potatoes because his father was a farmer, and from a young age Edwin learned to work in the same way. He has knowledge of the countryside and how to grow crops because he learned from his father.

Edwin wants this loan to educate his two children so that their future lives will be bright. He wants them to "be professionals and serve society."

In the photo, Edwin is in his fields with his animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his potato crops.

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is a 37-year-old married man and the father of two daughters from Bani Kenanah, a community in the city of Irbid, Jordan.

Mohannad has a small shop where he sells new and used clothing for men, women and children of all ages. Mohannad also sells school supplies including pens, pencils, paper and backpacks along with caps, scarves and different styles of shoes and work boots. 

Mohannad was the youngest son of a large, poor family; hence,  Mohannad grew up knowing the value of "second-hand" clothing, given that what his brothers wore would become his own as he graduated into their sizes. Mohannad also learned the importance of education and hard work; he dropped out of school after the sixth grade to start working and contribute to the family income.

Mohannad has developed his business for the past three years; now, he is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to expand his retail capacity by purchasing some display racks and more clothing. 

Mohannad is looking to a brighter future for his two daughters, his wife and himself. Someday, he would like to open a second shop; but, for now, Mohannad is trying to increase his income by offering his customers a larger selection. As his daughters grow into young women, Mohannad is saving to give them higher education and more choices than he had as a young boy raised in poverty.

loans.use: to purchase some display racks and more clothing.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Raquel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Dora y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 49 años edad, soy viuda, tengo tres hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es ser cocinera”. 

Dora es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora a pesar de las adversidades saca adelante a sus hijos, ella trabaja en la casa de un pariente cocinando. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para pagar la movilidad de su casa al lugar donde trabaja, ella gasta S/. 4,00 nuevos soles diarios. El sueño de la socia es abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital of La Convención province and an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  The main business activities here are coca, coffee, cacao and fruit production.

In the town of Quillabamba, we visit the "Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan" community bank and meet Dora who tells us:

"I was born in the town of Quillabamba.  I am 49 years old and a widow.  I have three children and live in the town where I was born.  My main business activity is working as a cook".

Dora is a tenacious and entrepreneurial woman who, in spite of life's adversities, is managing to get her children ahead in life.  She works in a relative's home cooking.  She has been in this business for one year and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, she needs a loan for personal use.  She will pay the transportation costs between her home and the place where she works.  She spends 4 Peruvian soles a day on this.  Dora's dream is to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to pay her transportation costs between home and work

loans.name: Benkadi D Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres qui constituent le  groupe BENKADI D sont  des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont  le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, DIARATOU, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Benkadi D group are all married, and, on average, 35 years old with 4 children.  Most of them live in plural families in the city of Banco, the seat of the Dioïla rural commune, in Mali’s 2nd administrative region, Koulikoro.

They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in hopes of better organizing their business at the start of the rainy season.  The crops they work with are rice and peanuts.  This is the group’s first time working with this MFI.

Diaratou, the second person from the left in the row of standing women, plans to use this loan to purchase farm inputs and small equipment, and pay costs of labor involved to maintain about a quarter hectare (0.6 acres) of peanuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold from a stall in the Banco market, and also at N’Golobougou, to customers including both men and women.  The group plans on making an average profit of about 25,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to purchase labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Ernesto Antonio

texts.es: Ernesto Antonio de 43 años de edad, habita en su casa con su esposa y tres hijas las cuales por el momento se encuentran estudiando. Ernesto es un hombre trabajador el cual no se cansa de luchar día con día por el bienestar de su familia. Su principal inspiración son sus hijas las cuales lo motivan a trabajar duramente para darles una calidad de vida diferente. El se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos en el tiangue (plaza de compra y venta de animales) de su localidad.  El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su hogar de habitación y es uno de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Es una persona muy reconocida en la zona ya que gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Además, cuando de cerdos se trata él es que tiene los mejores tanto en calidad como en precios. Ernesto solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio ya que se ha visto en la necesidad de hacer  algunos arreglos en los corrales en donde mantiene a los cerdos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más cerdos y materiales para el mejoramiento del corral. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que logrará tener buenos resultados a partir de esta decisión y podrá alcanzar el sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ernesto Antonio, age 43, lives in a house with his wife and three daughters.  His daughters are currently in school.  Ernesto is a hard-working man who does not tire from struggling every day for his family’s well-being.  His daughters are his primary motivation; they motivate him to work hard in order to give them a different quality of life.

He raises and sells pigs in El Tiangue (plaza for buying and selling animals), which is in his area.  He has his business at home.  It is one of his main sources of income.  He is a well-known person in the zone because, thanks to his charisma, he has managed to earn his customers’ trust.  Also, when it comes to pigs he is the one who has the best quality and the best prices.

Ernesto requests this loan from Integral to invest in his business.  He has seen the need to make some repairs to the pens where he keeps the pigs.  He will use the loan to buy more pigs and materials for improving the pen.  He trusts in God and that he will achieve good results in his business by making this decision.  He also expects to be able to fulfill his dream of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and construction materials.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a very active lady who performs her household duties at home. Besides her household work, she also operates a milk sales business with her husband. She has some cows and buffaloes. She takes care of them by providing timely food and water and keeping their shelter clean. Her husband sells the milk to community customers for a profit. Azra's husband also runs a grocery store where he sells daily use items such as sugar, spices, rice etc. 
Azra has six children. One of them is studying while the others do different kinds of work to contribute to the family financially. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s milk sales business. He will use the loan to buy another buffalo, which will help him produce more milk for selling therefore increasing his profits. Azra is very confident that an investment will help her husband make larger profits.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her husband's milk sales business.

loans.name: Maria Sarbelia

texts.es:
Sarbelia, administra un cafetín donD. venD. pupusas y bebidas, vive con su esposo y su hijo, el negocio tiene más D. 21 años D. existir y lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana por las tardes, el negocio lo heredo D. su madre.
Solicita un préstamo la compra D. bebidas como sodas, jugos, chicharrón, quesillo, pollo, condimentos, este préstamo le ayuda a incrementar el negocio disponiendo D. productos y atender a más clientes para garantizar los ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Ella quiere hacer mejoras a la vivienda a través del negocio, por eso busca apoyo en préstamo para alcanzar sus objetivos mediante el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Sarbelia lives with her husband and son, and manages a small cafe where she sells pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) and drinks. The cafe has existed for over 21 years and she serves there every day of the week, in the evening. Maria Sarbelia inherited the business from her mother. 

Maria Sarbelia applied for this loan in order to purchase drinks such as sodas and juices, as well as pork, cheese, chicken, and condiments. The loan will help increase business, providing her with produce and allowing her to serve more customers, thus guaranteeing an income to support her family. 

With the income earned from running her cafe, Maria Sarbelia wants to make improvements to her home. Therefore she is seeking the support of a loan to achieve her goals through the growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase drinks such as sodas and juices, as well as pork, cheese, chicken, and condiments

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 49-years-old, married and has three school-age children. His goal is to improve his hog-raising business to support his family and continue sending his children to school. He has been in this business for almost 28 years earning profits of P10,000 a month that he uses for their basic necessities and to finance the education of their children. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, he has the strong determination to uplift their status of living and to give his children a better life. 

His goal is to raise more pigs to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of P35,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He believes that this loan will contribute a lot to make the business grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for a hog-raising business.

loans.name: Jose Esgard

texts.es:
José de 21 años, es  soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

José se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como ovejas y cerdos, desde hace un año, cuenta con sus corrales amplios para sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos  naturales para engordarlos y pueda venderlos a sus clientes a un buen precio, obteniendo ingresos para solventar sus obligaciones personales.  

La actividad que ejerce José cada día crece más por lo que ha creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado y sanidad de  su ganado, al tenerlos bien alimentados a sus animales tendrá mayores ventas y con los ingresos podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado, mejorando su calidad de vida y brindarle mejores comodidades a sus padres.
texts.en:
Jose is 21, single, and lives at home with his parents. They only have electricity utilities, located in the Tambogrande district that belongs to the Piura department. This area is characterized by its agricultural activity, livestock farming, and artisans. Jose raises and sells farm animals such as sheep and pigs. 

Since a year ago, he has big enough corrals for his animals. He feeds them with balanced food and allows them to graze. This fattens them up so he can sell them to his clients at a good price, generating income to pay off his personal debts.

 The activity that Jose does daily grows more, so that he believes it necessary to request a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,000 Nuevos Soles to purchase more balanced food and invest in the health of his animals. Having them well nourished means better sales. With the income, he will be able to repay the loan, improve his quality of life, and provide better comforts to his parents.

loans.use: To purchase balanced food and invest in the health of his livestock.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Arlene has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой машины. Он хочет продать свою машину и купить новую.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He's twenty-five years old, married and has worked as a taxi driver for the last eight years. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase a new car. He wishes to sell his old car and buy a new one.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Blanca Daisy

texts.es:
Blanca Daisy, tiene 47 años de edad, 25 años de casada, tienen 4 hijos de 17, 20, 22 y 24 años de edad, vive en la aldea Tulian Rio de Omoa Cortes.
Doña Blanca, una señora muy emprendedora, tiene un taller de ebanistería, donde elaboran muebles de madera como ser de  comedor, cocina, libreros, roperos etc. todo lo que le pidan sus clientes. Su esposo es ebanista y es quien hace los muebles y trabaja todos los días. Anteriormente era taller familiar y hace 6 años que es propio. Trabajan en base a pedidos y venta de contado.
Para generar otros ingresos ella elabora y vende pan todos los días. 
Con ODEF a recibido ocho prestamos para invertir en madera e insumos para los muebles y deja una parte para los insumos que ocupa para hacer pan.
De esta manera ha mejorado su calidad de vida en la familia y a mantenido su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Daisy is 47 years old and has been married for 25 years. She has four children (ages 17, 20, 22, and 24). They live in the neighborhood of Tulian Rio in Omoa Cortes.

Doña Blanca is a very enterprising woman who manages a woodworking shop where she and her husband produce furniture such as dining sets, cooktops, bookcases, wardrobes, and other pieces. Everything they make is based on orders from their customers. Her husband is a woodworker and works every day to produce the furniture. This business previously belonged to a relative and they took over six years ago. Their work is driven by orders and their products are sold for cash. To generate extra income, Blanca makes and sells bread every day.

Blanca has received eight loans to invest in the purchase of wood and supplies for making furniture. Part of the money was used to buy supplies for making bread. Working in this manner has improved the quality of life of her family and has helped to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy wood and other supplies for making furniture.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora Guadalupe es divorciada siempre se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de ropa. Es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, necesita invertir para aprovechar las ventas en época de navidad y aumentar su clientela y ventas de su negocio.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su negocio es por eso que solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is divorced and has always been in the clothes selling business.  She is a very responsible and enterprising woman and wants to invest in order to take advantage of the Christmas season, increase her business’ customer base and sales.

This business is her source of income and she is asking for this loan in order to make the investment and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new stock of clothes.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: El señor Rosalio de 38 años es casado y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida; por tal motivo decidió poner un negocio familiar en el que pudieran tenerlo en su propia vivienda y que su esposa lo atendiera para que esté al tanto de las necesidades de cada uno. Rosalio es un hombre muy trabajador aunque por las tardes ayuda en el negocio también cuenta con un taxi en el que traslada de un lugar a otro a sus clientes. En este momento su mayor prioridad es comprar mercancía para el negocio como lo es refrescos, botanas, comida de lata, lácteos, tortillas y mas, ya que en esta temporada de Navidad sus ventas se incrementan por lo que necesita tener el negocio abastecido para que pueda tener un ingreso más alto. De esta manera el podrá comprar los regalos a sus pequeños y algunas cosas necesarias para el hogar.
texts.en:
Rosalío, 38, is married and has three children that he wants to provide a better quality of life for.  Because of this he decided to open a family business that he could have at home so that his wife could tend to it while watching over their needs. Rosalío is a very hardworking man who helps with the business in the evenings because he also has a taxi that he uses to transport customers from place to place.  

At present, his greatest priority is to buy merchandise for the store like soft-drinks, snacks, canned food, dairy products, tortillas and more because during the Christmas season sales increase and he needs to have the store well-stocked so that he can earn higher income and be able to buy gifts for his little ones and a few things that are needed in the home.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, groceries in general, dairy products and others.

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en: Angelyn is 27 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with a 4-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. Angelyn has been selling dried fish for the past twenty years.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother, and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is the profit. She is requesting this loan to purchase more dried cassava fish for her business. In future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dried cassava fish for her business.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
From the town of Takhmao, Mrs. So, age 55, a single mother, keeps very busy with her farming work from day to day. She grows both rainy-season rice and dry-season rice. Also, she grows vegetables for quick sale. She typically earns approximately $5.00 per day to support her family. She has been blessed with nine children: five of them are single and four of them are already married.

Mrs. So is looking for a loan from HKL to pay for the process of rice farming. She’ll buy things such as rice seeds, mineral fertilizers and pesticide to keep her crops growing well. In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business gradually. In addition, she will support her children until they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy things such as rice seeds, mineral fertilizers and pesticide to keep her crops growing well.

loans.name: Natalia Marcela

texts.es:
Emprendedora es la mejor palabra para describir a Natalia Marcela, una joven que a sus 22 años de edad ya quiere recibir el trabajo de la elaboración y venta de obleas que es de tradición familiar. Los padres de Natalia Marcela no obtienen grandes ingresos, por lo que Natalia Marcela ha visto grandes dificultades para poder cumplir el sueño de estudiar una carrera de educación universitaria, y es por esto que Natalia Marcela desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando como pulidora de algunas confecciones, sin embargo el pago es muy bajo y no le alcanza para cubrir sus gastos personales y ahorrar para sus estudios. Con el ánimo de colaborar con los gastos del hogar a sus padres, de pagarse sus propios gastos y de ahorrar para poder estudiar en un futuro, Natalia Marcela quiere que el negocio de la elaboración y venta de obleas se expanda y genere mayores ingresos, en gran parte porque el negocio es tan pequeño que no puede atender los pedidos de todos los clientes, es por esto que Natalia Marcela busca un préstamo que le permita comprar nuevas planchas para la elaboración de las obleas y la compra de insumos al por mayor que le permitan comprarlos a un menor precio.
Natalia Marcela manifiesta que con el incremento de la capacidad productiva del negocio sus ventas incrementarán y sus ingresos también lo harán, y de esta manera podrá mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus padres, y podrá cumplir su sueño de estudiar una carrera de educación universitaria que tanto ha anhelado.
texts.en:
“Entrepreneur” is the best word to describe Natalia Marcela, a 22-year-old woman.  She wants to go into the manufacture and sale of “obleas” [A variation of wafer, usually eaten as a dessert with two pieces filled with arequipe, dulce de leche (milk caramel) and/or sweetened condensed milk in the middle.  In some places they might contain cheese, fruits, Chantilly cream, among others. They are usually very popular as they are very inexpensive] since this is her family’s tradition.  

Natalia Marcela’s parents do not earn high income which is why Natalia Marcela has faced great difficulties in reaching her dream of studying a university career and this is why Natalia Marcela has been working for some time now polishing confections.  However, her salary is very low and does not suffice to cover her personal expenses or to save up for her studies.  

Wishing to contribute to her parents’ household expenses, to pay her own expenses and to save up for future studies, Natalia Marcela wants her oblea manufacturing and sales business to expand and generate higher income to a large extent because the business is so small that she’s unable to fill all her customer orders.  Because of this, Natalia Marcela seeks a loan that will allow her to buy new presses to make obleas and to buy ingredients at wholesale so that she can get them at better prices.

Natalia Marcela states that with an increase in production capacity of her business sales will increase and so will her income thus being able to improve her parents’ quality of life and be able to reach her dream of studying the university career she’s so much wished for.

loans.use: to buy a pastry press and ingredients in quantity.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya.  She is married and the mother of two children.  She owns a retail shop, which has been in operation for the last two years.  Naomi started the business because there are no shops around the area she lives in.

She learned about Milango from her friend and joined in order to gain access to credit.  She has repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.  Naomi is now applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to add stock to her retail business. 

Her business faces challenges including the high cost of products and fees paid to various government entities.  Despite these challenges, Naomi looks forward to establishing additional centers in the future.

loans.use: To add stock to her retail shop.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sabra is a 40-year-old widow, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has died, and now she is living in her own house with her two sons and a daughter. She is a medical nurse by profession; she has been doing this job in a hospital for the past fifteen years.

After the death of her husband, she began running a maternity center at her home. She is experienced and professional in her work. She has been dealing with many cases of pregnancy and has a very successful operation. She is a very famous nurse in her area, and the ladies have full confidence in her abilities.

Sabra wants to keep her stable reputation and wants to establish her maternity center. Therefore she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy an power loom and the latest medical instruments and equipment. Her daughter is getting a medical education from a medical institution, and she wants her daughter to do a medical course so that she can easily find a job in hospital.

Sabra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a power loom for herself.

loans.name: Niaina Haritiana

texts.fr:
Niaina Haritiana est une femme forte, active et travailleuse de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est tireur de poussepousse. Le couple a 2 enfants et  ils sont tous scolarisés. 
Elle est dans la vente de charbon depuis 2013. Avant cette activité, elle était dans la vente de produit de confection et maintenant, elle en est à son 6eme prêt. Elle s’occupe seule de son activité car son mari ne peut se consacrer qu’à son propre activité. Elle lutte fortement pour les besoins de sa famille. 
Les objectifs du couple est la réussite de ses progénitures et aussi de pouvoirs s’acquérir un terrain afin d’y construire une maison. Ainsi ils ne paieront plus de loyer comme aujourd’hui.

loans.use: acheter 70 sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
In the community of Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon, lives Miss Lorenza. It has been 10 years since she started her business selling tacos and snacks. She and her husband have never had a formal job. They have always been self-employed in the sales business. Her husband has a grocery store for a long time and they have been able to survive many important changes in their lives thanks to this business. They do not receive very much support from their children so they have had to struggle alone ever since they went out to get married. But with hard work and effort they have made it.

Now Miss Lorenza requires a loan of $925 to invest in ingredients and utensils that she uses to prepare her foods. This way she will be able to increase her sales. She plans to repay the full amount of this loan in a term of 6-12 months. You can contribute to their cause. You only need to decide. Don\'t doubt any longer. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la comunidad de Cadereyta, Nuevo León, vive Doña Lorenza, quien tiene más de 10 años de haber iniciado su negocio de venta de tacos y comidas. Ella y su esposo nunca han tenido un empleo formal, siempre han desempeñado trabajos por cuenta propia en lo que se refiere el comercio. Su esposo tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo y siempre han logrado sobrevivir ha varios cambios importantes que has tenido que vivir gracias a este negocio. Pues ellos no reciben mucho apoyo de sus hijos, por lo que han tenido que luchar solos desde que ellos se casaron y con trabajo y esfuerzo lo han logrado.

Ahora, Doña Lorenza, requiere de un préstamo de $925 DLLD, para poder invertir en insumos y utensilios con los que prepara los alimentos, de esta manera va a poder incrementar sus ventas. Ella planea regresar el monto total del crédito en un periodo de 6-12 meses. Tu puedes contribuir a esta causa, solo hace falta que te decidas, no lo dudes más, ella agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy more varieties of household goods to suit different customers

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Mrs. Chab S. N., 35 years old and a mother of 5 children, lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She  is a farmer growing vegetables and rice crops and raising fish in a small pond behind her house. She moderately makes around $2/day, while her husband is a carpenter and generally earns on average about $3/day in revenue. Two of her children are students and the rest are too young to attend school. Chab S. N. is asking for the loan to purchase more food for her fish and seeds for cultivation. In the future, she would like to increase her livestock by purchasing a number of fish to make additional income.

loans.use: To purchase food for her fish

loans.name: Alis

texts.en: Alis A. is 64, a widow with 6 children, from a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for 7 years as a leader of a union. Alis sells drinks and operates a guest house. She needs a loan of $525 to buy more drinks and to maintain her guest house.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Nasrallah

texts.en:
Nasrallah lives in District 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan, with his own family. He is single but he has the responsibility for his family. His father died during the war in Kabul so he is the only one to help his family.

Nasrallah has a small shop and he started this business one year ago. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, etc. He hopes to attract more customers and make a good income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy extra inventory like boxes of chocolate, bags of sweets

loans.name: Vefadar

texts.en:
Vefadar K. is a refugee from the Gubadli region, an area of Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict in the west part of Azerbaijan. He is 31 years old. He began his business with $300 in 2001, selling a small variety of shoes. With this small business and only $300 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs.

During the last three years Vefadar expanded his business very successfully. He opened his own shoe store in the central market. He now needs a loan of $600 to further develop his business by buying more kinds of shoes and opening a goods section. He hopes to increase his business and improve his family’s living condition with this additional income. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of shoes as well as other goods

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Born in Kpéssou in 1975, Mr. Kodjo H. is a young married father of two (2) children. Known throughout his village for his goodwill, he has in his care a total of ten (10) people. Driving a motorcycle taxi is his daily business. Currently, his motorcycle is in a very poor state. As a result, he hopes to buy a new one in order to conduct his business without problems. He is asking for a loan of $800 to realize this dream. His income will serve to better meet the needs of his family so as to encourage its growth.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Kpéssou en 1975, Monsieur H. Kodjo est un jeune homme marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Reconnu dans son village pour sa bonne volonté de faire, il compte à sa charge un total de dix (10) personnes. Le taxi moto est son activité quotidienne. Aujourd’hui, sa moto est dans un état très défaillant. Pour cela, il souhaite acheter une nouvelle afin de vaquer paisiblement à son travail. Il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour réaliser son rêve. Les recettes du travail lui serviront à mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille afin de parvenir à son épanouissement.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in cleaning products and plastics

loans.name: Ruhiyya

texts.en:
Ruhiyya is a mother of two children. She is 38 years old and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.

She resides in the Fizuli region where she settled in the village of Ahmadalilar. She has run this business for three years now. Currently, she needs a loan of $950 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia, an active and hard-working mother of three school-going children, lives in Yamasá, where she sells homemaD. fried chicken, spicy sausage pork, and fried vegetables. Lidia started her business three years ago, when she realized that her husband’s salary could not bear all the family’s expenses. Lidia has her stall set close to a public place, and passers-by visit the stall to enjoy her tasty goods.

The entrepreneur has requested a loan (the second one she’ll take from FSMA) to boost her business. She’ll buy new ‘cook’ utensils and raw materials to keep producing her food. Lidia hopes that her business’ growth will help her increase her revenue and better fend for her children.

loans.use: To acquire new cooking utensils and raw materials to expand her small food stand.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús A. does janitorial work and doesn't make much money. He barely earns enough to pay for basic living needs. For this reason he undertook another business venture in order to have money for any unforeseen necessary expenditures in the future. About three years ago, using money he had saved and a loan from a friend, he began to sell linens to work friends and family from a catalog. This business has been going well for him, as he treats his customers well and has low prices.

Jesús A. is asking for a loan of $300 to remodel the room where he displays his products. He will repay the loan in 3 months.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Jesús A. se desempeña como operador de limpieza, su salario es bajo, y apenas le alcanza para sus gastos más necesarios, por lo cual le surgió la inquietud de emprender alguna actividad para tener dinero extra para imprevistos. Hace aproximadamente 3 años, con algo de dinero que tenia ahorrado y con un pequeño préstamo de un familiar, empezó con la venta de blancos por catalogo a sus compañeros de trabajo y familiares. le ha ido muy bien con esta actividad ya que da un buen trato a sus clientes y buenos precios.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para remodelar el cuarto donde tiene la exhibición de sus productos.

loans.use: To remodel the home store

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.en:
Ndeye N. is 44 years old and married. She sells animal vaccines in her community and is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies.

She has been a member of the Sinthiang Coundara village bank for four years and has a strong history of repayment. This loan is for six months and will repaid in a single, bulk payment at the end of the term.

loans.use: To purchase animal vaccinations to sell in her community.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna C. is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of six children living in the district of Heremakono Nord de Bougouni in a monogamous family. She has total mastery of this business that she learned from her mother at a young age.

From three group loans (solidarity loans), she has gone onward to individual loans with two such loans. All previous loans have been correctly repaid.

She gets her supplies at the Bamako market and makes her sales at the Bougouni market. With this loan, she intends to buy 20 dozen pieces of children's clothing and 10 dozen bed sheets. She is a retail seller to customers composed of essentially women. The eve of holidays (Tabaski, Ramadan, etc....) is when she makes a lot of her sales. She expects to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she will pay the loan interest and help her husband cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Maimouna C. est femme mariée de 40ans, mère de 6 enfants et résidant dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de Bougouni dans une famille monogame. Elle a une maîtrise totale de cette activité qu’elle a apprise dès son jeune âge auprès de sa mère.

Après 3 prêts de groupe (prets solidaires) elle est passée en pret individuel avec deux prets. Tous les prêt précedents ont été correctement remboursés.

Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Bamako et effectue ses ventes au marché de Bougouni. Avec ce pret elle compte achéter 20 douzaines de vêtements pour enfants et dix douzaines de draps de lit. Elle vend en détail à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. La veille des fêtes (Tabaski, Ramadan etc...) constitue sa grande période de vente. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle payera les intérêts du prêt et aidera son mari à assurer les dépenses de la famille

loans.use: To buy children's clothing

loans.name: Sorie's Group

texts.en: This group has 4 members: Sorie C., Lamin C., Alimany S. and Lamin B.. They all work for the Military. Because military salaries are small, they all engage in trading or development activities such as buying corrugated iron or bags of cement to complete building projects. They are requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000.00 to expand their trading business and invest in new materials. This loan will be divided equally between the four men and will be repaid from their monthly salaries.

loans.use: To buy corrugated iron zincs

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 38 years old. She is a wife and mother of three children. Through her business, Charlotte has supported one of her children to finish senior high school, and the others are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells 'kenkey' as well as maize.

Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. Charlotte has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey at breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and also firewood.

Charlotte hopes to increase her savings to pay for her children's education. She belongs to the community group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Livestock, Making Food Products, And Trading Goods Group

texts.vi:
C. Thị Xuân năm nay 50 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0020. Vay 4.704.000 đồng.
Cô Xuân vay vốn về để kinh doanh của cửa hàng cô. Gia đình cô bán hàng tại nhà muốn thêm vốn bán ra nhiều loại hàng hoá. Cô có 3 người con, đứa lớn đã đi lấy chồng, còn hai đứa vẫn đang đi học. Hai vợ chồng bán hàng ở nhà và chăn nuôi thêm. Gia đình cô thu nhập khoảng 300.000đồng / ngày. 
Trong  nhóm bao gồm:
<li> Vũ Thị Tỷ: 53 tuổi. Ms 13.03.0024. Vay 4.256.000đồng. Cô Tỷ vay vốn về để đi chợ và làm nghề đan tre nứa.
<li> Tô Thị Hoa: 32 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0022. Vay: 4.256.000 đồng. Chị Hoa vay vốn về để làm nghề tráng bánh đa nem và chăn nuôi lợn gà.
<li> Trần Thị Ngà: 43 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0032. Vay 3.360.000 đồng. Cô Ngà vay vốn để đi chợ buôn bán mặy hàng tre nứa.
<li> Lê Thị Canh: 43 tuổi. Ms : 13.03.0021. Vay : 4.256.000 đồng. Cô Canh vay vốn để làm nghề tráng bánh đa nem và chăn nuôi.
<li> Đinh Thị Thêm: 35 tuổi. Ms : 13.03.0025. Vay 4.256.000 đồng. Chi Thêm vay vốn mục đích để đi chợ buôn bán mỳ và chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xuan Thi C., 50 years old, is borrowing 4,704,000 VND T. use as capital for her store. Her family runs a small store out of their home selling general goods, and they would like T. use the money T. expand the variety of goods they sell. She has three children, the oldest of which has married a husband, and the remaining two are still in school. She and her husband raise livestock in addition T. running their store. Her family's income is about 300,000 VND per day. The group also includes: Ty Thi V., 53 years old, borrowing 4,256,000 VND T. do business trading goods and also do bamboo weaving; Hoa Thi T., 32 years old, borrowing 4,256,000 VND T. make rice wrappers for eggrolls and raise livestock; Mrs. Nga Thi T., 43 years old, borrowing 3,360,000 VND T. do business trading bamboo goods; Mrs. Canh Thi L., 43 years old, borrowing 4,256,000 VND T. make eggroll wrappers and raise livestock; Mrs. Them Thi D., 35 years old, borrowing 4,256,000 VND T. do business selling noodles and raise livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for trading goods, raising livestock, and various food manufacturing activities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For purchase of equipment and expansion of stock

loans.name: Justa Pastora

texts.es:
Justa tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. 06 hijos, estudió el sexto grado D. primaria y vive en la Av. Revolución Nº 198, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno.

DesD. hace 05 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” D. Juli.  Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 compró 3 alpacas. A los 16 años D. edad  tuvo su esposo y su primer hijo. Sus padres no tenían medios económicos y por esa razón no pudo continuar la secundaria. A la edad D. 23 años inició el negocio D. compra y venta D. carne D. alpaca, el cual vendía en el mercado D. abastos D. Juli, también se dedica al engorD. D. ganado ovino. Actualmente continua con su negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  aumentará su capital para comprar una máquina cortadora D. carne a un costo D. S/. 2.400. 

Su mayor deseo es comprar una maquina congeladora para mejorar su negocio y así poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Justa is 46 years old, is married, the mother of 6 children, studied until the sixt thraD. of primary school and lives in Av. Revolución Nº 198, Juli district, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. For five years she has been a member of the Communal Bank “Niño San Salvador” of Juli. With the first loan of 300 soles (US $100) she bought 3 alpacas. When she was sixteen she had her husband and their first child. Her parents did not have the economic means and for that reason she could not continue to high school. At the age of 23 she started the business of buying and selling alpaca meat, which she sold in the supply market of Juli. She is also dedicated to fattening sheep. Currently she is continuing with her business. With this loan of 2000 solesn(US $650), which will be repaid in 4 months, will increase her capital to buy a machine for cutting meat at a cost of S /. 2400 (US $ 770). His greatest wish is to buy a freezer to improve her business and through this support her children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine for cutting meat

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham tiene 32 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus  tres hijos. Él es un humilde agricultor, actividad que inició cuando formó su familia. Desde entonces se dedica al cultivo de diversas frutas, pero dentro de todas, lo que más le agrada producir son las naranjas, ya que necesitan menos inversión y esfuerzo físico, ya que después de sembrar sólo se tiene que esperar la cosecha, claro que teniendo ciertos cuidados con la limpieza de tus terrenos. Es muy rentable ya que este producto es de fácil venta, por la gran demanda. Para ello hay que tener sumo cuidado y paciencia para sembrar las plantas de manera adecuada, en  tierras propicias y debidamente abonadas para su crecimiento. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y no tuvo problemas hasta el momento en  sus pagos. Abraham comprará abonos e insecticidas para sus terrenos de naranjales.
texts.en:
Abraham is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. He has been a humble farmer since he started a family. Since then, he has cultivated a diverse range of fruits. Above all, what he most wants to produce are oranges since they need less investment and physical labor. After planting, he only has to wait for the harvest, of course being careful with the maintenance of his land. It's a very profitable product since it easy to sell due to high demand. He has to take great care and patience to sow the plants in the appropriate way, on fertile land properly fertilized for the plants' growth. This is his second loan with MFP and, to date, he has had no problems with his payments. Abraham will buy fertilizer and insecticide for his orange grove.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Saayed

texts.en:
Saayed H. is married and responsible for providing for his family. He is active in agriculture and learned this business from his father. Now, his father is unable to work in agriculture and H. works hard at growing his crops. He has plenty of land for cultivation but he is unable to make use of it all.

H. wants to take out an individual loan of 30000(AF) with a term of 27 months to purchase more stock and seed to plant all the land and to get ready for next years cultivation. This is the season to prepare the land for next years harvest. He wants to improve the lives of his family.

With this loan he can further his business and help his family in the future. His father and all his family want to thank all those who help by making kiva loans possible.

loans.use: Purchase stock and seed for farming

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina N. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Faustina sells electrical items at Bantama, which she has done for a while now. Her husband works with a credit union.

Faustina uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Faustina will use the loan to purchase more electrical parts for her store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical parts for the store

loans.name: Sherbek

texts.en:
K. Sherbek is from the Shahrituz district, where he works in livestock and agriculture by raising cattle and planting vegetables. Later he reaps the benefits of this, thereby surviving with his family, which includes his wife and five children. It should be mentioned that this young man is a hard worker and has now redoubled his efforts because he wants to have better income to fulfill the needs of his family. Therefore, Sherbek has asked for the support of Kiva partner IMON International and a loan that will allow him to buy materials for planting his crops as well as to invest in purchasing and raising cattle in his area.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged its already weak economy. 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable--conditions that have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle and farming materials

loans.name: Fani Yamileth

texts.es: la Sra Fani G. compra y vende ropa para todo tipo de personas, asi mismo vende cosmeticos varios para dama, su producto lo distribuye en diferentes colonias cercanas a su casa de habitacion, con su negocio ella puede sostener a su hija, ella necesita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia ya que este dificil la situacion y necesita tener mas ganancias para poder sostener su hogar ya que en estos momentos esta pasando por una situacion bien dificil. ella cree que comprando mas mercaderia va a tener mayores ventas y asi poder darle aliementacion y educacion a su hija.
texts.en:
Fani G. buys and sells clothing for all types of people and also sells various women’s cosmetics. She sells her products in different neighbourhoods close to her home and this business allows her to support her daughter. She needs a loan so that she can purchase more merchandise. She is currently going through a very difficult situation, so she needs to earn more in order to support her household. She believes that by buying more merchandise, her sales will improve and she will be able to feed and educate her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's, women's and men's clothing

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en: Marthe is 37 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Banire Close, Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells foodstuffs, and she has been in business for 15 years. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Marthe says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Betha

texts.en:
Betha A., is a 40-year-old mother of six children. The oldest is 23 while the youngest is 7 months. She lives in Nymasaria in a three-room semi-house and pays about 1,200 KSH a month in rent. She is married, but says her husband does not work and is often absent.

Betha sells cereals like groundnuts (peanuts), beans, rice and finger-millet for around 250 KSH a kilo. She says she would like to charge less, but the transportation costs are high. Betha says that she must travel to different towns in different weeks depending on where the cereals are cheapest, so sometimes she purchases stock in Kissi while other times in Sondu.

Betha says her greatest challenges are helping her children as well as overcoming her illnesses so that she can work. She is asking for 10,000 KSH.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk for resale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is 52 years old and makes a living running a small store. She is married to Ernesto A., who is 61 years old. They live happily in Junction, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya near their three children, Ricky, 38 years old, Rey, 35 years old and Ernesto A. Jr., 30 years old.  All are married. The couple works hard to pay their bills and extend support to their grandchildren, who are already in school. 

Erlinda used to do her selling from a cart, but now sells in a market because that is much more profitable. She sells vegetables, fruits and ready-made snacks. Erlinda is applying for a loan so that she can expand her business by buying more items to sell. She has a strong faith, and is determined to improve her standard of living by making good use of this loan. She puts her approach to life this way: “Success is never ending, and failure is never final.”

loans.use: buy more products to sell

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим Баходуров - мужчина 55 лет , занимается торговлей продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров.Его точка продажи расположена на рынке города Худжанда.За товаром он ездит сам на оптовый рынок Истаравшана. Иброхим ездит за товаром два раза в месяц. Во время его отсутствия его замещает  сын, как раз на снимке он.Кредитуется Баходуров уже шестой год, займ использует на расширение товарооборота.Вначале его ассортимент был не очень разнообразный, но постепенно он благодаря кредитам смог расширить свой оборотный капитал.Слудующий кредит хочет потратить на завоз продуктов питания.
texts.en:
Ibrohim B. is a 55 year old man; he sells food and household products. His sales location is at the market in the city of Khujand. He travels for the products himself to the Istaravshan wholesale market. When Ibrohim is absent his son takes over; he is in the photo. This is the sixth year that B. has been a borrower; he uses the loan to increase his turnover. At the beginning his product assortment was not very big, but gradually, thanks to loans he has been able to grow his working capital. He would like to use his next loan to purchase food products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Carmelita is married and has five grown children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, selling homemade cakes to the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from this work.

In 2008, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business.

This loan will be the second loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jimmy's Group

texts.en: K. Jimmy is a hardworking and dependable 36-year-old man with a business selling produce for 15 years. He is a married man with three children all in school. He also cares for five dependants. His business is located in Mubende Town Council and being honest has won him good customers. Jimmy plans to build a warehouse for his business as well as build a second home that will be rented out for money. At the moment, Jimmy is making monthly profits of 220,000 and he hopes to increase it with future investments. For Jimmy, his loans have always helped him boost his business and enlarge his capital base, hence making more profits. He needs a loan so that he can buy more beans and maize to sell. Jimmy is the leader of the Mukisa group in Mubende.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Mirdjamol

texts.en:
M. Mirdjamol and his family have always been dedicated to agriculture. Mirdjamol is 44 years old, married and has 3 children. He has always been focused on making the land produce. His loans have generally been spent on the supplies necessary to obtain good production. In the future, Mirdjamol expects to have his own working capital which will allow him to cover his costs and buy more land so he can increase production and grow as a farmer. Currently he needs a loan of 4000 Somoni to continue purchasing farming supplies for his crop. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
45-year old, Danilo J. is a rice farmer since he was a small kid. His parents taught him everything about rice , how to till and harvest the grains.   His wife Helen J. is also helping him in the farm. But because they are also having a sari-sari store business his wife is more focus on selling goods to help manage all expenses in their home.

Now, he needs a loan of Php 6,000. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, rice seeds, and chemicals. 

CEVI helps small business grow. They provide all their clients with not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds, and chemicals

loans.name: Aurenila

texts.en:
Aurenila is a 43 year old hog raiser. She is requesting to avail a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP11, 000 for the maintenance and growth of her livestock business. Aside from raising hogs, she is also into beauty service for 20 years as her alternative source of income.  Aurenila is grateful that knowing Kiva will give her a chance to improve her business.  

Aurenila is married to Alex Sr, a village councilor. They were blessed with three children: Chester, Cherry and Alex Jr. All of them are studying. She hopes someday they could finish a course in college for them to have a better future. She is a former domestic helper abroad that which, her experience abroad molded Aurenila to work harder and patient in every business undertakings to become successful.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 6 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijas, además tiene un carro que realiza transporte de pasajeros a distintos distritos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una congeladora.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de los Milagros (Lord of Miracles). Maria lives with a partner, is 37 years old and has 6 children. Maria has a restaurant in her home, she works at it every day with the help of her daughters. She also has a vehicle for the transport of passengers to the various districts. Maria needs a loan of 2000 Soles, money which she will invest in the purchase of a freezer. Maria dreams of her children being professionals and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer.

loans.name: Mehrez

texts.en: Mehrez is a 40-year-old married man and father of 3 children. He has been working as a farmer since 2000 and has 15 years of experience in this field. Today, Merhrez is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Here is M’Balu B., Fanta T. and Fatmata K.. They are small scale businesswomen in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. They formed themselves into a group of three which they named Tamarameh II, in order to solicit a group loan of Le 800,000 for each from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With this loan, they will be able to add value into their businesses, make more sales and earn more profit. Consequently, they will be in a better position to look after themselves and children. 

Their leader is M’Balu B.. M’Balu was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone but she now lives together with her husband and two children in Kabala town. M’Balu’s husband is a businessman and one of her children is in class III, the other is not of school going age. M’Balu is approximately twenty-eight years of age. She sells market food – pepper, groundnuts/peanuts and rice at Kabala main market. She has been in this business for more than five years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Sabina Asunción

texts.es:
Sabina Asunción V. de 44 años desde 1991 se recorre las calles desde muy temprano ofreciendo ropa de todos los estilos y golosinas. Este oficio lo aprendió de su madre y con él a sostenido a sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad. Su hija mayor es quien le ayuda en el negocio.

Ella lleva 14 créditos en Adim con los cuales se ayuda mucho y ha visto crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sabina Asunción V. is 44 years old. Since 1991, she has been selling candy and all styles of clothing as a street merchant. She learned this trade from her mother and has been able to support her 4 dependent children. Her eldest daughter helps her with the business.

Sabina has taken advantage of 14 previous loans with ADIM, which have helped her tremendously in growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & candy to sell

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es: El grupo “Amigas por Siempre” esta representado por el señora Tito y conformado por 12 miembros que van ingresando a un cuarto ciclo demostrando honestidad, gamas D. trabajar y mucho entusiasmo por salir adelante, muchos D. los que empezaron el grupo ya no están ya que a medida que pasan los ciclos se van seleccionando y quedan las más responsables, socias que ven la forma D. mejorar sus condiciones D. vida con el desarrollo D. la actividad que realizan, actividades que hoy por hoy se ven con mucha competencia, por lo que se ven en la necesidad D. realizar viajes al interior del país con su mercadería, como edredones, maletas, cosméticos y variedad D. perfumes, ropa, carne, pesticidas, chompas tejidas a mano, zapatillas deportivas y ropa en genera para tener mayor venta, lo que implica tener mayor capital D. trabajo, por ello las socias muestran mucho interés D. seguir trabajando con la institución, todo ello reconociendo que tras el tiempo transcurrido D. trabajo con nuestra institución la condición económica D. sus hogares va mejorando.
texts.en:
The “Amigas por Siempre” (Friends Forever) group is maD. up of 12 members, represented by Tito, who are in their fourth lending cycle having demonstrated honesty, willingness to work, and much enthusiasm to get ahead. Many of the original members of the group are no longer part of it since, as the cycles unfold, some are selected out and only the most responsible members remain; members who see the way to improve their lives through the activities they undertake. Presently, these activities face heavy competition which necesitates trips to the interior of the country with their merchandise such as comforters, luggage, cosmetics, a variety of perfumes, clothing, meat, pesticides, hand-knitted sweaters, athletic shoes, and clothing in general, to increase sales. This requires more working capital so the members are very interested in continuing to work with the institution since they believe that working with our institution over time leads to an improving economic condition at home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Marta Teresa

texts.es:
Marta Juárez es una señora que desde cuatro años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y de comida. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante ante esta crisis es por ello que no se da por vencida. En su negocio tiene de todas tallas en ropa y de de paltillos que le guste a la gente como menudo los domingos, tamales, carne asada y taquitos de varios guisos.
Como su negocio no esta en un local con techo cuando son las lluvias las lonas que ella tiene no cubren todo es por ello que quiere comprar unas buenas tablas para que este bien protegida y también comprar mercancía para que en esta temporada navideña no le falte nada
texts.en:
Marta Juárez has made a living for the past four years selling food and used clothing. She is a very hard-working woman with a strong desire to make headway despite hardships, which is why she'll never give up. Her business has all kinds of clothes and foods that people enjoy, like menudo on Sundays, tamales, carne asada and various kinds of taquitos. Because the business isn't covered with a roof, when it rains the canvas she has doesn't cover everything, which is why she wants to purchase some good boards so it's better protected. She also plans to buy some merchandise for the Christmas season so she doesn't lack anything her customers want.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and some boards to cover the business

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
La socia CARINA hace pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”  

Nuestra socia es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre y padre para su hijo. Su hijo se llama Marco tiene 8 años y estudia en el colegio “MADI” del distrito de San Jerónimo. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene un carro que hace el servicio  de transporte de carga pesada a la ciudad de Masuco del departamento de Madre de Dios. En el carro se traslada combustible este trabajo lo heredo de su padre Juan. Ella cuenta que empezó llevando la contabilidad  del negocio de su padre y aprendió como funciona el negocio y ahora tiene su propio carro. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su hijo. La socia requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
CARINA, 29, is a member of the "PROSPERIDAD" communal bank. She is a humble woman, who must be both mother and father to her 8-year-old son, Marco, who is enrolled in the "MADI" school in the San Jerónimo district of the imperial city of Cusco. She has a vehicle with which she offers heavy cargo tranportation to the city of Masuco in the Madre de Dios department. The vehicle transports fuel; she inherited this work from her father, Juan. She relates that she began keeping the books in her father's business and learned how the business operated. Now, she has her own vehicle. She has been in this line of work for several years now and she does quite well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising mother who sees that her son gets ahead in life. She needs financing for vehicle maintenance. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Mrs. Bhawani M. is a tailor in the town of Tangal in Lalitpur. She opened her tailoring shop 5 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies clothes, like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, long dresses, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. Bhawani took a 6-month training course in tailoring near her town.

She plans to use this loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. Her economic condition is very low to fulfill the basic needs of her family, so she need the loan to expand her business to earn more profit to fulfill her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Rot

texts.en: Mrs. Rot S. is 41 years old and she lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Bros Soth, is a duck breeder who can earn a small income to support his family. In her farming, Mrs. Rot S. faces a problem because her rice field has infertile soil so she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy ducklings and duck food. Mrs. Rot S. is a mother of four children who are all students in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, ducklings and duck food.

loans.name: Bhagbati

texts.en:
Bhagbati S. lives in Chetrapati, Kathmandu. Chetrapati is one of the busiest cities of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. Bhagbati Shresth lives with her mother-in-law, husband, one son and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Prachandra Bahadhur S., works in a government office. Both her son and daughter are studying as well as working.

Mrs. Bhagbati S. opened her photo studio and watch shop more than five years ago. She employs two workers in her shop where she sells different brands of watches. She opened her shop to upgrade the living standard of her family. In addition, she wants to be independent and she doesn’t like to ask for money from her husband.

Now, Mrs. Bhagbati S. is requesting an Rs 20,000 loan to buy different varieties and brands of watches.

loans.use: To buy more watches for her store

loans.name: Nestor Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Néstor Antonio M. Z., labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres  hijos a su cargo y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento y mano de obra para reforzar una de las paredes de su casa de habitación.
Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Nestor dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr Nestor Antonio M. Z. works as a hygienist in the Mercado Oriental de Managua. He is married and has three school-aged children. During the last four years, he has worked with four loans through CEPRODEL, and in this time period he has invested the credits in the improvement of his home. He has been an excellent client. Currently, he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, and manual labor to reinforce one of the walls of his house. All of this is for the purpose of providing greater security and a better quality of life to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his house

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Lita M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos descartables como vasos, platos, cubiertos y bolsas plásticas siendo comercializadas todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

La señora Lita está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los productos descartables para continuar en la venta en el mercado.
texts.en:
Lita M. sells disposable items like: drinking glasses, plates, cutlery, plastic bags every day from very early in the morning until nightfall in Managua's Mayoreo market. Lita is asking for funds to buy disposable items to continue to sell them in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy disposable items.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel vive en la zona Río Seco  D, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Actualmente vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija.
 
Miguel trabaja en una empresa  en la que desempeña el cargo de lector de medidores domiciliarios de agua en determinados sectores de  la ciudad. 

El crédito lo destinará  al pago de pensiones de un instituto de formación profesional, ya que el quiere continuar con sus estudios superiores.
