Es el segundo  crédito con Impro y segundo vía kiva, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in the Río Seco D neighborhood of the city of El Alto. He currently lives in his parents' house, together with his wife and their little daughter. Miguel works for a company where he has the job of reading home water meters in specific parts of the city. The loan will be used to pay tuition for a professional training institute, since Miguel would like to continue his higher education. This is his second loan with Impro and his second through Kiva; the evaluation carried out shows that he is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying tuition at a professional training institute to continue his studies

loans.name: Cristo Es Vida Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “CRISTO ES VIDA”

Elsa es L. presidenta del grupo “CRISTO ES VIDA”, elL. es madre soltera D. 63 años D. edad vive con su único hijo, que aun depenD. D. elL. porque esta en rehabilitación por haber consumido drogas, y con su nieto que aun esta muy pequeño.

ElL. nos comenta que años atrás tenía una empresa D. snack pero al enfermarse gravemente D. los bronquios no pudo hacerse cargo D. su empresa, su ayudante encontró otro trabajo, elL. pidió el apoyo D. su familia pero nadie quería hacerse cargo, así que su pequeña empresa quebró.

Al recuperarse, tenia que comenzar nuevamente, ahora elL. se dedica a L. venta D. desayunos frente a un mercado en un kiosco donD. venD. leche D. soya, quinua, maca, etc. y panes con queso, palta, huevo etc., también estando en casa se dedica a L. venta D. tamales. El préstamo lo usará para invertir en su negocio.

ElL. planea tener una casa para que pueda darles un mejor hogar a su hijo y a su nieto.
También le gustaría viajar en especial conocer el Cuzco.
texts.en:
“CRISTO ES VIDA” (CHRIST IS LIFE) COMMUNAL BANK Elsa, 63, is the group president; she’s a single mother living with her only son, who is dependent on her because he is in drug rehab, and with her grandson, who is still very little. She tells us that years ago she had a snack business but, having become quite ill with bronchial problems, she could no longer look after her firm. Her assistant found a different job; Elsa asked for help from her family but nobody wanted to take charge, so her small firm failed. When she got her health back she had to start over again from scratch. Now, she sells prepared brekfasts in a food stand aross from a market; she sells soy milk, quinoa, maca (a radish-like root), etc. as well as bread with cheese, avocado, egg, etc. Since she’s home, she also sells tamales. She will use the funds to buy inredients for her meals. She plans to have her own house so that she can proviD. a better home for her son and grandson. She would also like to travel, especially to Cuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles V., 61 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by selling peanut butter, sandwiches and peanuts. She lives in Bless Brgy Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their ten adult children who are between 23 and 45 years old. Charles has been a member of NWTF - Project Dungganon since 1998. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business selling peanut butter, sandwiches and peanuts, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Charles is now borrowing 20,000 PHP so that she can continue selling peanut butter, sandwiches and peanuts. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF - Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Charles aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal working capital

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela L. is 45 and married with 2 children (ages 7 and 13).  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Sela has 2 years of experience in this business.  Sela needs a loan of WST $1250 to renew vehicle license.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Sela joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sela's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to renew vehicle license

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARTHA ES UNA CLIENTE QUE YA TRABAJO VARIAS SECUENCIAS  EN LA INSTITUCION, EN LOS ANTERIORES CREDITO DEMOSTRO RESPONSABILIDAD, ELLA SE DEDICA LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD, SU NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA 16 DE JULIO, UNA ZONA MUY COMERCIAL Y LE VA MUY BIEN EL LA VENTA DE SUS PRODUCTOS, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y SIEMPRE VIENDO EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR PRA SUSTIR SU PUESTO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Martha is a client that has worked several loan cycles with the institution. She has demonstrated responsibility with previous loans. She sells basic needs items, her business is located in the 16th of July area, a very busy commercial zone and her business selling these products is going very well. She is hardworking and always taking into account the well-bing of her family. She will use the loan as to buy merchandise at wholesale to resell in her business. She is very grateful to the organization for having confidence in her to give her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Peace Kwagala Margaret Group

texts.en: K. Margaret is 47 years old, married, and has eight children, all of whom are in school. For the past five years she has been operating a maize flour business. She is using her loan to purchase maize flour from manufacturers for resale. Margaret is purchasing in bulk for bigger profits. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to widen her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour from manufacturers for resale

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. IMELDA BEATRIZ, (LA UBICAMOS EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA CON LA MANO EN ALTO) TIENE 41 AÑOS, TIENE 2 HIJOS MAYORES D. EDAD, QUIENES SON SU APOYO Y ALICIENTE. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "LAS MARGARITAS" INTEGRADO POR 11 PERSONAS TRABAJADORAS Y RESPONSABLES RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. LA SRA. IMELDA BEATRIZ FUÉ ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑERAS COMO TESORERA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE CUATRO AÑOS INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO D. LA VENTA Y ALQUILER D. DISFRACES, EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN SU DOMICILIO, SE ANIMÓ A PONER SU NEGOCIO YA QUE TENÍA LA NECESIDAD D. APOYAR A SUS HIJOS EN SUS ESTUDIOS Y A LA VEZ ELLOS LA APOYAN EN EL NEGOCIO YA QUE ES SU ÚNICO INGRESO POR EL MOMENTO.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO IR AUMENTANDO POCO A POCO SU STOCK, SIENDO SU PROXIMA META AMPLIAR EL NEGOCIO, OFRECER MAS VARIEDAD D. DISFRACES TANTO PARA NIÑOS PEQUEÑOS, JOVENES Y ADULTOS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. DISFRACES PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Imelda Beatriz (who is raising her hand in the photo) is 41 years old and has 2 adult children who are both her helpers and her motivation. She is a member of “Las Margaritas” group, which is maD. up of 11 individuals who are hardworking and responsible residents of the district of Carabayllo. Four years ago Imelda Beatriz started her business selling and renting costumes. Her business is located in her home. She was inspired to set up her business because she needed to help her children with their studies, and they in turn are helping her with her business since it is her only source of income at the moment. Through her work Imelda Beatriz has managed to increase her stock little by little. Her next goal is to expand her business so she can offer more varieties of costumes for small children, young people, and adults. She will invest the loan she is requesting in purchasing costumes for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of costumes for her business

loans.name: Trinia

texts.es:
Trinia es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Trinia es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Trinia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza algunos días, porque viaja por su trabajo, durante este tiempo su tienda lo deja en administración de su mama, además Trinia compra cacao que luego vende a los proveedores. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de leche y arroz.
Trinia sueña con construir su casa de material noble pues ahora es rustico y salir adelante cambiando de negocio.
texts.en:
Trinia is a member of the communal bank "Bienestar." Trinia is married and has 3 children who are in school. Trinia has a store in her house where she sells groceries, an activity that she carries out some days, because she travels for her work. During this time, her mother runs the store. In addition, Trinia buys cocoa which she later sells to the vendors. She will invest this loan in the purchase of milk and rice. Trinia dreams of building her own home out of solid materials, since her current home is rustic. She also wants to succeed with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy milk and rice

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 43 years old and married to a business-woman. They have four children who are between 10 and 14 years old.

Emmanuel owns goats, and with a loan he wishes to buy more goats to sell. He says he is known for good customer service and rears high quality goats. Both of these qualities contribute to his large clientele.

He wishes to make enough profit in order to buy goats to sell in the neighboring markets.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran lives with her family in a big city called Multan. Multan is very famous for its special foods, its sweetmeats, and also for its warm weather. She has a small family consisting of three persons Ameeran, her husband, and a son.

Her son has studied till 5th standard but couldn’t study further due to financial constraints. He is a very hardworking child. He has started helping his parents in their milk-selling business at a very early age. Now he fully supports them with getting milk from the buffalo. He is now twenty-one years old. He also helps them in taking care of the business. Presently, they have three buffaloes and he takes care of them to make sure they are giving high quality and good quantity milk. 

Ameeran's home is medium-sized and she has fixed up a small area for the cattle. She has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her son. With the loan amount he will buy another buffalo and start his own milk-selling business. His mother is hopeful that he will be able to improve the family business by generating good income from it.

loans.use: Purchase a buffalo for her son's start-up dairy business

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 24 years old, married with one child, three years old.  Jean Claude is commonly known in the business of selling clothes and he has been in this business for about 5 years.  He keeps his business open from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Jean Claude needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Jean Claude will purchase different styles of clothes.  With these different styles of clothes for sale, Jean Claude will earn more profits and he really hopes that the profits he earns will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business till he becomes a wholesaler supplying the retailers of his business area.

loans.use: different styles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Sol Radiante De Huaycan Group

texts.es: Gloria tiene 47 años y vive en la zona c de Huaycán, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales aun tiene a cargo a 2. Hace 4 años vendía solo ropa para niños, desde ya hace 2 años y medio que trabaja con Edaprospo y su trabajo de venta de ropa ah crecido y ya vende hasta Edredones para camas, chompas, sabanas y demás, últimamente se ah comprado una computadora y piensa invertir el ultimo préstamo en mas mercadería para su negocio, aunque le encantaría poner su propia tienda de venta de ropa importada, no obstante es también la presidenta ,desde sus inicios, del grupo “Sol Radiante de Huaycán” el cual ya lleva constituido 2 años y medio  y lo conforman 8 amigas y vecinas con ganas de prosperar.
texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and lives in Zone C of Huaycán. She is married and has three children, two of whom depend on her for support. Four years ago she began selling children’s clothing but since she began working with Edaprospo two and a half years ago, her clothing business has grown and now she also sells duvets, sweaters, sheets, and other things. She recently bought a computer and plans to invest her latest loan into more merchandise for her business, although she would love to start her own imported clothing store. She also happens to be the president of the “Sol Radiante de Huaycán” group, and has been since it was formed two and a half years ago. It is made up of eight friends and neighbors with a desire to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno estudia y el otro es pequeño, Miriam se dedica a la venta de animales menores que compra en las diferentes ferias de la región y también le traen a su casa, los animales los comercializa en el mercado 12 de abril.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuys.
Los sueños de Miriam son tener una tienda de abarrotes, dar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the Wiracocha communal bank. In Quechua, Wiracocha means ‘Sun God’.

Miriam has a live-in partner and has 2 children, one of which is a student and the other is still little. She works selling young animals that she buys at different markets in the region and brings to her house. She later sells them at the ‘12 de abril’ market’.

Miriam needs a loan of 1000 PEN that she will invest in the purchase of guinea pigs. Her dreams are to have a grocery store and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Yenny Dolores

texts.es:
En la calle Medardo Cevallos, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dr. Medardo Cevallos.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Yenny, ella lleva ya diez años en el Banco Comunal y dice que está muy a gusto porque ha recibido muchos beneficios de parte de la Fundación Espoir para sacar su negocio adelante. Tiene 35 años, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años, los dos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en Quito en una empresa de seguridad.

Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda que se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Municipal, vende de todo en lo referente a víveres de consumo, además de eso entrega de forma personal especias molidas a algunos restaurantes de la ciudad, trabaja todos los días de lunes a sábados desde las 6am hasta las 16h00 y los domingos hasta las 12h00. Sus productos los compra en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es justamente para surtir su tienda.
 
Sus metas son seguir creciendo en su negocio y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Dr. Medardo Cevallos community bank meets every two week on Medardo Cevallos street, in the city of Portoviejo, known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds since colonial times. This is where we meet Yenny who has been a part of the community bank for 10 years. She says that she is happy because of all the benefits she has received for her business from Fundacion Espoir. 

She is 35, married and has two children ages 15 and 8 who both study. Her husband works in Quito for a security company. She has a store in the municipal market where she sells all types of food. She also sells custom ground spices to various restaurants around the city. She works from Monday  to Saturday from 6:00am to 4:00pm and Sundays until noon. 

She purchases her goods from a wholesaler in Portoviejo. This loan is to be able to stock her store. Her goals are to continue growing her business and to see her children as professionals.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, meat, dairy products and general groceries

loans.name: Chhany

texts.en:
Mr. Chhany Y. is 34 years old and his wife, Mrs. Saret Ouch, is 35 years old.  They live along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1993 and had two sons. Unfortunately, one of them died.  The other one is in school.  

Chhany is a policeman. His wife stays at home and does house work. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to renovate the house where he lives.   

Mr. Chhany Y. was not available for the picture, so his wife is pictured.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Aputu

texts.en: Aputu R.  is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. Aputu is 30 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marcial Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Marcial; el tiene 45 años de edad, soltero; el socio trabaja en el sector  público, y a la vez quiere invertir en un negocio de venta de mercadería referente a la navidad, como adornos,juguetes,entre otros mas es por eso que el viajo a Lima a cotizar todo esto.
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artículos navideños para poder ofrecer a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos.

 El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marcial Jesus belongs to the "Granito de Mostaza" ["Mustard Seed"] communal bank.  This communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is also in the province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Marcial is 45 years old, single, and works in the public sector.  At this time, he would like to invest in a business selling Christmas merchandise like ornaments, toys, and other items. Furthermore, he traveled to Lima in order to get a quote on all these things.

He is requesting this loan to buy Christmas items that he will offer for sale to his friends, relatives, and neighbors.

Marcial is grateful to those who, through this means, will contribute to his dream. He also promises to comply with his repayment schedule according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy Christmas items to sell to his friends, relatives, and neighbors

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio A. Sr. is from the village of Bugallon, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 52 years old. Dionicio is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Dionicio raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 50000 PHP every harvesting season (after four months).

In 2009, Dionicio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Dionicio is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops. This will be the third loan taken by Dionicio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Josphat Gichumu

texts.en:
Josphat Gichumu G. is 58 years old, married, and has three children.  He has been making metal products in Naivasha town for the last 14 years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of 25,000 KES in good time.  He plans to use this loan to buy raw materials for his metal workshop.

In the future, Josphat hopes to open a big workshop and be able to make his products in large quantities.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his metal workshop.

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira lives in Mian Channu, a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there with her family in a 3-room brick house for over 20 years. She has given birth to two sons. Both work in private firms for a reasonable income. They couldn’t find better jobs because of poor education which they couldn’t complete due to financial constraints. 

Nasira is a widow. Her husband died of a heart attack. It was a tragic time for her but she never gave up and faced the situation bravely. She started sewing work at her home.  Earlier, she received orders from her relatives but later on she started getting orders from her neighbors as well. She is good at her work and each of her customers acknowledges that. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her clothes-sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her complete orders in a shorter period of time and make more income every month. 
 
Nasira is hopeful that an investment will bring more profit for her and she will be able to marry off her elder son in the near future by saving money from her profit. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jacqueline es una mujer trabajadora, con deseo de superación, hoy en día trabaja en una empresa privada, y tiene su propio negocio en su casa de habitación alquiler de nintendo en donde lleva cuatro años en este negocio iniciando a través de su hermano quien vendió los equipos a bajos costos.
Atreves de los prestamos ha logrado invertir en equipos para su negocio en donde cada día atrae más su clientela. También ha logrado construir su casa toda de concreto, lo que desea hacer es un bajarete en frente para disminuir el sol caliente que le provoca mucho calor, a si como una mejora mas.
Lo que comprara dieciocho láminas de zinc, veinte dos perlines, golosos, cinco libras de soldadura, hierro, piedra, arena, cemento, para comenzar. Todo ha hecho posible gracias a los financiamientos que se le han otorgado por medio de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a hard working woman who wants to improve herself.  She is employed by a private firm and also has had her own home-based Nintendo games rentals for the last four years.  She started the business through her brother who sold her the equipment at low cost.

Through the loans she has invested in equipment for her business that attracts new customers every day.  She’s also managed to build her house entirely of concrete.  As an additional improvement she wants to build an overhang in front to lessen the heat of the sun.

She will buy 18 sheets of zinc, 22 gutters, screws, five pounds of solder, iron rods, stone, sand and cement to get started.  Everything has been possible thanks to the loans she’s been granted through Afodenic.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Joserecto

texts.en:
Joserecto P. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 50 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Joserecto owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joserecto also owns a sari-sari store that his wife manages. He says the store helps to provide for their daily needs.
Joserecto joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Joserecto is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Loise Wanjiru

texts.en:
Loise Wanjiru K. has practiced farming in Olkalou for the last 10 years. She is 43 years old, single and the mother of one child.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Loise hopes to diversify her sources of income and open a boutique, selling all types of clothes.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of an additional family member (her sister’s daughter). Grace has a business of selling clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Grace sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Grace has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through selling paint for houses. The main business challenges for Grace include seasonality and the ever-increasing price of clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler. Grace lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 42 years old.  She is a married woman and has 4 children. Her oldest child is 15 years old.

Roselyn is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 15 years. Roselyn also raises pigs in her backyard and manages a sari-sari store. She sells the pigs at the market.  Roselyn does her best to manage her time between her businesses and family. She hopes for her ventures to prosper.

Roselyn's loan will be used to purchase feeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina C. de 43 años es la propietaria de una tienda ubicada en el barrio Santo Domingo de Guzman  en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vende de contado y a crédito  productos de la canasta familiar al detalle, entre sus principales clientes que son las amas de casa y padres de familias del sector; con sus ventas de ranchos víveres,abarrotes,carnes, lácteos, refrescos, Marina satisface las necesidades de la comunidad, agregándole como valor el servicio especial que presta ella a cada cliente,  de acuerdo a sus características comunicacionales y adaptado a sus posibilidades financieras de compra;  Su negocio permanece surtido, pero como compra a crédito,  muchas veces no se gana los descuentos por hacerlo de contado,  ni las ofertas especiales a buen precio, que ofrecen sus proveedores  por compras en mayores volúmenes; esta es la razón por la cual se acercó Marina a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para  aplicar a su primer financiamiento,  con el cual comprará ranchos, víveres, carnes, enlatados, para ofrecerlos a sus clientes,  en estas épocas de parciales vacaciones, a consecuencia de la semana Mayor, o semana santa,  que se avecina  con todos sus rituales e incremento en las compras que hacen  las familias cuando reciben visitas y comparten sus alimentos mientras oran y disfrutan de los monumentos que exhiben las iglesias en sus ritos.
texts.en:
Marina C. is 43 years old.  She owns a store which is located in Santo Domingo de Guzman neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla, where she sells basic family shopping basket goods retail, for cash and also on credit.  Her main customers are housewives and parents in the area.  With her sales of food products, groceries, meat, dairy products and soft drinks, Marina fulfils the needs of her community.  She provides a special service to each and every customer in accordance with their communicativeness and their financial ability to shop.

Marina's business is well stocked but because she buys on credit, she often doesn't earn the discounts that she would if she paid cash.  Nor does she get to take advantage of the special, low-price offers that her suppliers provide to those who buy in larger volumes.  For this reason, Marina has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for her first loan which she will use to buy food products, meat and canned goods to sell to her customers during this vacation period of Semana Santa (Holy Week) which is approaching with all its rituals and the increase in shopping that it entails when families receive visitors and share their food while they pray and enjoy the special altars that churches display during their services.

loans.use: to buy food products, meat and canned goods in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 31 years old and married, with two children aged 9 and 11. She runs a supermarket where she sells items like water, juice, milk, breads, and eggs. Her business is well organized. She employs three people to help her. Alphonsine has 12 years of experience and her store is open from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Alphonsine has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more products to sell. She will invest the extra income into her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to sell.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Мунавар проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 56 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, юрист. По профессии  не работает. Она  занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Берет заказы у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Munavar lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 56 years old, married, and has four children. She has a law degree. She does not work in her profession.  She sews traditional dresses. She takes orders at home. She has been doing this work for more than twenty years. She is taking out a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: 46.thieu Duong Group

texts.en:
Dung is the group leader of the 9.1.46.Thieu Duong solidarity group, which consists of 7 members.   She is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.  

Dung works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  She has been involved in this business for 8 years.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

In 2010, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.   The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes to maintain a successful business and to remodel her house.  She hopes for her business to do well.

loans.use: buy baby livestock and fruit

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sandra; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de botica y también el negocio de un kiosco de golosinas en la estación de trenes en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, en la botica su esposo trabaja y en el kiosco trabaja la socia desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y juntos sacan adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere mejorar la atención de su botica y también quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar medicinas para la botica y para comprar algunas golosinas para el kiosco.
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the "Siempre Adelante" community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Sandra is 28 years old, married, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her pharmacy business.  She also has a candy kiosk in the train station in Ollantaytambo district.  Sandra's husband works in the pharmacy and she works in the candy kiosk, from 8.00am to 9.00pm.  Together they get their son ahead in life.

Sandra would like to improve her pharmacy business and also expand her candy kiosk.  She is requesting this loan to buy medicines for her pharmacy and some candies for her kiosk.

Sandra is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her pharmacy and some candies for her kiosk

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is a married woman with 1 child. She is 44 years old. Her husband is a farmer. 

Melva has had a business of selling herbal products and cosmetics for 11 years. She sells items like shampoo, lotion, liniment, and perfume to the people in her community. She also helps her husband sell his harvest at the market.

Melva is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as shampoo and lotion. In the future, she hopes to be successful and receive more blessings.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shampoo and lotion.
